loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub M. is a 50-year-old cattle breeder, married with three children. Teyyub has 14 years of experience in cattle breeding. He considers himself a successful businessman because during the lean years, he gained a number of permanent clients from the butcher shops, who always buy cattle from him. Teyyub has applied for a 500 AZN loan to purchase one milking cow and to start selling milk and milk products.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K. is currently in the business of selling various medications at her pharmacy and is requesting a loan to stock more medications to sell.  Susan is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a director general. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend her pharmacy floor.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more medications to sell

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham J. is a 38-year-old man who has sold confectionery and cookies in his own shop since 2009. He is married and has two children. His monthly income is about 500 AZN and he wishes to increase it to 700 AZN in the next six months. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more merchandise and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand his business

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette was born in 1981. She is married with three children and one dependent who is not a relative. Odette’s husband does not have any occupation which can make money for their family. That's the reason why Odette has to work hard so that she meets all the needs of her family. Odette owns a business selling various styles of clothes.

Odette is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing various styles of clothes to attract more customers. The increased business will help her to earn more profits which will allow her to buy a house.

loans.use: To expand a clothing business

loans.name: Luz De Los Cachorros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Luz de los Cachorros inicia su tercer ciclo con 12 socias.
Rosa es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, durante el tiempo que es socia aprendió a ser responsable y a ahorrar, Rosa es soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Rosa tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que esta ubicado cerca del Mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, Rosa solicita un préstamo de 600 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, gaseosas.
Uno de los hijos de Rosa ingreso a la Universidad y su deseo es que culmine sus estudios, y que sus demás hijos sean profesionales, también mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Luz de los Cachorros” is starting its third loan cycle with 12 members.

Rosa is the Communal Bank President. Throughout her time as a member, she has learned how to be responsible and establish some savings. Rosa is single and has six children, four of whom are in school. She manages a restaurant from a rented location near the Magdalena Market. Rosa works every day from morning to night with the help of her children. She is requesting a loan of 600 PEN to buy rice, sugar, and sodas.

One of Rosa’s children is about to enter the university, so she hopes they will all be able to finish their studies. She would like to see them become professionals and also hopes to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and sodas

loans.name: Wilson Hipolito

texts.es:
Wilson de 38 años, el es vendedor de refrescos y frutas como coco y sandias, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). 

Tuvo su negocio porque en el sector por donde vive no había un puesto de frutas,  comenzó a vender cocos, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo vender sandias y otras frutas, ahora se levanta a las 04h00am hasta las 15h00 todos los días. Vende cada coco a $ 0.60 y las sandias a $ 1.50 c/u, también vende refrescos naturales de sandias y cocos. 

Para poder continuar con mas clientela el necesita comprar con el préstamo cocos y sandias, en el futuro el quiere tener locales de frutas en todo el sector las Orquídeas.
texts.en:
Wilson is 38 years old and sells refreshments and fruits, such as coconuts and watermelons. He lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area with a decaying ecosystem.

He started this type of business because there were no other fruit stands where he lives. At first he sold coconuts, but with a little bit of effort, he began selling watermelons and other fruits. Now he wakes up at 4am and works until 3pm every day. He sells coconuts for $0.60/each and watermelons for $1.50/each. Wilson also sells natural beverages made from watermelons and coconuts.

In order to continue attracting more customers, Wilson will use his loan to buy more coconuts and watermelons. In the future, he hopes to set up fruit stands in every sector of Orquídeas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconuts & watermelons

loans.name: Tsogtgerel

texts.en:
Tsogtgerel L. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two daughters both go to the local secondary school. 

Tsogtgerel operates a wooden products trading business at the regional market in his province. He started this business in 1997 and has become very experienced. He purchased a new car and used it as a taxi in 2009. He is a hard-working and diligent person.  He hopes to one day establish his own car repair center. Tsogtgerel is requesting a 2,800,000 Mongolian tugrug loan to purchase raw materials used in his wooden products business.

loans.use: To purchase a raw materials

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia T. is from the village of Flores, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Arsenia raises pigs for fattening and sale. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Arsenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Arsenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn C. is a single woman who lives in Gingaw, Central Tabao Zone 4, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Analyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Analyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store, so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Analyn C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor vive en casa propia en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa. La actividad que realiza es la fabricación de muebles en un taller de carpintería que tiene instalado en su domicilio; con esta actividad, Victor cubre sus necesidades de subsistencia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar venesta (es una madera muy delgada) y terminar algunos muebles que le pidieron.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 y tiene un  historial de pagos  muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Victor lives in a house he owns in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz; he is separated from his wife.  His activity is manufacturing furniture in a carpentry workshop that he has installed in his home.  Victor supports himself with this enterprise.

The loan he requests is to buy venesta (a very thin wood) and to finish some furniture that has been ordered.  

He has been a client of Impro since 2009, and he has a good payment history that allows him to access new credit.

loans.use: To purchase venesta, a very thin wood, to finish some pending jobs for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Gedion Musee

texts.en:
Gedion M., aged 31, is married to Josephine, and together they have one child aged 9. His primary business is transporting people using motorcycles, a business popularly known as ‘’bodaboda’’ in Kenya.

Gedion and his wife are also farmers as their secondary business, so as to supplement the motorcycle transport business. His business of 2 years generates a profit of Kshs 5,000.

He was introduced to Kadet by the Credit officer in charge of Tala office. With the loan he has applied for he plans to repair and service his motorcycle. 

Gideon’s customers are well-served and contented by his comfortable transportation, and he plans that the extra money generated from the business will be used to improve his farming business and also buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa A. is married and has two children. Adwoa displays provisions on top of a table at Abura for sale. She has been in this business for six years. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. Adwoa plans to build a shop from her increased profit.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es:
Jeannette B. R. es una de las profesoras más queridas de la Palma en Puerto Jimenez, y sueña con poder instalar en su propio café internet.
En este momento ella necesita un préstamo de ₡300 000 (Trescientos mil colones) para pagar el arreglo de su computadora portátil y la compra de una impresora multifuncional, herramienta que necesita para trabajar  y darles un mejor servicio a sus estudiantes.
Además ella asegura que será también la primera compra para su café internet en el futuro.
Jeannette es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Raíces Capitales, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en:
Jeannette B. R. is one of the most highly respected teachers in La Palma in Puerto Jimenez. She dreams of starting her own Internet café.

At the moment, she needs a loan of 300,000 CRC in order to pay for repairs to her laptop computer and to purchase a multi-functional printer. She needs this equipment for her work so that she can provide better attention to her students. In addition, she says this first purchase will enable her to start her Internet café in the future.

Jeannette is a member of the Raíces Capitales Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the more than 100 member organizations that make up EDESA.

loans.use: Pay for computer repairs & purchase a printer

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
M. Margret lives in the Nabweru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Margret has a business of selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Margret sells her products at the market at retail prices.    

Margret has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes.  The main business challenges for Margret include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business.   

She lives in a home that she owns, but where she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Ana Maria; ella tiene 30 años. La socia es soltera y tiene 01 hija, ella estudió cosmetología, actualmente ella tiene un salón de belleza en el tercer paradero de ttio, la socia le puso de nombre Luanis como su pequeña hija; La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de secadoras profesionales para su salón de belleza, la socia también comprará líquidos para hacer los permanentes, tintes de colores y de este modo ella podrá dar mejor servicio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su salón de belleza.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Nuevo Amanecer Del Cusco community bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. The member is Ana Maria. She is 30 years old. The member is single and has one daughter. She studied cosmetology. Currently she has a beauty salon in the third suburb of Ttio. She gave it the name "Luanis" like her little daughter. The member wishes the loan in order to invest in the purchase of professional dryers for her salon. The member also will buy liquids for perms, dye and, in this manner, she will be able to give better service. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her beauty salon.

The member is happy with the loan granted and she promises to make her payments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 34 años, vive  con su esposo Charly (42), y tienen dos pequeños hijos con los que habitan  su casa que es propia.Después de  trabajar  por muchos años en sociedad con una amiga, decidió alquilarse su local e instalar su taller. Y desde hace dos años  su principal actividad es la confección de polos y blusas, los cuales ella misma realiza;  traza, corta y cose  con mucho esmero, pues sus diseños son muy originales y de buen acabado. Pero no  solo a ello se dedica esta emprendedora mujer, además  comercializa las prendas en su taller y  también lleva a las casas de sus amistades y vecinos, para vender todo. Con el tiempo ha logrado ser más conocida por  la calidad de prendas que fabrica, y para el futuro  piensa ampliar su tienda para  llegar a ser propietaria de una gran  tienda dedicada a este rubro.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete una vez más de pagar puntualmente, y además manifiesta sentirse contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, porque todos los integrantes son muy solidarios.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero del  préstamo en la compra de  telas delgadas y frescas, para confeccionar  polos para la época veraniega, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana, 34 years old, lives with her husband, Charly, and after working for many years in partnership with her friend she decided to rent a location to open her own workshop. For the last two years she has focused her work on manufacturing t-shirts, and blouses, which she personally makes. She transfers the patterns to fabric, cuts and sews while paying attention to detail. Her designs are very original and well-made. Ana is very enterprising. Not only does she make the clothing, but she also sells it out of her workshop and door-to-door, in order to sell all of it. Over time she has gradually become more well-known for the quality of the clothing she produces. 

Ana has expressed that she is glad to belong to her comunal bank because all of the members are very supportive. Looking to the future, she plans to expand her store and become owner of a large clothing store. This will be Ana's 16th loan with MFP. Once again she is committed to paying back the loan on time. Ana is requesting the loan so she can invest in new, think fabrics to make t-shirts for the summer season. In this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase fabric for clothing.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos pues ha sido una fuente alternativa para salir adelante con su negocio. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de generar ingresos a su familia ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, ella tiene que salir todos los días para ofrecer la variedad de productos a sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos y ropa en general. Desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y establecer otro medio de vida.
texts.en: Maria Guadalupe works selling general merchandise and has had this business for more than three years.  This is not the first time that she is requesting a loan because it has been an alternative means of getting ahead with her business.  She began this means of living due to the need to generate income for her family, as she has two young children.  She has to go out every day to sell a variety of products to her customers.  The purpose of the loan is for the purchase of raw material such as shoes, cosmetics, creams, treatments and general clothing.  She wants to improve her family’s living conditions and establish another means of living.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a 31-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15000. Rhodora is borrowing PHP 20000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rhodora aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund business operations of her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech was born in 1965. She is married to Mr. Vanna Naun (pictured with her).  They are farmers who rent a small piece of land where they can grow rice. They sell part of their rice yield and keep the rest to support their family.

They have some problems with the rice field because the soil is infertile, the field is far from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects.  To improve their rice production, Mrs. Pech would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. She is the mother of five children:  Three are laborers and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Adjoa Esi

texts.en: Adjoa Esi F., a divorced mother of one, has been involved in the production and sale of kenkey (a traditional dish made from ground cornmeal) for about 15 years now. She was educated through junior high school herself, but hopes that her child will attain a higher level of education. As a single parent, she is responsible for the well-being of her child. A loan from you will help her expand her kenkey business. Adjoa plans to use the profits from this loan to save towards the education of her child. In the picture, she is shown with the corn she uses to make the kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her business of making and selling kenkey, a traditional dish made from ground cornmeal

loans.name: Affoussatou

texts.en:
Affoussatou is fifty years old and lives in the Sémé-Podji district with her husband Taofick and their three children. All of their children are schooled.
For the past 10 years Affoussatou has sold home products from her stall in the Abattoir district of Cotonou. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase stock of home products in bulk

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 60 años, vive con su  esposo y su hijo cuya edad es D. 16 años, en su casa que es  propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado dedicada a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, pero con el paso D. los años ya su estado físico no le permite tener el mismo dinamismo, por ello ha optado vender productos D. primera necesidad, en un mercado que se encuentra ubicada dentro D. su zona. Es así que todos los días, trabaja en esta actividad, ofreciendo diversos productos que tiene mayor demanda D. consumo a sus clientes asimismo venD. papa recién cosechada y otros productos como el maíz, trigo, quinua, habas que cultiva con frecuencia. Pues su labor D. campo no lo ha dejado, ya que permanece más tiempo en su negocio, por ello contrata peones para que siembren y cosechen los productos que tiene. Por ahora su mayor prioridad es la D. implementar su tienda con diversos productos. Es su crédito número 10 con MFP, esta muy contenta D. ser parte integrante D. su banco comunal, pues con el  tiempo ha logrado aprender el significado del ahorro. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería y aumentar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Amelia is 60 years old and lives with her husband and 16 year old son in her own home.  She's been involved in agricultural and livestock work almost her whole life, but over time her physical state has affected her abilities, so she decided to sell basic needs products in the market within her zone.  She works daily selling the products that are in high demand from her customers.  She also sells freshly harvested potatoes and other products like corn, wheat, quinoa, and peas which she harvests often.  She has not given up her fields, but she has hired field hands to do the work now that she spends more time in her other business.  At the moment her store is her priority.

This will be her 10th loan through MFP and she is glad to be part of her communal bank because she has learned the significance of saving.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more merchandise and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar B. is from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 50 years old. Edgar is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Edgar owns and operates a general store. Edgar has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month.

In 2007, Edgar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Edgar is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as rice to expand his product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Edgar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as rice to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is 31 years old and still single. Marilou is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

Marilou is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Marilou has been growing tomatoes for four years.

In the future, Marilou hopes to produce more tomatoes to sell and earn income to support her parents and to save for her future. She believes that with the continuous support of the Kiva lenders, she can start another kind of business someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMIGOS DEL MILENIO”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Huanchac; en la provincia D. Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 53 años D. edad y La socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención y dirección D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia desea poder implementar su tienda D. abarrotes, ella quiere comprar los productos básicos y el pago D. las otras mercaderías, ella comprara fideos al por mayor, azúcar dos bolsas grandes, arroz tres bolsas, aceite en galón. La socia quiere poder seguir teniendo los productos en su tienda para que los clientes se sientan bien servidos. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y abastecer su tienda D. abarrotes.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores; a la atención  D. internet, contadora,  hay socios docentes, y una gran parte D. socias que se dedican a la venta D. comidas caseras.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y D. este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The loan recipient belongs to the village bank "Amigos del Milenio". She lives in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

The client is 53, married and has 3 children. She alternates between her activities at home and taking care of her grocery store. She wants to be able to stock her store by purchasing basic products and paying for other merchandise. She will buy noodles in bulk, sugar in large bags, three bags of rice and gallons of oil. She wants to be able to continue having products in her store so her customers feel well-served. She needs the loan to be able to buy merchandise and stock her grocery store.

The other members of the bank raise small animals, proviD. internet or accounting services, are teachers, and a large number sell homemaD. food.

The loan recipient values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that they gave her, and through this she will be able to improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments in the time stipulated.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Jerluette

texts.en:
Jerluette is 44 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Jerluette has requested a 18,000 PHP loan from Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.
Jerluette has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.ru:
Ашоту 61 год, он живет в селе Варсер, Севанского района вместе с женой. Дети взрослые и проживают отдельно со своими семьями. По профессии Ашот бухгалтер и он проработал по своей специальности в разный организациях в течение долгих лет. 
На данный момент Ашот работает в сельской администрации и параллельно занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Жена помогает Ашоту на ферме, благодаря чему хозяйство развивается и на сегодняшний день они разводят коров, овец и кур. Также они обрабатывают собственный участок земли. Полученную от сельскохозяйственной деятельности прибыль они используют для нужд своей семьи. 
Ашот обратился за кредитом на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения 15 голов баранов, что позволит увеличить доход семьи в будущем.
texts.en:
Ashot is 61 years old.  He and his wife live in the village of Varser in the Sevan region.  His children live with their own families.  By trade,  Ashot is a bookkeeper, and he has worked in his profession for many years for different organizations.  

At present, Ashot works in rural administration and, at the same time, farms.  His wife helps Ashot on the farm, and thanks to that the farm is expanding.  They raise cows, sheep and hens. They also work their own land.  They use the profit they get from farming for their family’s needs.

Ashot has asked for a loan of 1,000,000 drams to buy fifteen sheep which will  allow him to increase the family’s  income in the future.

loans.use: To buy fifteen sheep for his farm

loans.name: Alexander José

texts.es: Este cliente es trabajador activo de una empresa productora de azúcar en el cargo de estibador, desde hace más de cuatro años, actualmente está acompañado y es padre de un niño menor de edad, este crédito lo solicita para empezar a construir un pequeña vivienda, ya que donde vive es de los papa de ella y quiere vivir de manera independiente al ir construyendo poco a poco su casa, además agradece la importancia que tienen las instituciones de micro finanzas, para mejorar el nivel de vida de las familias.
texts.en: This client works for a company that produces sugar as a stevedore (docker).  He has been in the job for more than four years.  His marital status is currently "living with somebody" and he has one child.  He is requesting this loan so that he can start building a small home since he currently lives with his girlfriend's parents and would like to live independently, gradually building his own home.  He is grateful for the important role that microfinance institutions play in improving families' living standards.

loans.use: to buy building supplies such as corrugated metal sheets, sand and blocks

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 51-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. She and her husband run a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of rice to people in the local community.

Huong requires a loan to purchase rice and a range of different products including basic packaged foods and beverages to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and additional products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en: Aiza is 27 years old and married. She has three children, ages 9, 7 and 2. She is a farmer who tills her land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She grows rice crops then sells her harvest to rice traders. She earns about 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. Aiza is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to be stable.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nelva Marisol

texts.es: Nelva, de 38 años, está casada hace 15 años con Luis. Ambos tienen una hija, Guisel a la que quieren y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Ella es una mujer con iniciativa y empuje; hace tan solo 6 meses comenzó con la venta de petróleo y gasolina, en la calle principal de su localidad, donde alquiló un pequeño espacio. Según cuenta vende un promedio de S/. 480 nuevos soles como máximo, ya que no existen muchos grifos en la zona. Además de aprovechar sus tiempos libres en tejer pequeñas gorras de lana, que comercializa a los intermediarios que la visitan constantemente. Pero su principal objetivo es consolidar una empresa de trasportes, para ello está tramitando todos los papeles legales, además de comenzar con 6 carros, para seguir las rutas de la ciudad de Tarma-San Pedro de Cajas, San Pedro de Cajas-Las Vegas. Ya le falta muy poco para lograr su objetivo, pues con los 2 carros que posee y los que resta conseguir espera emprender este negocio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para concretar sus planes. Razón por la que promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Nelva de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 cilindros de golosina y petróleo, para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelva, 38, has been married to Luis for 15 years.  They have a daughter, Guisel, who they love and educate in their own home located in San Pedro de Cajas.  She is a woman with initiative and drive.  Just six months ago she started selling petroleum and gasoline on her town’s main street where she rented a small space.  According to what she relates, she sells an average of 480 new soles maximum because there aren’t many gas pumps in the area.  In addition, she takes advantage of her free time to knit small wool caps that she sells to middlemen who visit constantly.  But, her main objective is to set up a transportation firm and she’s in the process of making all the legal transactions necessary.  She wants to start with six cars to cover the Tarma-San Pedro de Cajas and the San Pedro de Cajas-Las Vegas routes.  She’s very close to reaching her objective because with the two cars she already has and the rest she expects to get she hopes to start this business.

She’s a member of the “Corazón de San Pedro” (San Pedro’s Heart) communal bank and this is her first MFP loan where she expects a small loan to realize her plans which is the reason behind her pledge to repay her installments punctually.  

If Nelva were to receive your support, she will use the requested funds to buy two gasoline cylinders and petroleum to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy two gas cylinders and petroleum.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz nació en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella vende golosinas en el centro educativo “Nueva I” desde hace un año y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Beatriz es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo galletas, chicles, caramelos y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco in Peru and is 29 years old. She lives with her partner and their two children in the same city where she was born. She has worked in this city selling lollies in the educational centre “Nueva I” for one year and it is going very well. The loan that Beatriz is applying for will be used to purchase products such as biscuits, gum and lollies, amongst others. 

The community bank “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” (Lord of Miracles of Urubamba) meet every month in the city of Urubamba in Cusco, Peru. Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial city because of its traditional festival, Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase products such as biscuits, gum and lollies, amongst others

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor y su pequeña hija Resalí, a la que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. A sus 15 años de edad, se convirtió en una madre muy responsable y trabajadora, ya que cargada a su niña en la espalda,  labra la tierra de sus vecinos, conjuntamente con su esposo, donde sumados le pagaban 20 soles diarios, de ahí que se propusieron en alquilar chacras y sembrar sus propios cultivos, se iniciaron sembrando papas y sus cosechas le resultaron muy bien, permitiéndole acumular dinero; que le permitió adquirir unos terrenos cultivables. Desde entonces siembra cada año papa y arveja, que le permiten tener buenas ganancias. Con los cuales compró 2 toros para el arado y 2 burros para carga. Ella y su esposo están muy contentos y felices, puesto que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura, ya que le genera dinero cada cosecha. Por ello está convencida de progresar mediante sus cultivos y, de ese modo ahorrar para adquirir más terrenos y evitar pagar el derecho de alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa cruz de patay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde promete cumplir cada una de las cuotas, asimismo tiene  anhelos de realizar sus ahorros en su banco comunal. Mercedes de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 36 years old, is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Hector and her little daughter Resali, whom she cares for and educates at home in the settlement of Patay.

At the age of 15, Mercedes became a very responsible and hard-working mother. Carrying her daughter on her back, she worked her nieghbor's land with her husband, and together they earned just 20 sols a day. 

Eventually, they decided to rent farm plots and plant their own crops. They began by sowing potatoes and their harvests have been very good, permitting them to accumulate money. This led them to acquire some cultivable lands. Since then, each year Mercedes sows potatoes and green peas, resulting in good earnings. With these, they bought two bulls to plough the land and 2 burros for carrying loads.

Mercedes and her husband are very content and happy now, since they like to work in agriculture and earn money for each harvest. They are convinced they can continue making money from their crops, and in this way, save to acquire more land and avoid having to rent farmland.

Mercedes belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Patay” communal bank and this is her 9th loan through MFP. She promises to comply with her payment schedule, and hopes to begin saving in her communal bank. Upon receiving the loan, Mercedes will buy 3 bags of green pea seeds and various sacks of natural fertilizer for the next sowing.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of green pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer for her farm fields.

loans.name: Carlos Hernando

texts.es: Carlos siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra y desde hace un tiempo tiene su propio cultivo de hortalizas y con este mantiene económicamente su familia. El quiere tener un cultivo mas grande para así mejorarle la calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa, por esto necesita comprar mas insumos agrícolas para poder comenzar su nuevo cultivo.
texts.en: Carlos has always made his living working the land, and for quite some time has had his own vegetable garden through which he supports his family financially. He would like to have a larger garden so he can improve the quality of life for his wife and family, so he needs to buy more agricultural supplies to get the garden started.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid es casada  y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 18 años en el municipio de Soledad. Allí se dedican al comercio de artesanías, como mochilas, manillas, aretes, pulsos, sandalias mallas, hamacas, y accesorios femeninos. Ingrid oriunda de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, cuando se vino al departamento del Atlántico, no quiso perder la conexión con la raíz artesanal de su pueblo y por eso decidió vender las artesanías producidas por su coterráneos. Con sus ingresos producto del negocio, contribuye con los gastos de su hogar y espera ofrecer cada día más bienestar a su familia. Su meta es lograr una educación universitaria de calidad para sus hijos y por eso trabaja fuertemente,  para lograr ahorros con los cuales pueda alcanzar este sueño. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará productos artesanales como mochilas, accesorios femeninos y calzado, para responder a encargos hechos por sus clientes,  a quienes está interesada en complacer pues ha logrado relaciones de fidelidad con ellos.
texts.en:
Ingrid is married and lives with her husband and three children, aged between 10 and 18, in the municipality of Soledad.  This is also where she works selling handicrafts such as backpacks, earrings, different kinds of bracelets, mesh sandals, hammocks and women's accessories.  Ingrid is originally from San Jacinto, in the Bolívar department.  When she came to the Atlántico department she didn't want to lose her connection with the artisanal background of her village, and so decided to sell the handcrafted products of her countrymen.

With her income from the business, she contributes to household expenses and hopes each day to improve her family's well-being.  Her goal is to achieve a quality university education for her children, and for this reason, she works extremely hard so as to be able to save money to achieve this dream.

Her Kiva loan is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will buy hand-crafted products such as backpacks, women's accessories, and shoes, to meet her customers' orders.  She wants to please her customers as she has achieved a relationship with them based on trust.

loans.use: to buy hand-crafted products such as backpacks, women's accessories, and shoes.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is 29 years old.  He is married and blessed with two children. He is a mixed (crop and livestock) farmer and has been doing this for three years. His farm is in a productive area, which is good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan.  He plans to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and feed for his cattle.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.

His dream is to educate his children.  He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Asunción se reúnen un grupo de mujeres con el propósito de obtener un mejor bienestar para sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas ellas. Ellas se encuentran actualmente en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación,  donde se puede destacar la responsabilidad de ellas en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen cada una de las que integrantes además de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la señora Venancia, la cual se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para empezar su jornada laboral. Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos. Ella misma se encarga de elaborar cada uno de los alimentos que vende. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues a los clientes les gustan sus platos. Ya que le está yendo muy bien ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y es por eso que solicita el crédito, para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y demás, los cuales son esenciales para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
In Asunción a group of women meet together with the common goal of improving their families' well-being through hard work. They are now in the 2nd phase of a  women's program,  where each one takes responsibility for different tasks and activities including repayment commitments.
Venancia tells a compelling story, rising early in the morning to start work as a food vendor. She prepares food items for sale and they are a big hit with customers.  For this reason she seeks credit and wants to invest in her growing business, to buy meat, chicken, greens, seasoning and other ingredients to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, greens, seasoning and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 39-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dreams are educating his children and buying a car. He has been in the motor vehicle spare parts business for the last 10 years and has been challenged by customers not paying on time plus price flactuation and inflation. His goal is to expand his business into a new market. John needs the loan to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to insure and license his taxi.

loans.name: Soboulde/jokker Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Joker Endam a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 15 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.


Madame Rougui est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 61 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle a aussi à sa charge deux autres membres de sa famille.

Elle vend du riz, du lait et du savon. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Son crédit va lui permettre d’acheter du riz, du lait et du savon pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari dans les charges domestiques.
texts.en:
The group Joker Endam was created on May 17, 2011 at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 15 women who all live in the same village and practice small trade.

Mrs. Rougui is the head of the group. She is 61 years old, married and the mother of five children. She also looks after two other family members.

Mrs. Rougui sells rice, milk and soap, an activity that she has been practicing for several years.

Her loan will allow her to buy rice, milk and soap for resale, and she will use the profits to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, milk and soap for resale

loans.name: Baasan

texts.en: Baasan is 54 years old and lives with her five children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. Four kids are employed, and one is a college student. She started her grocery retailing business in 1996 by opening a small shop. Her shop is well known in the neighborhood. Now that her kids are grown up, she wishes to expand her business by broadening her product range. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I never had an opportunity to expand my business.  Now that I have, I don't want to lose this opportunity." She is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en: Muhannad, a 24-year-old hardworking young man, is single and living with his family. He started his own business at a young age, tailoring and sewing at home. He started by buying one sewing machine and some fabric and began working at home. Now Muhannad has applied for a loan to buy more fabric and material needed to continue tailoring and making clothes. He hopes to open his own workshop one day, so he can employ people – especially those who are in need of work.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material needed to continue tailoring and making clothes

loans.name: Savoeut's Group

texts.en:
Savoeut is 50 years old, married and has five children. All of her children work at the family's farm while still in school. Like other villagers near the mountainous area of the Ratanak Mondul district, Savoeut plants maize and cassava as her main income source. She has been in this business for more than ten years. 
Savoeut received a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund eight years ago. The loan helped her regularly afford sufficient food for her large family and enabled her to send her children to school. She completely repaid the loan to VisionFund. Now she is requesting another loan with her group members who also have been with VisionFund from two to five years. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her plantation. Savoeut hopes this loan will enable her to grow a healthy crop, increase her business and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her plantation.

loans.name: Jocylin

texts.en:
Jocylin is a married woman and has four children. Of which two of them are still attending school. Her way of earning is through raising and selling of hogs.
 
 Almost 5 years now, that she has been engaged in hog raising  livelihood. Jocylin would like to raise quality hogs but the main challenge is the lack of capital. 

She  would like to boost her earnings by raising  more quality hogs and having sufficient supply of feeds, as well. That is why she join CEVI to access financial services.
 Jocylin has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. 

In the future, Jocylin  is looking forward to have a stable source and extend thanks for the support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on agriculture.

loans.name: Essi Sanno

texts.en:
Essi Sanno A. was born in Lomé on August 1, 1976. She is single with no children, and she has not had the opportunity to finish her secondary education. Neither did she learn a trade, so she had to go live with her aunt, who is a merchant with a boutique where Essi worked. That is where she developed an interest in the business of building and construction materials. She decided on her own to start her own business. But with her very limited financial means, this has not been easy at all. So she got an initial loan to get things started. This very energetic young woman now manages her own shop with a discipline worthy of a highly experience business woman.

Having an ever-increasing and demanding customer base, she is requesting a new loan of $1,200. This new financing will allow her to establish a stock of hardware in order to meet the expectations of her customers on a timely basis. Given her experience in this field of endeavor, this young woman deserves financial support, which will make her business even more worthwhile.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Essi Sanno A. est née le 1er août 1976 à Lomé. Célibataire sans enfant, elle n’a pas eu la chance de terminer ses études secondaires. N’ayant également appris aucun métier, elle a dû se réfugier auprès de sa tante commerçante pour l’aider dans sa boutique. C’est là où elle prit goût du commerce de matériaux de construction et décida elle-même de monter son propre affaire. Cela n’a pas été du tout facile compte tenu de ses moyens financiers très limités. Elle a donc sollicité un premier crédit pour démarrer. Cette jeune femme très dynamique gère aujourd’hui sa propre boutique avec une rigueur digne d’une femme d’entreprise très expérimentée.

La clientèle devenant de plus en plus nombreuse et exigeante, elle sollicite encore un nouveau crédit de $1200. Ce nouveau financement va lui permettre de constituer un stock en matériaux de quincaillerie en vue de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle à temps. Avec l’expérience qu’elle acquis dans ce domaine, cette jeune femme mérite d’être soutenue financièrement afin de lui permettre de rentabiliser au mieux son activité.

loans.use: Selling hardware goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a new point of sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Mohammad Karim

texts.en: Mohammad Karim lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and married. He is a shopkeeper, and he has a shop for making sweets. He has a lot of experience in his job. He did this business for a long time in Iran and Pakistan. He has lots of workers in his shop. Now he wants to open another shop in another part of Kabul, so he wants to take an individual loan to purchase all of his supplies and expand his business. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To open a second shop

loans.name: Yous

texts.en: Mrs. Yous H., age 50, works with her husband on a plot of farmland growing rice, together earning around $3 each day. They have seven children, three who are employed, one of whom works as a tailor, and three who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a sewing machine for her daughter to better operate her business. A sewing machine will mechanize her operations and allow her to produce much more to meet customer demand and raise revenue.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
We find 19-year-old Luzgarda in the company of her adorable 3-month-old baby. She is a hard-working mother who, since she was 17 years old, worked several different jobs to save enough and realize her dream of starting her own business running a small grocery store, which at the beginning, she ran in a small area in the home of her loving mother, Peregrina. Now, after much effort and dedication, her little store has turned into one of the biggest and most visited of the small town of Santa Lucia.

The dream of this young mother is to one day own a chain of wholesale grocery distribution stores. For this reason, she also studies accounting and computer skills in an institution of higher learning in her town, so that in the future she may adequately administer her chain of stores. In this opportunity, Luzgarda resorts to your support and requests a loan with which she intends to increase the variety of her goods while supporting her young husband to finish his military career with the hope that they can one day enjoy an environment filled with love, unity and tranquility in their new home. Let’s support this young lady with great entrepreneurial spirit to continue harboring in her heart wishes of improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Luzgarda de 19 años de edad en compañía de su adorable bebé de tres meses. Ella es una laboriosa madre que desde la edad de 17 años trabajó en diferentes oficios para ahorrar lo suficiente con el sueño de emprender su negocio propio con una bodeguita de abarrotes, negocio que en principio funcionaba en un pequeño espacio del domicilio de su querida madre, Peregrina, ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación su pequeño centro de ventas se ha convertido en uno de los más grandes y concurridos de su pueblito Santa Lucia.El deseo de esta joven madre es poseer algún día una cadena de tiendas de distribución de abarrotes al por mayor, es por esa razón que también estudia “contabilidad y computación” en un instituto superior de su pueblo, para en un futuro administrar adecuadamente su cadena de tiendas; en esta oportunidad Luzgarda recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo con el que pretende aumentar la variedad de su mercadería y al mismo tiempo apoyar a su joven esposo a concluir su carrera militar a fin de que juntos puedan gozar de un ambiente de amor, unión y tranquilidad en su nuevo hogar.Apoyemos a esta joven con gran espíritu emprendedor a que siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: Increase the amount and variety of goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Emma Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. J. has ten years of experience in this business. She started up her business with little money, approximately sixty dollars that she reinvested depending on the circumstances of how her products were selling. Her customers are from the city with those among whom she has gained a reputation for the baby clothes she sells. In addition to people who come to shop over the weekend in the center of the city coming from the nearby cantons and hamlets. What drives her to continue day after day in the business is the ability to provide a better education for her two children so that they might have better opportunities in their lives. Mrs. J. has had four loans with Apoyo Integral. Her credit history is very good. Her investments are evident in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra J. tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio, comenzó su negocio con poco dinero aproximadamente sesenta dólares que fue reinvirtiendo nuevamente conforme fue vendiendo los productos, sus clientes son de la ciudad con los cuales se a dado a conocer pór la ropa para recién nacidos que vende, además de personas que vienen los fines de semana a comprar al centro de la ciudad provenientes de cantones y caseríos cercanos al lugar, lo que la impulsas a seguir día tras día en el negocio es el poder dar una mejor educación a sus dos hijos y a si que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en su vidas , la señora a tenido cuatro créditos con la institución, su historial crediticio es muy bueno ,sus inversiones son evidentes en el negocio.

loans.use: She will buy children's clothes --pajamas, blankets & indoor clothes, also women's clothes --skirts, blouses-- and men's clothes --pants, shirts and whatnot. - Comprara  ropa para niños pijamas  frazadas y ropa interior  además de ropa para mujer ,faldas  blusas y ropa para caballeros, pantalones  camisas y otros.

loans.name: Nevzija

texts.en: Nevzija was born in 1949 and she lives in Živinice. She has a husband who has been retired for 17 years. His pension is about US$ 225. They are doing agricultural work  and selling used clothes. This is her second loan at MCO WWI. Her first loan  was for US$ 450. She intends to use her second loan in the amount of US$ 925 for buying more clothes for re-sale  and buying some chickens. She thinks  that she will be able to improve  their monthly household income.

loans.use: Buying clothes and chickens

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Since he was a boy, Nicanor was always a working and responsible man. Since starting his family Nicanor has always tried to work hard so that his dear family will not face limitations and economic hardship. He is father to five children and their only source of income is his honorable job offering transportation services with his pedal-taxi. After having numerous problems, Nicanor and his wife mutually decided to separate. He feels very sad and depressed because he is not permitted to see his children and enjoy their love and company now that they live with their mother. Nevertheless, he works very hard in order to send his dear children what they need in order to have an education and the comfort they deserve. He is asking for your help in order to continue working for the well-being of his children. He is seeking a loan to use for repairs to and improvement of his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Desde muchacho el señor Nicanor siempre fue un hombre trabajador y responsable, desde que formó su familia constantemente trató de esforzarse para que sus seres queridos no pasen limitaciones y privaciones económicas, él es padre de 5 hijos y su única fuente de ingreso económico es su noble oficio de brindar servicios de movilidad en su pequeña herramienta de transporte (Triciclo).Nicanor después de tener innumerables problemas con su esposa ambos en mutuo acuerdo decidieron separarse, pero se siente muy triste y abatido porque no le permiten ver y disfrutar del cariño y compañía de sus pequeños, ya que viven con su madre y ella se opone rotundamente; sin embargo Nicanor se esfuerza enormemente para enviarles lo necesario a sus queridos hijos para que éstos puedan recibir la educación y bienestar que se merecen.En esta oportunidad solicita tu ayuda para seguir esforzándose por el bienestar de sus retoños y hace la petición de un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la reparación y mejoramiento de su herramienta de trabajo..

loans.use: Repairs to his humble work vehicle

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy E. is 41 years of age.  She is a widow with 3 children, and lives in Benin City where she sells provisions & foodstuffs. She learned the trade from her mother before she started her business in 1992. She needs a loan amount of $525 to buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale. She has been with LAPO for 5 years is a dedicated client.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Amina's Taifa Group

texts.en:
Amina is 24 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 20 and 19 years old. Amina owns a small cafe, a business she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 11:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $52 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Aisha, Zaituni, Jenifer, and Stela, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales, clothes sales, and grains wholesales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her cafe

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 30 year old father of 2. Rabih lives and works in southern Lebanon, in Saida, where he works painting furniture. This is the second time he is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Comité Primavera Group

texts.es:
The Primavera Committee is based in Capiata Kennedy, and city that is a few minutes away from the San Lorenzo Office which is the closest to the area. This group has been working as a Women's Committee for 1 year, and is now in its fourth program cycle. Each program cycle lasts 4 months, which is the maximum length of the women's loans. During each cycle, borrowers receive training from specially trainedadvisers. The Primavera group raises money through community activities in neighborhoods and other areas. The women work in diverse activities, including the sales of lotions and cosmetics. Some have small stores, while others sell clothing, fruit, cleaning products, food, etc.

These women have been able to succeed and grow with each loan that they have received. Among their most notable successes is the fact that some of those who were itinerant saleswomen now possess locals from which they run their businesses.

They are very organized and demanding of each other, having established their own internal regulations. They also show a high degree ofsolidarity, with some of the women tutoring the children of the other members in subjects which are particularly difficult, since many of them were not able to finish their primary or secondary education.

With the loans that they receive, these women will be able to make bulk purchases of additional merchandise for sale.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

El comité Primavera es de la zona de Capiatá Kennedy, una ciudad que queda a minutos de la oficina de San Lorenzo que es la más cercana a la zona. Este comité tiene un año de trabajar como Comité de Mujeres y ahora están en el cuarto ciclo del Programa. Cada ciclo del programa dura cuatro meses que es el periodo máximo de pago para estas señoras y durante estos ciclos ellas reciben capacitaciones de parte de asesores especialmente entrenados para dictarlas.

El grupo Primavera, realiza actividades comunitarias en sus barrios al igual que actividades extras para recaudar fondos para sus ahorros.

Se dedican a actividades diversas, entre ellas están algunas que venden cremas y cosméticos, otras posee despensas, otras venden ropas, frutas, productos de limpieza, venta de comidas, etc.

Estas señoras han logrado superarse y crecer con cada crédito recibido. Entre los logros más notables está que algunas que eran vendedoras ambulantes hoy día ya poseen un negocio fijo de venta.

Son muy organizadas y exigentes unas con otras, ellas poseen su propio reglamento interno. Además de todo esto, son muy solidarias entre sí, algunas de las señoras se dedican a enseñar a los hijos de las demás algunas materias de la escuela que son difíciles especialmente ya que no todas lograron culminar sus estudios primarios y secundarios.

Con el crédito que recibirán ellas podrán adquirir mercaderías para la venta en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables, cleaning products, and products for sale in stores such as dairy, meat, pastas, flour, and oil. Also perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their home located in Itapua Poty. He has just finished his studies and has obtained a degree in Agricultural Engineering thanks to the work and sacrifice of his parents. His is the owner of a gym and is also the founder of the Agrarian Extension group, which has been together for two years.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase more stationary bicycles and gym equipment, as he has many clients and he needs to better equip his gym in order to give his clients better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Hugo tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa propia que queda situada en Itapua Poty. El ya ha culminado sus estudios y ha obtenido el titulo de Ingeniero Agrónomo gracias al trabajo y sacrificio de sus padres. El es propietario de su gimnasio y aparte es funcionario de la Dirección de Extensión Agraria desde hace 2 años.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mas bicicletas estáticas y aparatos para su gimnasio, ya que cuenta con mucha clientela y necesita equipar más su local para poder brindarles un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase stationary bicycles and gym equipment

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is 29 years old and mother of one child. Her seven years old child is currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling groceries stuff like Onions, plantain, beans and groundnuts and drinks in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income and also to out ways her competitors activities  to support her family. Grace is a member of the group called Asempa Trust Group which literally means (Good News). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taking during their group meetings.

loans.use: She needs the loan to expand business to overcome competitors

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Ami A. manufactures palm oil and also sells firewood which is the major source of fuel for the fishmongers at Duakro near Elmina. Ami has received no formal education. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a security guard.

Ami has been selling firewood since 2004. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit for the oil production and firewood for re-sale to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit for the oil production and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., a 35-year-old widow without any children, lives in Peam Ta Ek Village in Kandal Province where, as  a garment factory worker, she must spend a great deal of money on transportation. In order to reduce her expenses, she is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To add the loan to her savings to buy a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Rashida Parveen Sakhe Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Rashida parveen baji is 20 years old and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan. Her husband, S. M., is a wood seller. Rashida baji has no children. She completed her education through 8th standard. She couldn’t complete her education because her parents arranged her marriage with S. M.. Rashida baji is a very talented lady who learned the art of knitting clothes from her mother. Now she knits clothes and helps her husband in improving the financial situation of her household. She is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three more members. Shahnaz baji requests a loan to buy a grinding machine in which she will grind flour and wheat to sell in markets. Shamim akhtar baji and Farida baji each request a loan to buy thread to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for wood-selling business

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed is a 71-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He has owned a grocery store and candy shop for eighteen years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order for him to pay his car maintenance. This is the first time that Abed has requested a loan.  

Abed is exceptional in his work because he has a special schedule; he opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening, as well as he has good relations with his clients. His clients are his neighbors and friends. 

In the beginning, when he first started his business, he faced some cash issues, but now it is not the case anymore. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store.

loans.use: Abed needs the loan to pay his car maintenance.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves tiene 59 años, acaba D. quedarse viuda, tiene 4 hijos, D. los cuales ahora vive con una D. sus hijas. Hace 5 meses murió su esposo, desD. entonces se encuentra muy triste, pero aún así continuó trabajando en sus campos, nos dijo con una leve sonrisa, por ello cuando llegó el momento D. regar su chacra D. zanahorias fue sin presagiar que sufriría una  caída que le provocó una fractura en el brazo derecho, desD. entonces tiene dificultades para realizar sus actividades, ahora depenD. D. su hija que se está haciendo cargo D. ella y D. sus cultivos. Nieves dedicó toda su vida a la agricultura, sembraba varias hectáreas D. hortalizas y después las transportaban a los mercados D. las ciudades aledañas. Esta actividad les ha sido muy rentable, ya que les permitió darles una educación a sus hijos, además a Nieves le agrada mucho la chacra, le ha dado muchas alegrías y ganancias que le han permitido vivir cómodamente, su única dificultad por le momento es no poder mover su brazo hasta que sane su hueso. Para Nieves este es el sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, tiempo en el cual ha venido pagando sus cuotas sin caer en morosidad. Solicita el dinero esta vez para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su chacra D. espinaca.
texts.en:
Nieves is 59 yeas old, and she is recently widowed. She has 4 children, who now live with one of her daughters. Her husband passed away 5 months ago, and since then she has been very sad yet she still has continued to work in her fields, she told us with a slight smile. When it was time to return to her small field of carrots without forewarning she suffered a fall that caused a fracture in her right arm, since then she has had difficulties performing her tasks and now depends on her daughter who is taking responsibility for Nieves and her crops. Nieves dedicated her entire life to agriculture; she planted numerous hectares of vegetables, and later would transport them to markets in nearby cities. This activity has been very profitable for Nieves, given that it has permitted her to proviD. her children with an education. In addition, Nieves enjoys her small farm a great deal, it has given much joy and profit that have permitted her to live comfortably. Her only difficulty at this moment is not being able to move her arm until her bone has healed. For Nieves this will be her sixth loan with the Microfinanzas Prisma bank, a time during which she has paid her quotas without ever having any delinquent payments. Nieves is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers for her small spinach plot.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Eben

texts.en:
Eben O. B. is married and has 2 children. He has received schooling through senior high. Eben sells groceries and other food supplies at Nyankumasi post office near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 4 years. His wife is a petty trader.

Eben uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Eben will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eben plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business selling groceries.

loans.use: purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand

loans.name: Vahob

texts.ru: Дехконов Вахоб  студент учиться на 3 курсе в экономическом факультете, ему 21 лет, еще не женат, живет с матерью  и  средним братом, старший брат живет в России и время от времени присылает деньги. Мать работает учительницей, отца нету. Он помогает матери, ухаживает за скотом и после откорма выводит на рынок на продажу коров. Братья присылают деньги на обучение, и на проживание. Он также ездил раньше в Россию, но мать отозвала его и больше не пустила , он решился заняться откормом скота, от этого бизнеса тоже есть хорошая прибыль. Он часто ездит в город на учебу и узнал об Микринвесте и о выгодном кредите, обратился и получил кредит, он также благодарен КИВА и Микроинвест за помощь.
texts.en:
Vahob D., 21, is a 3rd-year college student majoring in economics. He is not yet married and lives with his mother and a brother. Vahob's older brother is working in Russia and from time to time sends money to support his family. Vahob's mother is a school teacher. She has no husband. Before his mother forbade him, Vahob used to join his brothers on their money earning trips to Russia. Now, he raises cattle--a business that brings a decent profit. In the city where he goes to school, Vahob learned of the opportunity to apply for a KIVA loan. He will use the money to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 45-year-old engaged man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Ibrahim has been working as a furniture painter since 2002. He has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work and to save money for his wedding. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan.

Ibrahim is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Ibrahim chose  his business because of his experience, especially because he learned it when he was young.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase tools for his work and save money for his wedding.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 29 años, vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 3 años instaló una tienda en su propia casa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad y todo lo que necesiten sus vecinos y clientes, los que siempre acuden ella para satisfacer sus necesidades. Marleny y toda su familia participan en la atención de este negocio, que es uno de los pilares económicos del hogar. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposo, trabaja en las duras tareas del campo, por lo que para Marleny tener esta tienda, le ha permitido tener mayores ingresos económicos para seguir dándoles una buena educación a sus hijos. Para el futuro, Marleny y su familia están pensando en implementar otros productos, aparte de comestibles, a fin de seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de reincorporarse a su banco comunal, desea seguir trabajando en su grupo y por ese compromiso asume el cargo de tesorera en este ciclo de crédito. El dinero que ahora viene solicitando es para adquirir más mercadería y abastecer mejor su tienda; comprará fideos, menestras y también útiles de escritorio para la época escolar.
texts.en:
Marleny is 29 years old, and lives in her own house with her husband and three children. Three years ago she set up a store in her house where she sells basic goods, and all of the items her neighbors and customers rely on her to supply. Marleny and her whole family participate in the business, which is one of the major sources of income for their household.
