In addition, together with her husband she works in the fields; also having this store allows her to earn extra money to provide her children with a good education.

In the future, Marleny and her family are considering adding products in addition to groceries, in order to meet her customers' needs.

This is Marleny's ninth loan with MFP and she is very happy to rejoin her community bank. She hopes to continue working with this group, and as such as taken on the role of treasurer for this credit cycle.

The money she is currently requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise to better stock her store with pasta and dried beans, as well as school supplies for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock merchandise

loans.name: Dinora Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Dinora ha sido una mujer esforzada desde muy joven ayudaba a sus padres para apoyarles. Su negocio es una pulpería,  que desde hace cinco años administra, también vende estufas que su esposo hace. Anteriormente vendía ropa pero tiene mejores ingreso con la venta ya que vende variedad. Tiene 64 años de edad, sus hijos son mayores de edad y residen independientes, ella habita en el barrio Hialeah en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo elabora estufas eléctricas lo cual es de gran apoyo. Este es el décimo crédito en Afodenic el cual va invertir en compras varias como: granos básicos, carnes y productos de limpiezas para incrementar el volumen de inventario, como sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dinora has been a hardworking woman since she was very young, helping out her parents in order to support them. Her business is a local general store that she has run for 5 years. She also sells electric stoves her husband makes. While she used to sell clothing, she makes more money now since she sells a larger variety of products. She is 64 years old with grown, independent sons, and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. This is her tenth loan with Afodenic which she will use to buy various goods such as basic grains, meats, and cleaning products to expand her inventory and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain, meat, and cleaning products for her store

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en:
Pakiza H. is a 55-year-old female baker. She lives and works in Agsu city and has engaged in her bread-making business for the last eight years. She is married and has five children.

It is very hard to keep such a big family and cover basic needs. Pakiza and her husband try very hard to cover all the needs of their children and especially care about education. Pakiza dreams of providing her children with the best quality education and most of her income she saves.

Pakiza applied for $1500 to improve her working conditions.

loans.use: To improve her working conditions

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma G. is from the village of Sibula. She is 39 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business since 1991 and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2004, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used in the same manner. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Vilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Juliann

texts.en: Juliann O. is married, 32 years old and has five children. She sells sarongs, a business she loves because she makes a lot of sales. Juliann has applied for this loan to buy more sarongs to sell, and wants to offer her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla has managed a general store for three years and she works hard for the progress of her business. Every day she wakes up early to prepare her store and check her merchandise. She has gained a lot of customers for her store to make it grow.

Perla is now seeking the assistance of Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as business capital that she can use for her store. Some of the things that she plans to buy are soft drinks, sack of rice, sugar, salt, and other commodities that are in demand by her customers. She believes that the amount will contribute a lot in making her business become more productive.

Perla is 42 years old and she is already a widow. She was left with her children and they are: Madelyn, 19 years old; Majelly, 16 years old; Eddie, 15 years old and Ken Jerico, 9 years old. Her eldest stopped her college studies but three of them are still studying. Perla is hoping that her children will someday finish their studies.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Harris is the leader of the Good Luck lending group. He is a high school graduate and the father of four children. His business activity is the sale of dry goods (onions, pepper, rice, oil, and so on): he has been doing this for the past five years.

He views illness as his greatest challenge.

He dreams of improving his business to the level of a shop, and eventually he hopes to enable himself to build a home for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for sale

loans.name: Ricarda Teodora

texts.es:
Doña Ricarda es originaria de Managua, Capital de Nicaragua; Ciudad céntrica para el comercio y de mucha conglomeración. 

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sobre todo ropa para damas y caballeros y en algunos casos vende ropa de niño, pero muy pocas veces, nos dice doña Ricarda, debido a que no tiene mucha demanda.

Ella desea poder poner un tramo en el mercado Roberto Huembes, donde su hermana está actualmente trabajando y cree lograrlo con la ayuda de los créditos que ADIM le vaya facilitando y conforme al crecimiento de estos.

Es su tercer ciclo en ADIM, pero tiene muy buenas expectativas puesto que nunca ha quedado mal con sus cuotas. Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa surtida para no tener que pedir crédito a su hermana y así ganar mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Ricarda is originally from Managua, the capital city of Nicaragua, a city central for trade and conglomeration.

She sells clothing mainly for men and women but occasionally for children, although very rarely, Ms. Ricarda tells us because there isn't a lot of demand for it.

She wants to have a stretch in the market "Roberto Huembes" where he sister works and she thinks that with the help of the loan from ADIM this will be possible and she can expand her business.

This is her third loan cycle with ADIM and she has very high expectations because she has never been late with her dues. She will invest the loan in buying a selection clothing so that she doesn't have to borrow from her sister and can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a selection of clothing for sale

loans.name: Levi's Group

texts.en:
M. Levi (see inset photo) is the leader of a lending group in Ibanda, a district in West Uganda, and is also a pastor spreading the word of God. He is 38 years old and married with four children, all in primary school. Levi has owned a retail shop for ten years in Kashare and works with his wife to ensure that there is business continuity. He makes 80,000 UGX in weekly profits due to his transparent business transactions. 

Levi needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for his shop to avoid shortages. His goal is to expand his retail shop as well as to have a happy and educated family.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his retail shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.pt:
Ana Maria nasceu na cidade central da Beira, província de Sofala, tem 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 2 e 16 anos. Os dois mais velhos estudam nas escolas publicas de boane. Concluiu o nível médio de Agronomia. Vive na casa própria com sua família (marido, filhos e um sobrinho).

Saiu de Sofala quando tinha 7 anos de idade juntamente com a sua família para cidade de Inhambane (província a 400 km a norte de Maputo) onde estudou ate 10 classe. Foi à razão que lhe valeu a transferência para boane a fim de continuar com os estudos no instituto de Agronomia. Mais tarde casou se e passou a viver definitivamente no distrito. O seu marido trabalha para uma empresa de instalações elétricas como eletricista. Ana Maria já tem 12 anos de experiência como docente na escola Primaria da vila de Boane, perto da sua residência, e recebe 6.000,00mt que aplica no sustento da familia.

Já teve empréstimos com o banco Procredito para iniciar com as obras de construção da sua casa e tendo reembolsado sem problemas. Através das amigas colegas que deram as informações comparativas entre a Hluvuku-Adsema e outras instituições concorrentes, preferiram aproximar e solicita 20.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, tijoleiras e louca de casa de banho).

Propõe se pagar o empréstimo sem problema para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com intuito de concluir a casa. A casa ainda de tijoleiras para o chão, pintura, acabamentos na cozinha e mais intervenções.
texts.en:
Ana Maria was born in the town of Beira, Sofala province, in Mozambique. She is 35, married and the mother of 3 children between 2 and 16 years old. The two older ones attend public school in Boane. Ana Maria went to school for Agronomy. She lives in her own house with her family (husband, children and a nephew). She left Sofala when she was 7 with her parents to the city of Inhambane (400km north of Maputo), where she finished 10th grade. She later moved to Boane to continue her studies at the Institute of Agronomy. She later got married and set residence in Boane. Her husband works as an electrician at a local company. Ana Maria has 12 years of experience teaching at the Boane primary school, and she makes 6.000,00MT (about U$220) per month, which is used to support her family. She has made loans with the Procredito bank before, in order to build her house, and paid them back without a problem. She is now asking for 20.000,00MT (U$725) to buy construction supplies (cement, bricks and bathroom tiles). She plans on paying the loan quickly so she can ask for other loans in order to finish her house, which still needs floor tiles, painting, and kitchen finishing, between other minor details.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, bricks, tiles)

loans.name: María Domitila

texts.es: María Domitila A. A. reside en el oriente del país en San Francisco Gotera municipio del departamento de Morazán. María tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con seis hijos todos aun  menores de edad. Para María ha sido un reto salir adelante con su extensa familia  la cual ha sacado adelante con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, María se dedica a la venta de variedad de pan de manera ambulante caminado casa por casa lo que ofrece, también vende ropa que comercializa con vecino y amigos, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en nueva mercadería.

loans.use: para invertir en nueva mercadería

loans.name: Las Novatas Group

texts.es:
4000,  4000 4000
Las novatas está conformado por Lidia María C., Sandra de los Ángeles R. e  Irene del Socorro C. C.. La señora C. de 42 años hace ocho años empezó haciendo comida que distribuía en empresas aledañas a su hogar y actualmente se introdujo a la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 8 años de trabajar con Adim y su sueño es tener un comedor.

La señora Sandra de los Ángeles R. hace nueve años empezó a vender comida derivada del cerdo y actualmente tiene un pequeño comedor con variedad de comidas caseras y típicas.  Mientras la joven  C. desde los 17 años vende visuteria y así se pudo costear el bachillerato.
texts.en:
The group “Las Novatas” consists of Lidia María C., Sandra de los Ángeles R., and Irene del Socorro C. C.. Sra. Lidia is 42 years old and has been selling food for 8 years. She prepares meals out of her home and delivers them to nearby businesses. She recently started selling clothing. Lidia has been a client of ADIM for eight years and she dreams of opening a diner.

Sra. Sandra has been selling food for nine years. She has a small diner where she offers a variety of homemade traditional dishes, mostly containing pork. Young Irene is only 17 years old and sells costume jewelry so that she can pay for her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret sells cooked foods and drinks to make a living in her community in Ughelli, Delta state. She sells for long hours to ensure that she is able to assist her husband to meet the basic needs of the family. She is 35 years old and married with six children. Her eldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is 1 year old. Her husband is a government worker. 

She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Edena

texts.en:
Mrs. Edena O. is from the village of Landing in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with one school-aged child. To make a living, Edena raises and sells pigs in the local community. 

Edena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edena is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP which will be used for additional capital of her existing business. This will be Edena's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beans in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and charcoal to sell. Jackline is 24 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has two children and they do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and charcoal

loans.name: Tsedendash

texts.en:
Tsedendash B. drives a minibus for tourists visiting his town and other customers that request bus services. Since he is one of the very few bus owners in town, he is usually busy with local requests for his bus services. With his profit, he supports his younger brother, paying his tuition for university in Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia) and his living expenses too. He hopes to fix up his old house and get ready for his marriage planned very soon.

Tsedendash is 24 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His mother is retired and now helps with her son's business. Tsedendash requests a loan to purchase paint and necessary accessories to fix up his minibus.

loans.use: To purchase paint and necessary accessories to fix up his bus

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maravillas, inicia su segundo ciclo con 17 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. panes, helados, verduras, ropa, calzados, comida, F., frutas, loceria, libros y abarrotes en general.

Como es el caso D. Evelin que es soltera, tiene 23 años y vive con sus padres, Evelin venD. salchipollos en L. puerta D. su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes. 

Mientras que Cenia es soltera, tiene 25 años, estudiante D. Administración, Cenia venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. L. región, actividad que realiza los días domingos.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. ropa variada, papa, aceite, mostaza, verduras, zapatos, F., frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son administrar su propio negocio, terminar su carrera, tener un restaurante, salir adelante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Maravillas" started its second loan cycle with 17 members. The members have a variety of businesses including the sale of bread, ice cream, vegetables, clothing, shoes, food, flowers, fruit, china, books and groceries in general. This is the case for Evelin, who is single, 23 years old and lives with her parents. Evelin sells salchipollos (a Peruvian chicken dish) from a door in her house; she carries out this activity every day in the afternoon. Cenia is single, 25 years old, and studies business administration. She sells clothing in the various markets in the region, an activity that she carries out each Sunday. The members need different amounts of loans, such as 300 (Peruvian) soles, 600 soles or 900 soles, making a total loan of 13,500 soles to their communal bank. These loans will be invested in the purchase of a variety of clothing, potatoes, cooking oil, mustard, vegetables, shoes, flowers and fruit. The members dream of running their own business, finishing their studies, having a restaurant, having success and seeing their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, potatoes, cooking oil, mustard, vegetables, shoes, flowers and fruit

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49 year-old widow and mother of 3 children. With the help of her first loan, she managed to purchase accessories and cosmetic products to expand her business. She's very thankful for the loan because it allowed her to increase her income and in 2009 she was able to open a clothing shop in her town.

Today, Mariam is requesting to borrow $600 to expand her inventory and offer a bigger choice of clothes and collections to her clients.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Donatila Reymunda

texts.es: Donatila Reymunda, es madre de 3 hijos, Abraham de 40 años, Uberlinda de 30 y Juanita de 24, todos le ayuda en las actividades del ordeño y  en las actividades agricola y ganadero, Donatila es dueña de una pequeña finca la cual presenta buenas caracteristicas técnica para el desarrollo del hato ganadero, cuenta con inventario propio. Esta solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC para la compra de terneros de desarrollo, con el objetivo de cuidarlos, engordarlos y cuando obtengan un buen peso venderlos para obterner mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor sueño es aumentar su inventario de ganado, pues es el patrimonio que podra heredarle a sus hijos , es muy conocida en la comarca por su liderazgo. Expresa que le gusta trabajar con los credito de institución de AFODENIC, por los interes bajos y la buena atencion que le brindan.
texts.en:
Donatila Reymunda is the mother of three children: Abraham (age 40), Uberlinda (age 30) and Juanita (age 24). All of them help with milking the cows and the other activities that pertain to farming and raising livestock. Donitila owns a small farm that has suitable conditions for raising the herd of cattle that she owns.

She is requesting her first loan from AFODENIC for purchasing calves to raise. Her objective is to care for and fatten them so that they can achieve a good weight for resale. This will help her obtain better earnings so that she can improve her family’s quality of life. Her greatest wish is to increase her herd so that she can leave it as an inheritance for her children. Donatila is well-known in the region for her leadership. She says that she enjoys working with the loans from AFODENIC because of the low interest rates and the good service that she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Luis esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños, es mecanico, se dedica a este rubro desde hace tres años, tiene muchos clientes ya que el Sr. Luis es muy bueno en su trabajo, él es una persona joven y muy responsable, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito para comprar las cosas que necesita para su taller como herramientas de trabajo, el vive en casa con sus padres y contribuye a la economia del hogar. Su sueño convertir su taller en uno más grande, ampliarlo para poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is married and has young children. He has been working as a mechanic for three years and has many customers. Luis is very good at his job and is a very responsible young person.

This is the first time he is requesting a loan. He will buy the things he needs for his shop, such as work tools. Luis lives at home with his parents and contributes to the household finances. He dreams of converting his shop into a much larger garage so that he can better serve his customers. Luis is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is married, has three children, and is 43 years old. His children attend school and this gives him joy as a father. He is a hard working and honest man and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

He sells motor spare parts at retail prices to his customers. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his immediate family. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Raniah

texts.en:
Raniah is a 34-year-old single mother of two children who got divorced a few years ago. Since then she has been doing her best to improve her living and financial situation, but more importantly to depend upon herself. 

She decided to open a child care in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, where she takes care of children when they come to spend the day, play, sleep, eat and do many activities. Raniah is very devoted to her work. She said that she loves the children as if they were her own kids. She decided to open her child care because she learned about it at school and used to work as a kindergarten teacher.

Today, for the first time, she asked for a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase educational toys for the children, as well as to add new decorations.  In the future, she plans to keep on improving her child care as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase educational toys for children.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. K., a 27-year-old mother of two young kids, is married to Soman, 30, who catches fish in the river to earn a living. K. has operated fish sale business door-to-door for the surrounding neighbors since 2000, earning a small income for serving the family. K. always finds it hard traveling, so she tried to save up her personal money for a vehicle, but her cash is not enough to buy her own vehicle. Therefore, she would like a loan to add her savings in order to buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel M. was born in 1957. He lives in Hovk village, Ijevan area, with his wife and a son.

For a long time Samvel has worked as a livestock expert in different villages. Now he has his own farm where he keeps cattle. His wife and son help him in this hard work and thereby support their family.

At the moment, Samvel has some newborn (2-3 months) calves and he needs a 300,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his calves

loans.name: 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hoa L. T. (43) is a 57 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa).

Hoa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To making a living, Hoa harvests and sells wild-caught fish in the local community. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500000 VND a month.

In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting her 4th loan, for 4248000 VND, which she will use to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. L. T. Dai (6) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. L. T. Oanh (113) is a 28 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2442600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3. N. T. Huyen (3) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4. N. T. Tiep (115) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2442600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. T. T. Thoa (61) is a 45 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Hoa L. T. (43) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 500,000 VND. Vào 2005, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Dai (6) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Oanh (113) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. T. Huyen (3) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. N. T. Tiep (115) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. T. T. Thoa (61) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Mabinty K. (pictured second from the right) is the leader of this group. This 45-year-old is a widow with three children. Mabinty has been a businesswoman for a year now. She makes and sells laundry soap. With her share of this loan, she will buy soap-making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, rubber bowls and hand gloves in order to produce a larger quantity of soap for sale.

These are members of the “God Bless Group" from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 800,000 leones each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soap-making materials like palm oil, caustic soda, rubber bowls and hand gloves

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
LA SRA MICAELA JADE TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE CUATRO HIJOS PEQUEÑOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LAS PRÓSPERAS DE CARABAYLLO", INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.

LA SRA. MICAELA JADE SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MAZAMORRA Y COMIDA; TODAS LAS TARDES SE UBICA EN LA PUERTA DE SU CASA CON SUS MESITAS Y ASÍ EMPIEZA A TRABAJAR. EMPEZÓ VENDIENDO UN POCO DE MAZAMORRA Y FUÉ SU MAMÁ QUIEN LA ANIMÓ. MOTIVÁNDOLA DE QUE DEBÍA TENER UN INGRESO EXTRA PARA APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA, HACE UN AÑO HA INCREMENTADO EL NEGOCIO Y AHORA VENDE COMIDAS.

CON SU TRABAJO PUEDE APOYAR A SU PAREEJA CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES ASÍ COMO GASTOS DEL COLEGIO DE SUS HIJOS.

SU PROXIMA META ES PONER UNA BODEGA MUY SURTIDA, CONSIDERA QUE SI SIGUE TRABAJANDO MUY DURO ES UNA META QUE NO DEMORARÁ MUCHO EN LOGRAR.

EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA Y COLOCACIÓN DE UN TOLDO QUE CUBRA EL ESPACIO DONDE SIRVE LA COMIDA Y MAZAMORRAS, ASÍ TAMBIÉN UNA PARTE LA DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA DE MESAS Y SILLAS PARA PODER ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES Y SE SIENTAN MAS CÓMODOS AL DEGUSTAR LOS EXQUISITOS POTAJES QUE ELLA PREPARA.
texts.en:
Sra. Micaela Jade is 29 years old and has four small children. She is part of the group “Las Prósperas de Carabayllo”, which consists of eight individuals who reside in the district of Carabayllo. Her fellow members elected her to be President of the group’s Board of Directors.

Sra. Micaela Jade sells “mazamorra” (corn porridge) and food every afternoon on the doorstep of her house where she has small tables set up for her business. She began selling porridge after her mother convinced her that she needed to earn extra income to help with the household expenses. Over the past year, she has increased her business and now sells other foods.

Through her work, she has been able to assist her husband with the family expenses and her children’s school expenses. Her new goal is to open a well-stocked grocery store. Micaela plans to continue working very hard, so she believes it will not take her long to achieve this goal.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase and install a canopy to cover the space where she serves food and porridge. Part of the money will be used to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can be more comfortable while enjoying the tasty food that she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and a canopy for the space used in operating a food business

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chiltoma se encuentra conformado por Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Matilde Patricia González R. y Consuelo del Carmen P. González tres mujeres de distintas edades pero con un mismo sueño, ser victoriosas en la vida.

Nubia, quien es la más joven de tan solo 24 años es la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, cuando decidió independizarse y tener una familia; hoy en día, su esposo es quien le ayuda en las actividades del negocio, ambos tienen un hijo al que quieren criar de la mejor manera posible y que llegue a ser alguien en la vida. Matilde, también se dedica a la venta de frutas, sin embargo ella lo hace en menor escala y de forma ambulante en el mercado municipal. Consuelo quien es la mayor del grupo, una mujer madura de 60 años ya, se dedica al destace de cerdos y la venta ambulante de su carne y derivados. Todas ellas utilizarán el crédito para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Chiltoma" is made up of Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Matilde Patricia González R. and Consuelo del Carmen P. González, three women of different ages but sharing the same dream: being victorious in life. Nubia, the youngest at only 24 years old, is the group's coordinator. Her work is selling fruit in the Masaya market. She started about 4 years ago, when she decided to become independent and start a family. Today, her husband helps her with her business activities. Together, they have a child whom they would like to raise in the best way possible, so that he can be someone in life. Matilda also works seilling fruit, but she does it on a smaller scale, as a mobile vendor in the municipal market. Consuelo is the oldest member of the group, a mature woman who has already reached the age of 60. Her work is butchering pigs and selling their meat and byproducts as a mobile vendor. All of them will use the loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah N. is a shopkeeper who sells retail items, as well as green groceries, within the Githurai area. The tenants of the area are her clients. She is married and has one son, who is one and a half years old.

Hannah joined KADET and will now be accessing her first loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She plans to use the money to increase her inventory of green grocery items such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and others items that are running low in her retail shop.

In the future, she would like to expand and run a hotel business on the side.

loans.use: Increase her stock of green grocery items for sale

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang S. is 55 years old, and her husband, Mr. Ton Nao, is 58 years old  (pictured together). They have been married since 1979 and have four children:  three sons and one daughter. One of the children is married and the others attend school (two are in university). The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

This couple is old, but they are still strong enough to work. Savang and her husband are farmers; they grow vegetables on their farmland in the village. The couple hopes to support their children with further education, so Savang is asking for her first loan of $500 to pay school fees for her children who are attending university.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy.
Gloria es conviviente, tiene 2 hijo que estudian, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde tiene una plastiqueria, en donde vende bolsas, papeles y productos descartables. Además Gloria vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de descartables.
Los sueños de Gloria son tener una tienda grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. She has a live-in partner and two children who are in school. Gloria has a post in the Playa Grau marketplace where she has a plastics shop where she sells bags, paper and disposable products. In addition Gloria sells clothing at the region's fairs. 

Gloria requires a loan of 2,000 soles in order to buy disposable items. Her dreams are to have a large store and that her children would be professionals.

loans.use: To purchase disposable items

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita tiene 60 años no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos con Fundación, pues ha demostrado ser una muy buena cliente. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, pues ha sido un gran apoyo para mantener a su familia. Yitza se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos  pues ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, calzado, ropa interior y ropa en general, cosméticos y otras cosas. Ella sabe que si compra al mayor le resulta mucho más favorable pues así paga menos por los productos que compre. Ella sueña con mantener su negocio activo y asegurar el pan de cada día.
texts.en: Yitza Margarita is 60 years old and it is not the first time she has been financed by Fundacion Leon; she has proven to be a good client.  She sells general merchandise and it has been great to support her family.  Yitza considers herself as a very responsible person and enjoys the interaction she has with customers that come to her for different products.  She will use this loan to purchae raw materials such as; bed sheets, shoes, intimate clothing, general clothing, cosmetics, and other things.  She knows that it if more favorable for her if she purchases in bulk, this way she pays less for products.  She dreams of keeping her business active and securing her daily bread.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Roy is in her mid-thirties.  For the past three years, she has had a business collecting pieces of wood, often in Iringa, which is in the south of Tanzania.  She then sells the wood to carpenters to be used in construction.  She works from 8 am to 5 pm and earns a weekly profit of about US$ 53.  

This is Roy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more wood for resale.  Roy is a member of 'Ustawi Group'.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the picture, Roy can be seen second from the right in the second row, wearing blue.

loans.use: To obtain more wood for resale

loans.name: Fantché

texts.fr: Marié et père d’un enfant, il a 29 ans. Il est né à atakpamé et habite à Lomé à adidogomé. Il exerce comme activité principale la réparation de portables mais associe la vente des accessoires de portables. Habituellement, il achète au grand marché de Lomé et dekon et exerce cette activité il y a de cela 7 ans. En plus le siège de son activité se trouve à côté de la douane adidogomé. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 4 cartons de batteries et 2 cartons de chargeur.
texts.en: Married and the father of one child, he is 29 years old. He is born in Atakpamé and lives in Lomé, in Adidogomé. He makes a living by repairing cells phones and also by selling phone accessories. Usually he stocks up at the big market of Lomé and Dekon; he has been in this business for 7 years. His shop is by the Customs office of Adidogomé. He is seeking this loan in order to purchase four boxes of batteries and two boxes of chargers.

loans.use: Purchasing cell phone accessories

loans.name: Benita Del Socorro

texts.es: Benita Del Socorro tiene 29 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido su principal fuente de ingreso. Benita alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de su establecimiento, por lo que tiene que realizar las actividades del hogar. Ella solicita el préstamo para implementar la compra de granos básicos, verduras, frutas, bolsas, cubiertos entre otras cosas necesarias para su negocio. Benita se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Benita Del Socorro is 29 years old and is a food vendor.  She has been doing this work, which is her main source of income, for more than 11 years.  Benita combines taking care of her household with her business.  She is seeking this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, bags, containers and other stock needed for her business.  She promises to meet her payments on time.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Dominica is the coordinator of her group, Unidos para Vencer 1 & 2 (Unite to Win Group). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She enjoys doing beauty salon work, and that why she operates a salon. This is her passion.

Dominica is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for ten years. She was starting to use her savings to buy equipment until she got her first loan. She plans to use this new loan to invest in her business by buying seven packs of hair and cosmetics products. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and she is dreaming of  having her own "ranchito" or little house. She says that her most difficult challenges are to settle her business and get better at managing to do everything she needs to do.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy hair and cosmetics products

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y su primer hija de 15 meses, se dedica a la panadería, tiene 30 años de edad, este negocio es herencia familiar, ella es panificadora y administra el negocio desde hace 2 años con un horario de lunes a sábado de 8:00am a 8:30 pm, este negocio es su fuerte y es de él de donde obtienen los ingresos para solventar las diferentes situaciones económicas.
Ella desea comprar harina, levadura, azúcar entre otros materiales que forman parte del proceso para la elaboración del pan, dicho préstamo le ayudara a mantener un buen inventario, en ocasiones a aumentar la producción  y tener mejores oportunidades de crecimiento.
Sueña con tener un inventario grande, propio, ampliar la panadería y darse a conocer en nuevos lugares para desarrollarse como una microempresaria.
texts.en:
Susana lives in San Miguel, in the region of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and their first daughter; she is 15 months old. She is a baker, she is 30 years old, and the business is a family inheritance. She has been the baker and administrator of the business for the past 2 years, working from Monday to Saturday, from 8am to 8:30pm. This business is her strength and it is through this business that she is able to obtain the income she needs to pay for her various expenses. 

She wishes to purchase flour, yeast, sugar and other ingredients that she needs to make bread. This loan will help her keep a well stocked inventory and it will allow her to increase productions during some occasions and to have greater business development opportunities.

She dreams of having a larger inventory of ingredients to expand her baker and to make her known to in new neighborhoods. She dreams of improving as a small business owner.

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast, and sugar.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús S. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas. Él vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, y así mismo vive junto a su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad, quien es la mayor inspiración de Manuel para salir adelante. Manuel se dedica a la comercialización de mochilas, cinchos, carteras y bolsos, su negocio se encuentra a las afueras del mercado regional de Sensuntepeque, en donde hay una gran afluencia de personas, quienes en su mayoría consumen sus productos. Manuel solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mochilas, y de esta manera aprovechar la temporada de inicio de clases, comprando mochilas y bolsones por mayor de manera que pueda vender a precios más bajo lo cual le permita contar con más clientes. De esta manera él espera mejorar en gran manera sus ganancias y poder vivir mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús S. C. is 34 years old and lives in Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.  He lives with his wife who works selling a variety of products.  He also lives with his 3 year-old daughter who is Manuel's biggest inspiration to get ahead in life.  Manuel sells backpacks, belts, wallets and bags.  His business is located on the edge of Sensuntepeque regional market which is a busy area with a lot of people who buy his products.

Manuel is requesting a loan so that he can buy more backpacks and, in this way, take advantage of the back-to-school season, buying backpacks and school bags wholesale so that he can sell them more cheaply which will attract him more customers.  In this way, he hopes to improve his profits and be able to live more comfortably together with his family.

loans.use: To buy backpacks to sell

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita G. Gutiérrez, vive en la Ribera Julián Grajales, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Audon Santos Santos, quienes todos su hijos ya están casados y tienen un nieto  a su responsabilidad  de nombre Royer Santos Estrada de diesi seis años de edad.

        El préstamo que  ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía  para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, donde lleva un años  y le va bien ya qué ha tenido buenos ingresos en  hogar.

       Para iniciar esta actividad  la animo su  nuera  ya que es un trabajo bueno en donde les va bien  y así con esta actividad tendría ingresos en su familia y gracias a dios comenta que sí le está funcionando.

       De la ganancia que le queda compra más mercancía que se le termina como son: azúcar,  aceite, galletas, entre otros cosas, y así agradar más su negocio que tanto la ha estado apoyando.
 
Su  deseo  es que su negocio aumente día a día  y de eso lograr a horrar para sostenerse más adelante.
texts.en:
Margarita G. Gutiérrez lives in Julián Grajales neighborhood, in the town of Copainala, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married to Audon Santos Santos and all her children are already married.  Margarita and her husband have one grandchild in their care: 6 year-old Royer Santos Estrada.

Margarita will invest her loan in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She has been in this business for a few years and it is doing well.  She has made good income for her household.

It was Margarita's daughter-in-law who encouraged her to start out in this business since it is good work and she told Margarita that she would make good income for her family through this business.  Margarita says that, thanks to God, her business is doing well.

Margarita uses the profits that she makes in her business to buy more merchandise when it runs out such as sugar, oil, cookies, etc.  In this way, she expands this business that has supported her so well.

Margarita's wish is for her business to grow day by day so that she can save in order to support herself in the future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo B. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Camelo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish like dilis and bolinao in the local community. Camelo has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Camelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Camelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Camelo is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Camelo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um S. is a 49 year-old man who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Um S. sells beds in and around his community. His product is made mostly from wood.  Usually, he can earn a daily income  of about $5.60 per day. His wife is a local rice farmer who makes a profit of approximately $1.60 each day. The couple has five children:  Three are single and the other two are married. 

Um S.'s income is low because his motorcycle is too small to carry beds.  That is why Um S. has decided to ask for a loan of $1200 to buy a trailer to connect to his motorcycle so that he can use it to transport more beds than before.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for his motorcycle to increase the number of beds he can transport.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is a single mother with two children. She makes a living by selling corn in Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast. 

To bolster her family’s income, she wants to grow her business. The loan will allow her to purchase more corn for sale. The extra income will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for sale

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
It's one year that Mary has been running a cereal shop in Kangemi market and her business is really doing well. She earns about KES. 99,000 in a month.  She is 34 years old, married to Francis, and a mother of two school-going children.    

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she learned about KADET LTD through a friend. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying back her first loan in good time.  She plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase 10 sacks of beans and five sacks of rice for sale. 

Mary intends to use the anticipated profit to save and build rental houses, and  to grow the business, and to open another cereal shop to meet the demand in the marketplace in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals, e.g., 10 sacks of beans and five sacks of rice.

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso. Esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de montañas que la hacen única y hermosa.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 48 de edad, es madre soltera de  4 hijos, todos son mayores  de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto que tiene 6 años y estudia en escuela. Lleva en el Banco Comunal dos años, es la presidenta y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.

Para salir adelante ahora que ya está sola y para darle una buena educación a su nieto ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, confitería, caramelos, sodas, aguas y otros productos elaborados. Trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es recorriendo la ciudad en un triciclo, ella busca lugares donde la gente se reúnen con mayor frecuencia para poder vender sus productos. Lleva haciendo este tipo de trabajos 7 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para surtir su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Damas De Progreso” communal bank meets in the San Cristóbal neighborhood of Portoviejo.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Valley because it’s surrounded by mountains, making it unique and beautiful.

Here we meet Bertha.  She is 48 years old and the single mother of 4 children, all adults and on their own.  Her six year old grandson lives with her and attends school.  She’s been with the communal bank for two years and is currently the president.  She likes it because her fellow members are very responsible.

In order to get ahead, and to be able to provide a good education for her grandson, she sells fruits, candy, caramels, sodas, water, and other products.  She works every day and sells by traveling around the city on a tricycle, looking for places where people gather often.  She’s been doing this for seven years.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her business.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to stock her business

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro A. is from the village of Tagodalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 48 years old. Alejandro is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Alejandro operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) Alejandro is just starting this business.

In 2011, Alejandro joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandro is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Alejandro from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Pete

texts.en:
Pete E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sagay, Camiguin Province. He is 32 years old. Pete is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pete owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, coffee, biscuits & beverages in the local community. Pete has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pete joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pete is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Pete from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Sagom

texts.en: Sagom, age 48, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of raising pigs to resell, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who produces wooden furniture and earns an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sagom and her husband have had these businesses. Sagom is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase pig food and wood to expand her husband’s and her businesses. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pig food and wood to improve the businesses.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house in Kompong Chhnang Province. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make extra income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and to weave baskets. Recently, Mrs. Som ran out of essential materials from her stock supply. She hopes to acquire more raw materials to continue making baskets. She is using her Kiva loan as an advance. Mrs. Som is a 30-year-old married woman blessed with two children who are attending the local school. The couple are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to continue making baskets for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena es una barranquillera que vive en el barrio Ciudadela Cuarta Etapa, donD. tiene desD. hace 12 años su negocio llamado “Sala D. Belleza Mayito”, ella es estilista profesional con muchos años D. experiencia emprendedora, regularmente en su negocio funciona mediante el sistema a domicilio con clientes radicadas en diferentes barrios D. Barranquilla y Soledad y como la mayor parte D. su vida la ha vivido en el barrio el lucero D. Barranquilla  donD. aún residen familiares, allí tiene su mayor clientela. Su hogar está compuesto por su cónyuge que es taxista independiente D. un vehículo D. su propiedad, el cual genera  importantes ingresos que apoyan el gasto familiar y un ahorro para eventualidades del vehículo. El Balance y el PyG.  del negocio D. Maria muestra la situación D. un clásico negocio D. servicios que funciona con un costo bajo,  y maneja  cuentas por cobrar debido a las ventas D. productos D. belleza, que promociona cuando asesora en imagen personal y profesional a sus clientes;  sus indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio y condiciones favorables para la inversión, que  realizará mediante su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , la cual se destinará a reparar el cromado D. las sillas, así como a invertir en insumos D. belleza y productos para la venta. Su meta es incrementar su capital D. trabajo con el fin D. ofrecerle a sus clientes un servicio confortable y generar mayores ingresos para aumentar el bienestar D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a working woman who lives in the Cuidadela Cuarta Etapa area, where she has worked for 12 years in a business called "Sala D. Belleza Mayito" (Beauty Salon).  She is a professional stylist with many years of entrepreneurial experience.  Regularly in her business she operates through a system at home with customers located in different neighborhoods of Barranquilla and Soledad.  For most of her life she has lived in the Barranquilla neighborhood where her family still lives and where she gets most of her customers.  

Her home is composed of her spouse who is an independent taxi driver with his own vehicle, which generates significant revenue that supports the family expenditure and savings for contingencies of the vehicle.  The balance sheet and the income of Maria's business shows the status of classic services that work at a low cost and manage accounts receivable due to beauty product sales, which she promotes when she provides advice on personal and professional image to customers.  

Their financial indicators show a stability in business and favorable conditions for investment, which she is going to achieve through this kiva loan.  This is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This loan will be used to repair the chrome of the chairs, as well as to invest in beauty supplies and products for sale.

Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to proviD. a comfortable service for her customers and generate more income to enhance the well-being of her home.

loans.use: to repair the chrome of the chairs, as well as to invest in beauty products for sale

loans.name: Delia Marina

texts.es:
En la ciudad Masaya en la comarca de Campusano, reside doña Delia Marina, quien labora para la escuela Camilo Zapata desde hace veinticuatro años, es maestra, casada, tiene dos hijo  menores, es por ellos que trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de doña  Delia es mejorar el techo de su casa ya que tiene una parte que se le pasa el agua,  es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito y poder comprar el zinc y madera, y poder  brindarles mayor seguridad a sus hijos y mejorar su  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
In Masaya city, in the Campusano region, lives Doña Delia Marina.  She has worked for the Camilo Zapata school for twenty-four years as a teacher.  She is married with two young children, and it is for them that she works hard to provide things that necessary.

One of the necessities for the family of Doña Delia is to improve the roof of her house as part of it leaks water.  This is why she approached the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan to be able to buy zinc and wood, and to provide greater security for her children and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy zinc and wood.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his son and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For six years he has operated a general store in front of his house.

Be would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and other products such as packaged foods to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers.

Be also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and basic household goods to stock his general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and is married with two children. She wants her youngest child to finish college through the income from her clothing and dressmaking materials business. Generally, she earns an average net income of P2,500 each month.  

Part of the income she earns is used to meet their daily needs, pay her child's school allowances and pay bills such as electricity. She is determined to increase her income to meet all the needs of her family. 

Josephine is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy new clothing materials such as pins, fabrics, threads and needles to sell in her stall. She will also buy feed for her duck raising business. She says that this loan, when approved, will be very helpful in developing her business more.

loans.use: to buy new stock of pins, fabrics, threads and needles to sell

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente es muy carismática, amable, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
La Señora María tiene 65 años, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 12 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, vive con dos nietos quienes trabajan y le hacen compañía, su esposo labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad. 

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, cría y vende vacas, borregos, cuyes, gallinas y lleva 10 años en este negocio.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es tener más vacas para vender la leche.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir [New Future] community bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish.  It has a cold climate and charismatic, friendly people who maintain their culture and tradition. They work raising animals and farming. 
 
María is 65 years old. She is married and has 12 children, all of whom are adults. She lives with two grandchildren who work and keep her company. Her husband works in agriculture and she owns the house she lives in. 

María works in agriculture. She raises and sells cows, sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She has done this for 10 years.

She has been a member of the community bank for 13 years. She is going to invest the money from the loan in buying pigs and chickens to continue her business.   

Her goal is to have more cows to sell milk.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Ezera

texts.en: Ezera, 60 years old, has 7 children. He sells foods such as maize, beans and groundnuts in the Kyenjojo food market. His business is profitable, generating about 200,000 UGX profit per week. Ezera has operated this business for over 30 years. This hardworking man is also involved in the sale of crude alcohol. Ezera plans to use this Kiva loan to buy more maize and groundnuts to resell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and groundnuts to resell

loans.name: Eudez

texts.es: Eudez, de 48 años. Esta casada con Eduardo, con quien tiene 8 hijos, a los que cría en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). A pesar de su avanzada edad, está trabajadora mujer sigue dedicándose a la agricultura. Ya tiene 21 años sembrando café, naranja y achiote. Lo que más le gusta de su labor son las épocas de cosecha, pues recoge con satisfacción los frutos que cuidó con mucho esmero. Ahora por ejemplo se está preparando para la cosecha de achiote, donde está segura obtendrá buenos resultados. Cuenta que el árbol de frutas que se encuentra detrás suyo, en la foto; es un patrón de semillas de mandarina, de ahí se sacan los nuevos núcleos para sembrar en gran escala. Además su esposo trabaja como peón en otros terrenos agrícolas obteniendo un dinero extra para su hogar. Pero como tiene muchos hijos; ella también trabaja en cada jornada que encuentra, ya que así puede obtener más ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá obtener al aliado incondicional para el progreso de sus cultivos. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Eudez de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de su terreno agrícola después la ardua cosecha.
texts.en:
Eudez, 48 years of age, is married to Eduardo; together they have 8 children that they raise in their own home located in the Kivinaki community (Peruvian central jungle).  Despite her advanced age, this hard-working woman continues to dedicate herself to farming.  She has already been planting coffee, oranges and achiote for 21 years.  

What she enjoys most about her work is the harvest season, as she gathers the fruits she tended to with great care.  Today, for example, she is preparing to harvest her achiote, where she is sure she will obtain a good result.   

She recounts that the fruit tree seen behind her in the picture yields mandarin seeds, from which she obtains new plantings to sow at a grand scale.  In addition, her husband works as a farm laborer on other lands, thereby obtaining additional income for the family.

However, as she has many children, she also works on every journey she finds herself on since this is how she will obtain greater profits.  She belongs to the “Flor de Almendra” (“Almond Flower”) cooperative bank; this is her second loan with MFP, where she is sure she’ll be able to obtain an unconditional alliance for the progress of her crops.

For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  Eudez, at receiving your support, will invest the requested funds into the purchase of tools to clear her farmland after the arduous harvest.

loans.use: buy tools for farming.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Ángel tiene 44 años de edad es soltero vive con el hijo y con los padres en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Descripción de la Ventanilla  VRC Luchar para triunfar, se encuentra ubicada en el sector la poza, perteneciente a la ciudadela 10 de noviembre  Cantón Ventanas, Los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a diferentes labores tanto Agrícola como comercial.

Miguel se dedica a la  agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao los productos los compra en Comercial Lola. Solicita el crédito para  comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea e incrementar la siembra, comprar más  semillas  y obtener más utilidades. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar los abonos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente son la competencia y las plagas.

El sueño de Miguel es poder apoyar a la familia económicamente para la medicina y alimentación y poderse comprar un carro para transportar los productos para poder venderlos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 44 years old.  He is single and lives with his son and parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchar para Triunfar' community bank is located in La Poza sector, in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank are engaged in different businesses, both agricultural and commercial.

Miguel is a farmer who grows corn, rice and cacao.  He buys his products in Comercial Lola.  Miguel is requesting this loan to buy manure, fertilizers and urea.  In order to increase the crops that he sows, he will also buy more seeds and thereby make more profits.

This loan will be a great help to Miguel as it will enable him to buy the manure he needs to keep his crops in good condition.  The challenges that he faces are competition and pests.

Miguel's dream is to be able to support his family financially, paying for medicines and food.  He would also like to be able to buy a car to transport his products and sell them.

In his free time, Miguel enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, urea and more seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia wants a loan to buy sugar and braids to resell. She is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in her own house in Masindi, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for the last three years and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar and braids to resell.

loans.name: Solomua

texts.en:
Solomua is 39 years old and is married with six children. Solomua owns and operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Solomua needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or $125 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2011, Solomua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Solomua's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 30 years old. She owns a business selling adult and children's clothes. She has one year's experience in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 7 pm every day except on Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her. Constance has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase clothes to sell. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and be able to pay for her master's education and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase adult and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucice

texts.en:
Lucice is a 34 years old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 9 children between the ages of 18 and 3.  5 of them go to school. 

Lucice runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for 4 years. She has no employees. Lucice heard about Finance Sudan through the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase more food items like milk, biscuits, fresh up, sweets, soap, and sugar. In additions to this business, Lucice has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Lucice would like to hope for increment in business size, to have a good stock in the shop.

Her major challenges include the competitors high cost of living and low income rate.   

Lucice says that she is happy for finance Sudan’s support especially for women, for helping them with capital to start up a small scale of business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like milk, biscuits, fresh up, sweets, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Decio

texts.es: Decio, de 32 años, es una joven amable, es soltera, pero no tiene hijos y todos los días sueña con poder surgir, salir adelante y poder brindar todo lo necesario para tener una buena calidad de vida a sus padres con quienes vive en casa propia. El trabajo de Decio, consiste en varias actividades, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ahí mismo funciona su disco bar, en donde ofrece a sus clientes buena música, bebidas heladas y aperitivos. Pero el fin de semana, por las noches vende comida en su casa. Por otro lado, también hace trabajos de corte de cabello y peinados para sus clientes. Todas estas actividades los hace sola y en un local muy bien acondicionado en su casa. Trabaja con mucha tenacidad desde hace cinco años. Tiene muchos planes en mente, pero por el momento solo desea mantener sus negocios. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contento de saber que le volverán a dar la confianza para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo, esta muy comprometida de cumplir con sus pagos de cuotas así como pago en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy buenos y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará bebidas para ampliar la variedad de productos que tiene, asimismo comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda, así como materiales para su peluquería e ingredientes para seguir preparando comida.
texts.en: Decio, age 32, is a very friendly and good woman. She is single and has no children. Every day she dreams about getting ahead and being able to provide everything necessary for a good quality of life to her parents, with whom she lives in their own house. Decio's work consists of various activities. She has a grocery store where she sells basic daily necessities.
