In the same place, she operates a disco bar, where she offers her clients good music, cold drinks and cocktails. On weekends in the evening, she sells food at his home. At the same time, she also offers haircuts and hairstyling services to her customers. She does all of these activities alone and in a very well-equipped space in her home. She has worked with great tenacity for five years. She has many plans in mind, but at present all she wants is to maintain her businesses. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that they will once again place confidence in her so she can increase her working capital. She is very committed to making her payments, just as she paid off her previous loans. She is very happy to belong to her communal bank, since all of the members are very good and show solidarity. With the amount she has requested, 2500 Peruvian soles, she will buy beverages to broaden the variety of products she offers, and she will also buy basic staple goods for her store, as well as materials for her hair salon and ingredients to continue preparing food.

loans.use: to buy daily staple goods, beverages, materials for his hair salon and supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 29-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is a mother of three children.

Rania is trading in clothes. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase clothes for this purpose.

Rania is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika S & C Co-Operative Society Group B

texts.en:
To Musa, a 60-year-old father of 6, the only thing that adds up when it comes to business is success. From his estimation, it's only hard work that at length culminates into achievement.

Musa owns a restaurant in Kampala. He has been in this business for close to 7 years now. He offers all delicacies, but it is mostly the local delicacies, like cooked bananas, stemmed green vegetables, ground nut sauce, etc. that most of his clients are really partial to.

Musa is hoping to begin with a clean slate on the threshold of next year. He envisions expansion. This, he says, has been long overdue due to the fact that his clientele has been increasing.

Musa says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more foods for his restaurant like bananas, cassava, maize flour, dried beans, ground nuts, rice, peas, yams, and sweet potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase more foods for his restaurant like bananas, cassava, maize flour, dried beans, ground nuts, rice, peas, yams, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Milinkou

texts.fr:
Milinkou est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Milinkou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des céréales pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Milinkou a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Milinkou voudrait diversifier ses marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Milinkou is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a driver, and has four children who all go to school. The eldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 8.

Milinkou has been working as a retail merchant since 2007. She sells grain cereals to all-comers from her home. She resupplies in Lome and works alone. At this time, her main problem is that she is out of stock.

Milinkou is requesting her second WAGES credit loan to buy grain, as she wants to reinvest in the business. In coming years, Milinkou would like to diversify her offerings. She stated that with the profits she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with two children and all go to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.She is a tailor and operates on a retail basis. She has been in this business for several years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy materials for clothes.Her major business challenges include seasonality of clothes. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria owns a small restaurant in her local community. Her great food keeps helps her maintain her neighbors and locals as frequent customers. She is a repeat Kiva borrower who is now seeking to further invest in her restaurant. With her first loan she was able to buy larger amounts of food and improve the quality of the dishes she prepared. She also made small changes to her restaurant like increasing the amounts of tables and chairs. Now she wants to make many more cosmetic changes and continue investing in furniture. She also would like to keep buying her ingredients at wholesale prices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant

loans.name: Kokou

texts.en:
Mr. Kokou S. was born in 1948 in Aklakou in the Lacs Prefecture. Married and the father of nine children, he is a retired teacher. His pension being too meager and irregular for the needs of his family, he took the initiative when he was still working to install a mill, which permits him to pay for family expenses. He hired a miller who he paid at the end of every month. Now retired, he works the mill himself. Honest and a good manager, he has easily reimbursed his previous credits.

Today, his clients being more and more numerous, he wishes to install another mill in the neighboring area that will bring him much more income for the good of his family. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan of $1200.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Kokou est né en 1948 à Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Marié et père de neuf (09) enfants, il est enseignant à la retraite. Sa pension étant très maigre et irrégulière pour tous les besoins de la famille, il prit l’initiative depuis qu’il est encore en fonction d’installer un moulin qui lui permet de subvenir aux dépenses familiales. C’est ainsi qu’il prit un meunier qu’il paie à chaque fin du mois. Maintenant à la retraite, il s’en occupe lui-même. Honnête et bon gestionnaire, il a su rembourser facilement les précédents crédits.

Aujourd’hui, ses clients étant de plus en plus nombreux, il souhaite installer un autre moulin dans le quartier voisin qui lui procurera beaucoup plus de revenu pour le bien de la famille. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $1200.

loans.use: Purchase of another mill

loans.name: Mamounata

texts.en:
Déné Mamounata is a single 44-year-old woman with 5 children. Her husband divorced her because she has had 5 daughters and no boys. The mentality and traditional practices have pushed her out of her home.

Déné is taking care courageously of her 5 daughters. She has decided to send all her 5 daughters to school in order to prove that they can do as well as boys. She is paying all their schools fees from her trade activities.

Deme’s challenge is to fight against poverty and against the retrograde thinking of her ethnic community about females. Let’s contribute to her tremendous challenge.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase more goods in order to benefit from bulk purchase price

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional cows to expand cattle sale business

loans.name: Ananias David Jossia

texts.pt:
Ananias David Jossias M. is 41 years old, father of 2. He was born in the city of Maputo, where he was raised with his 6 brothers. His family’s financial condition allowed him to study until the 9th grade. Since 2003, he has been supporting his family with a construction brick business in his back yard.

Ananias was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by friends. There is requested his first loan to invest in his brick business. Ananias’ work employs 3 part-time workers. With the income from the bricks, Ananias supports his family and saves. With the loan of 12.500.00MT, Ananias plans on increasing the volume of his stock of sand and cement. Ananias’ work has a positive impact in his community because it generates employment for 3 people, and brings construction materials closer to the residents of his neighborhood. In the future, Ananias hopes to open a construction material store and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: km 16 - Boane Cliente: Ananias David Jossias M. Sector de actividade: Fabrico de blocos Valor do empréstimo: 12.500,00MT (480.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de cimento e areia Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/12/2008

Ananias David jossias M., de 41 anos de idade, natural de Maputo,pai de dois filhos, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus pais, numa família de 6 irmãos, a situação financeira da família lhe permitiu estudar ate 9 classe. De 2003 ate então vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio pessoal possui um pequeno estaleiro de venda de blocos no quintal da sua casa, por indicações de alguns amigos do mesmo bairro soube da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA e aproximou-se da instituição onde solicitou um empréstimo para aplicação no seu negocio de fabrico de blocos.

A sua actividade esta sendo bem inserida na comunidade e que providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores envetuais. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta encargos familiares e uma parte para a poupança, com o empréstimo de 12.500.00Mtn pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria, tais como pó pedra e areia. A sua actividade tem maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego a 3 trabalhadores coloca material de construcao mais próximo da comunidade, contrubuindo deste modo para o desenvolvimento do seu bairro. No futuro gostaria de construir um armazém para a venda de material de construção e fazer crescer o seu negocio.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen I. is 43 years old, she has three children and she lives in Benin City. She sells local gins to the people living in her community. She needs a $425 loan to enable her to buy more local gin to sell; she has been in this business since 1987 and in LAPO for 6 years.

loans.use: Helen would like to buy more Local Gin to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Rosa sells in the central market in Leon, sandals for girls, boys and adults; shoes for women and men of all ages, etc.

She has been working in this business for 7 years and remembers she started with US$108 of her own money. She started with the necessity to not be walking every day, selling door to door, because she had a health problem. But this did not make her lose heart, she continues selling and is proud of having been able to make it to where she is right now.

Right now she is more financially stable and her children always have food for three meals a day. The impact of the aid received has been very good for her business and for herself as a person because she can see how others encourage her to go on.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Rosa vende en el mercado central de Leon, sandalias para niñas, niños y adultos, calzado para damas y caballero de todas las edades...etc.

Lleva 7 años de tener este negocio y recuerda que comenzo con 108 dólares, de dinero propio. Inicia con la necesidad de no estar caminando diario vendiendo de casa en casa, porque se le presentó un problema de salud...pero esto no la desanimó, ella sigue vendiendo y está orgullo se haber logrado llegar a donde esta ahora....

Se encuentra mas estable economicamente y sus hijos siempre tienen alimento para los 3 tiempos de comida. El impacto de la ayuda que ha recibido ha sido muy bueno para su negocio y para ella como persona porque mira que los demas la animan a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Working capital, buying merchandise (shoes). (Capital de Trabajo, compra de productos para la venta)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
In 1999, after having lived in common marriage with her partner, and had two little ones, her partner left them without offering anything to support their children. This is why Leticia decided to start selling shoes through catalogues so she could make money to support her children's expenses. Little by little she has become well known in her neighborhood because she goes door to door offering her products.

However, she has covered the whole neighborhood and she thinks it is necessary to expand even more to be able to get more customers. This is why Leticia is requesting a loan for US $925 to be able to buy a used 1997 van so she can distribute the shoes in towns and neighborhoods near her home. Leticia is determined to pay back the money in 6 months, because she is sure that with this expansion she will be able to increase her income and make sure her two children lack nothing. With your help Leticia will be able to support her two children without needing a man in the family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

En 1999 después de haber vivido en unión libre con su pareja y procreado a dos pequeños, su pareja la abandonó sin brindarle algún apoyo para la manutención se sus hijos. Fue por eso que Leticia decidió comenzar a vender zapatos por catálogo para poder sacar dinero para mantener los gastos de sus dos hijos. Poco a poco se a dado a conocer en su colonia puesto que va casa por casa ofreciendo los productos.

Sin embargo ya recorrió toda la colonia y cree que es necesario expandirse más para poder captar más clientes. Es por eso que Leticia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para poder comprar una camioneta usada de 1997 para poder distribuir los zapatos en los pueblos y colonias cercanas a su casa. Leticia está dispuesta a pagar el dinero en un plazo de 6 meses puesto que está segura que con esta expansión podrá obtener mayores ingresos y así procurar que a sus dos hijos no les falte nada. Con tu ayuda Leticia podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos sin necesitad de un hombre en su familia.

loans.use: Buying a van to sell her products (Comprar una camioneta para vender sus productos)

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phan Thị Q. is 42 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương. She is a TYM fund member for 5 years now. She has 3 children (2 are still attending school). Her main occupation is selling pork. Her husband buys the pigs and butchers them, she sells the pork. This is why they make more profit than their peers. Each month, on average, they make 200-250 USD. Since now is the year end (lunar calendar), the demand is rising. Mrs Q. thinks that they need to stock up to meet the demand because of the upcoming Tết Nguyên Đán festivities. After discussing with her husband, she has decided to apply for a loan of 575 USD to invest into their business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị Q., 42 tuổi, đang sống tại Quảng Xương, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị hiện vẫn đang học phổ thông. Công việc chính hiện nay của gia đình chị Q. là bán thịt lợn. Chồng mua lợn về giết mổ, vợ bán thịt, nên lợi nhuận cao hơn so với những người phải đi nhập hàng từ nơi khác về. Trung bình một tháng gia đình thu khoảng 200-250USD. Vào dịp cuối năm, nhu cầu thực phẩm của người dân tăng cao, chị Q. thấy cần phải tăng thêm lượng hàng phục vụ cho Tết nguyên đán. Chị đã bàn với chồng và Q.ết định vay 575USD đầu tư cho việc buôn bán.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Ternura Group

texts.en:
The community bank “Ternura” is new, and associates are starting their first loan cycle. The bank currently has 20 associates, and they joined the bank in order to have access to capital. At the community bank there are fewer requirements, fewer papers, and you can get your loan faster. In addition the community bank provides support and training on relevant subjects.

Associates of “Ternura” have a variety of different businesses. Some own restaurants, some sell vegetables, ice cream, or hamburgers. They all said that they are excited to be part of the community bank and happy with how the process has gone so far.

One client in particular is excited, Julia T. P., as she was elected the president of the community bank for the first loan cycle. Julia owns a restaurant. She has owned the restaurant for several years but now she will be able to expand. With her first loan she plans to buy more tables and chairs to serve more clients.

All of the associates will use their loans to invest in their businesses. They will buy things such as plates, silverware, meat, carrots, tomatoes and fish. Because each business is different people need different loan amounts. Loans range from 300 to 900 soles per person (3 soles = $1), reaching a total of 11,850 soles.

Their dreams are to buy land and own a home, as many currently rent their homes which is more expensive. In addition, they hope to continue developing their businesses and help their children become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses, such as buying plates, silverware, meat, carrots, tomatoes and fish.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick E. is 35 years old, married with 2 children. He provides transport services to people living in his community. He has been in this business since 2002. He lives in Benin City, Edo State Nigeria. He needs a loan amount of $600 which will enable him buy a new motorcycle. With a new motorcycle he will be able to serve his customers better. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy additional motorcycle

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween N. was married 27 years ago. She has nine children: three boys and six girls. All of her sons and her husband are butchers who operate separate meat shops. Parween sews sequins onto shawls and scarves. Three of her daughters and one son are married. Currently, the family needs a loan to invest in their meat business. In the picture Parween is with her family.

loans.use: Expand a butcher shop business

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru:
Abdukarim S. lives in the Varzob region. He is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children. Abdukarim has a small food store. Food sales are the sole sorce of income for his family. One of his children is a student. His wife takes care of the household. At this point, Abdukarim would like to increase the assortment of inventory in his store. That is why he needs additional funds. After advising with his family, he decided to apply for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Солехов Абдукарим житель района Варзоб .Возраст 47 лет , женат , имеет 2 детей. Абдукарим имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин. Торговля является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Сын клиента студент.Жена занимается ведением домашнего хозяйства. В данный момент клиент хочет пополнить ассортимент своего магазина.Для чего ему нужны деньги. Посоветовавшись с семьей Абдукарим решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To increase the inventory assortment

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom M. is a subsistence farmer in Sya Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, Mrs. Mom M. has a pig-breeding business which she managed to start thanks to a loan obtained from AMK. Her husband, Mr. Lim San, is a subsistence farmer and also works at a charcoal kiln for a small salary.

Mrs. Mom M. is 28 and the mother of five children, two of whom are attending state school while the remaining three stay at home because they are very young. Although the parents have various business activities, they still live in poor conditions and in a small house. Thus, Mrs. Mom M. decided to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace her current one. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to build a new house to replace her current one

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov S. is a 38-year-old married father with seven children. One child is employed in a garment factory and five others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Pov S. and his wife are shown in the picture.

Mr. Pov S. is a farmer in Prey Totoeng Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business, he is a teacher who receives $30 per month for his salary. His wife, Mrs. Saroeurn Riel, is a farmer and a grocer in the local village. Since her grocery business is going well, she wants to expand her business. Thus, her husband, Mr. Pov S., has decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods for his wife's inventory.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for his wife's inventory.

loans.name: Rodolfo Manuel

texts.es:
The client Rodolfo Manuel asks for a loan to improve his home. He wants to improve his kitchen and in that way improve his family's life. Over time and through loans, he has been building his home. It is built of concrete with a ceramic floor, zinc roof, living room, two bedrooms, electric power, and drinkable water, but the kitchen is not in good condition. He works in the business of servicing topographers. He counts on the support of his wife who helps him with the household expenses. This young man is a professional that started working when he was young. He is humble and has a spirit of personal improvement. In his past loans, he has had good credit history, the will to pay, and responsibly assumes his credit commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

El cliente Rodolfo Manuel solicita el crédito para mejora de su vivienda, requiere realizar mejoras en la cocina, de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar; con el tiempo y a través de créditos ha ido construyendo su vivenda, está construida de concreto, de piso de cerámica, techo de zinc, sala, dos dormitorio, energia electrica, agua potable, pero la cocina no esta bien acondicionada; labora en la empresa de servicio de topógraficos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que ayuda con los gastos del hogar, este joven es un profesional que desde pequeño inició su actividad laboral, humilde, con un alto espiritu de superación personal, en los créditos anteriores demostro moral crediticia, tiene voluntad de pago, asume con resposabilidad sus compromisos de crédito.

loans.use: Improvements to his Kitchen

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est gérante de cyber-café qui a plus de cinq d'expérience dans le secteur. C'est avec un crédit de imcec qu'elle a ouvert ce service qui lui permet aujourd'hui de faire des chiffres d'affaires de 20 000 fcfa. Elle vit avec son mari et gére bien sa famille. Le crédit lui a permis de réparer ses ordinateurs et d'aumenter sa clientéle
texts.en:
Fatoumata K. is an internet café manager who has over five years of experience in this sector. Using an IMCEC loan, she opened this service which now enables her to achieve sales figures of 20,000 francs CFA. She lives with her husband and does well running her family. The loan enabled her to repair computers and to increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain computers

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam P. is 43 and lives in Siem Reap province with her husband and five children aged 21, 19, 16, 10, and 6. She sells souvenirs near one of the Phimean Akas temples in Angkor Wat which is one of the most visited and holiest areas in Cambodia. She makes about $10 per day. Her husband is 43, and is a cook making about $2 per day. Three of her children are in school, and two work selling books and postcards to the tourists around Angkor Wat, making about $6 per day. Their monthly expenses are about $120.

In the future, Soam P. would like to expand her business further by opening another souvenir shop.

Soam P. is requesting his loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her souvenir shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina inició el negocio para obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a su esposo con las necesidades del hogar ya que querían  darles a sus 3 hijos Brenda Berenice de 19 años, estudiante de la carrera de Psicología; Sergio Iván de 12 años estudiante de primaria y Karla Gissele de 11 años, estudiante de primaria, una carrera universitaria. Comenzó en el mes de Enero de 1996 cuando una amiga la  invitó a su casa a una demostración de perfumes, que fue lo primero que empezó a vender, después ella seguí por su cuenta y como le empezó a ir bien en el año 2000 empezó a vender también cosméticos de reconocidas marcas y hasta la fecha le ha ido bien y le queda una ganancia suficiente para ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos con sus estudios. 

Ella necesita un préstamo por 10,000 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar más productos que le ayuden a tener un inventario mas variado para poder surtir a sus clientes y seguir dándoles una buena atención.
texts.en:
Angelina started her business to obtain an extra income and help her husband with the household necessities, especially because they wanted to provide their 3 children with an education: Brenda Berenice is 19 years old and she is completing a degree in Psychology; Sergio Ivan is 12 years old and he attending primary school; and Karla Gissele is 11 years old and she is also attending primary school. She started in January 1996 when a friend invited her to her home to showcase some perfumes, which was the first things she sold. Later one she went out on her own and found success. In the year 2000 she started also selling cosmetics of well known brands and this has also gone very well. This has given her enough earnings to help her husband and their children with their studies.

She requires a loan amounting to 10,000, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase more products to increase the selection in her inventory, and be able to supply her clientele with good customer service.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said Athuman is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. He runs a mobile phone accessories shop at Vituka ward in the city of Dar es Salaam. Phone accessories are purchased from Kariakoo wholesale shops and other shops around. He has been in the business for two years. He manages to meet his family's daily needs from the business income. He wants to buy more stock so as to expand his business but fund is a limiting factor. He is requesting a loan of T.shs 600,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories stock

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Choeurn T. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khna Kandal village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Hun Hon, is a pig breeder. Mr. Choeurn T. is 55 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer and others are enrolled in the local school. Since the second child's workplace is far from their house, Mr. Choeurn T. decided to ask for a loan for his second child to pay for transportation to work. 

Three members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the other has a monthly payment loan. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for his second child to pay for transportation to work.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif was born in 1978. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.

He has run this business for 5 years. His net profit minimum is 50 AZN per month. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables.

In the future after improving his business, he would like to build a shop and to buy a lot of sorts of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en: Roudayna is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, living in Rachaya in the Bekaa valley. She used to sell accessories at home, and five years ago she opened her own shop. Today, Roudayna is asking for $1,200 in order to increase her inventory and her profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Kifaya

texts.en: Kifaya is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, living in Al Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. She has owned and operated a bakery since 2000, and she already has several micro loans from Ameen to improve it. Today, Kifaya is requesting $1,000 in order to renew her bakery's machinery.

loans.use: Renew the bakery's machinery

loans.name: Susana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Susana Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Jr. San Pablo de la C., Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos dependen de ella.

Se inicio con de S/. 500.00, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  negocio propio, de estampados en tela. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicada en el centro de la cuidad en un  local especialmente acondicionado para mostrar sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/2,200.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos como banderolas bordadas, baner, cintas, grecas, blondas brillantes en diferentes colores y por docenas e igualmente telas y pintura para la confección de los estampados en tela.

Ella y su esposo toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer independiente, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Susana Patricia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susana Patricia is a member of the “Manos Unidas” community bank. She lives in the Jr. San Pablo de la C. in the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín. She is 38, married, and has 3 children who are all dependent upon her. She started her own business of printed fabrics with 500 PEN and encouragement from her husband. She continues with this business which is located in the center of the city in a special place to show her products. With a loan for 2,200 PEN, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy more products like embroidered flags, banners, ribbons, interlaced decorative designs, and dozens of bright laces in different colors. She would also buy fabric and paint for making her printed fabrics. She and her husband make the decisions about the earnings from her business. Personally, she is an independent woman, more secure and responsible about making her payments. Susana Patricia would like to thank Manuela Ramos for letting her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flags, banners, ribbons, decorations, lace, and fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Yessenia del Carmen Solórzano, tiene 32 años de edad, desde joven tiene un negocio que administra desde hace doce años, vende llantas y productos ferreteros. Reside en el barrio Laurees Norte en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo le ayuda en el tramo, y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de productos que sastifagan  las necesidades del cliente como: alambre, candados, y otros y a si vender mas, como captar clientes, sus metas a futuro es poder terminar de hacer su casa, acondicionar el tramo en mejores condiciones  así como apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
This young woman, Yessenia del Carmen Solórzano is 32 years old and has three young children. Since she was young, and for the last twelve years, she has managed her business selling wheels and metal products. She lives in the Laurees Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her husband helps her with the stand. She wants to invest this loan to purchase merchandise that will meet the needs of her customers, such as wire, padlocks, and other things. In this way she will increase sales and attract customers. Her goals for the future are to be able to finish off her house, to fix up her stand and to support her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (metal products)

loans.name: Ablossi

texts.fr: Agée de quarante un (41) ans, Mme Ablossi A. est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle réside actuellement à Adétikopé avec sa famille où elle exerce comme activité la préparation et la vente d’une bouillie à base de mais dans un établissement scolaire de ce village. C’est une femme très dynamique et beaucoup appréciée par les enseignants de l’établissement dans lequel elle vend par la qualité et la propreté dont elle fait preuve dans la préparation de la bouillie. Pour rentabiliser son activité et augmenter ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit pour stocker du mais et acheter du sucre, les éléments entrants dans la préparation de la bouillie.
texts.en:
Ms. Ablossi A., age 41, is married and the mother of two. She currently resides in Adétikopé with her family where she works at making and selling cornmeal porridge in an educational facility of this village. She is a very energetic woman and highly appreciated by the teachers of the facility, where she makes her sales. This is because of the quality and the cleanliness she demonstrate in making the porridge. To make her business more profitable and to increase her revenues, she’s requesting a loan to stock up on corn and to buy some sugar, the ingredients that go into making the porridge.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock corn and sugar for making and selling porridge

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr: NDEYE COUMBA F. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier cité senghor de thiès et a cinq enfants en charge;elle fait du petit commerce de fruits de saison pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants;elle a eu à bénéficier d'un pret avec kiva qu'elle a remboursé sans difficultés;elle sollicite un nouveau pret pour renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Ndeye Coumba F. is a married woman who lives in the Cité Senghor neighborhood of Thiès and is raising 5 children. She is a petty trader selling seasonal fruit to support her children. She has received one loan through Kiva that she reimbursed without difficulty. She is asking for another loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of seasonal fruit

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Mrs. Hilaria G. is single and lives in her own home with her two daughters, one of whom works in Spain. This daughter also helps support the family.

Mrs. G. has a business in one of the busiest markets in downtown Asunción, and has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell -- fruits, vegetables sweets and medicine. She also sells traditional teas which are grown locally, honey and cheese. Mrs.G. starts work in the early hours of the morning (at around 4:00 a.m.), when she goes out to buy the items she needs to run her business. One of her biggest goals is to be able to expand her business and open a store in which she can offer a more comfortable and enjoyable environment for her clients.

loans.use: The buy fruits, vegetables, cheese, honey and sweets to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ubani Adaku

texts.en:
Ubani sells provisions and she is also a fashion designer. She is 32 years old and married with four children.

Ubani has been in her business for the past eight years. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and tailoring materials to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and tailoring materials

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred G., married with two children, received education through junior high school. A saltwater fisherman since 2006, he sells his catches in Elmina. His wife is a trader. Alfred uses his income to pay bills and other expenses and will use the loan to buy fishing equipment to enhance his fishing work. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest in his enterrprise.

loans.use: Alfred will use the loan to buy fishing equipment to enhance his fishing work.

loans.name: Vera Cruz Group

texts.es: El grupo “Vera Cruz” esta representado por la señora Cinda y esta conformada por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a distintas actividades la mitad D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. zapatos y a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir, el resto D. las socias se dedica a la panadería y a la venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, los socios se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia a nivel comercial o D. venta D. productos es alta ya que existe variedad D. producto y D. todo precio por lo que los socios tienen que esforzarse para sacar adelante sus negocios realizando prendas mas acorD. al los cambios en el mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materia prima como telas y mercadería como abarrotes para incrementar su stock D. venta y repuestos para sus vehículos que ayudara a los socios a mejorar sus ingresos y por enD. a brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. La experiencia D. las socias radica en grupos anteriormente formados en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo D. los grupos solidaR. y saben como trabajar juntas para tener un mayor beneficio.
texts.en:
The “Vera Cruz” group is represented by Cinda. The group is composed of 13 members who work in different economic activities. Half of the women sell shoes and make clothing; the other half of the women sell bread and groceries from small neighborhood stores. The men in the group work are taxi drivers. Competition at the commercial level and in product sales is high because there are a variety of products available in a range of prices. Because of this, the group members have to work hard to make their businesses successful by making clothing that follows changes in the market. The loan will be used for buying materials such as fabrics, for merchandise such as grocery items to increase stock, and replacement parts for their cars. This will help the members improve their incomes and therefore be able to proviD. their families a better quality of life. The group members have experience from working with previous groups formed by other institutions, so they are familiar with the concept of working in solidarity lending groups and they know how to work together for increased benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys Ivania

texts.es: La joven Ivania de 30 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, soltera y habita en casa de sus padres, tiene una pulpería con sociedad con  su hermano, lo cual comenzó vendiendo pollo y golosinas, que desde horas tempranas se levantaba a preparar el pollo para cocinar y empacar en bolsa y salio a vender, este lo inicio con liquidación de su trabajo anterior en la zona franca. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo por lograr su crecimiento en su negocio, con este crédito invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción  para repellar la casa de sus padres y poder ir mejorándola día a día y gozar de sus esfuerzo. Espera a futuro poder tener su propia familia.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para repellar la casa

loans.name: Kadiri

texts.en:
Kadiri is 50 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions like noodles, milk, detergent, eggs, etc.

Kadiri hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She hopes to own a big supermarket in future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Nenita is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Nenita provides transport services to local community members. Nenita has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Nenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Retsy

texts.en:
Resty is a 45 year old single mother of 2 children between 8 and 20 years old. All of her children go to school. She resides and owns a four room house where she is staying with seven people. The family has access to electricity and running water at home. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. To get to and from this area, she uses public transportation.

Resty sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Resty's monthly expenses include medication, feeding the family and school fees. Resty has been with MCDT for ten years; this is her twentieth loan  She wants to use this loan to buy more newspapers and magazines; she aspires to be a newspaper agent in her area.

loans.use: purchasing more newspapers and magazines

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago A. es comerciante en el departamento de León siendo propietario de su pequeña pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos como comestibles y productos personales. El señor Santiago es muy esforzado y al tener tres hijos en edad escolar, estos son el motivo por el cual se esfuerza día a día.

Hoy en día espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para invertir en la compra de los productos para la pulpería y satisfacer a sus clientes que le visitan.
texts.en:
Santiago A. owns his small grocery store in the department of León where he sells all kinds of products like food and personal items. He is a very hard worker and, since he is the father of three school-aged children, is motivated every day to do his best. He is asking for this loan to buy inventory for his store so that he can better meet his customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Jurynda

texts.en:
Jurynda R. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years-old and married with four school-aged children. Jurynda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Jurynda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jurynda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jurynda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Jurynda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jurynda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

loans.name: Neima

texts.en:
Neima C. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in a market and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Neima is 25 years old and is married with a husband who is an engineer. She has six children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca T. is from the city of Castillo Concepcion Tarlac. She is 59 years old. Francisca is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a general store. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Andrea vive en colonia Rio Rama , todos los dias tiene que viajar en bus hacia su centro de trabajo en la Alcaldia del Coral, tiene un año de laborar como asistente de cartas de venta, tiene 3 hijos los cuales lestan estudiando ya que quiere que sean personas de bien, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra en la Alcadia del Coral. Ella requiere este credito para construir la cocina mas grande ya es muy pequeña , ya que gracias a los credito que ella ha obtenido en otras instancias ha mejorado su vivienda y solicita este credito en AFODENIC porque el interes es muy bajo y accesible a personas de escasos recursos esconomicos, doña Andrea es  muy alegre, responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy servicial con la personas que lo necesitan y con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Andrea lives in the Rio Rama neighborhood. Every day she has to take a bus to her workplace in the town of Coral. For the past year, she has worked as an assistant in an advertising company. She has three children, who are in school, since Andrea wants them to have a good foundation in life. Her husband works as a construction supervisor in the town of Coral. Andrea needs this loan to expand her kitchen, since it is very small. Thanks to the loans she has obtained on other occasions, she has been able to improve her home, and she is requesting this loan from AFODENIC because the interest rate is very low and affordable for people with few economic resources. Andrea is a very cheerful, responsible, honest and hard-working person, very helpful to people in need, and with a strong desire to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Miguel Santiago

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel Cárdenas G. es trabajador activo de la alcaldía municipal es el responsable del área de transporte,  el dinero lo solicita para compra de una moto-taxi, casado tiene 4 hijos uno menor.
texts.en:
Miguel Cárdenas G. is an employee of the Mayor's office transportation department. He will use the funds to buy a mototaxi. He is married and has four children, one of whom is still a minor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: 29 De Enero Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “29 de enero” esta representado por la señora Dioselina y conformado por 14 miembros donde 3 son varones y 11 son mujeres donde todos se apoyan mutuamente. La señora Fátima es casada y tiene 3 niños en edad escolar el mayor esta en colegio y los otros dos pequeños están en escuelas primarias, la señora Fátima se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propio hogar montando una pequeña tienda de barrio en la cual tiene también la venta de aceites, sodas y enlatados y desea poder agrandas su negocio con muchos mas productos y conservas es por esta razón que requiere del financiamiento; en cuanto a sus expectativas a futuro ella  desea poder agrandar su casa y hacerle algunas refacciones, también poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos con una buena educación y un techo mas confortable para el desarrollo de sus actividades. El resto de las socias de este banco comunal tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, joyas de fantasía, y negocios como salones de belleza, transporte en moto-taxis y empleos domésticos. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es alta pero loas socios saben como sacar adelante sus negocios con el cambio de mercadería o el traslados de la misma a mercados zonales o ferias de barrio obteniendo clientes leales a su trabajo y que confían en la mercadería que venden.  El destino del financiamiento es para poder ampliar un poco mas su negocio con la adquisición de mercadería, herramientas de trabajo, insumos y con una mejor comodidad para sus clientes. La mayoría de los miembros del grupo son nuevos pero con mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares, pero se encuentran satisfechos con la descripción del trabajo a realizar con la fundación Agrocapital demostrando unidad en cada una de sus reuniones previas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “29 de Enero” (January 29th) is led by Sra. Dioselina and consists of 14 members (3 men and 11 women) who are mutually supportive of one another.

Sra. Fátima is married and has three school-age children. The oldest is in high school, while the other two are in elementary school. Sra. Fátima manages a small neighborhood grocery store located inside of her home. She sells products such as oil, sodas, and canned goods and hopes to expand her business by adding more products. For this reason she is requesting a loan. In the future, she hopes to enlarge her house and make a few repairs. She also wants to provide her children with a good future by paying for a good education and having a comfortable home where they can develop in all of their activities.

The other members of this Communal Bank have businesses involving cosmetics, food, groceries, fine jewelry, beauty salons, motorcycle taxis, and housekeeping services. Competition is high in the commercial sector, but the members know what it takes to succeed in their businesses by turning over their merchandise or establishing their businesses at the regional markets or neighborhood fairs where they can obtain the most loyal customers who are in need of their products. This loan will be used to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, equipment, and supplies. They will also provide more comfortable conditions for their customers. Most of the members are new to the group, but they have plenty of experience working with solidarity group loans at other institutions. They are satisfied with the objectives they have to achieve with Fundación Agrocapital and so far have demonstrated teamwork in each of their previous meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Amalia Ivoon

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limón y actualmente está apoyando a su mama en el desarrollo del negocio de comideria, y estudiando sabatino, ya que la experiencia trasmitida por la antes mencionada tradicionalmente se extiende en manos de la solicitante.
texts.en:
This client is from the mining town of the El Limón, and currently is supporting her mother while trying to grow her food business. She also studies on Saturdays, as the experience transmitted by the aforementioned is traditionally extended into the hands of the requestor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Red brick, cinder blocks, cement, corrugated zinc, smooth zinc, metal rods, wire, lumber, etc.

loans.name: Philipa

texts.en:
Philipa is a faithful and hard-working businesswoman who sells groceries to her customers. She is married to an electrician. She is thirty years old with three children from age 16 – 22. She spends most of her time taking care of her business and supporting her children in school. She loves selling and enjoys serving customers. She trades in groceries like candies, mineral water, toiletries, hair creams, assorted biscuits, etc. She has operated her shop for the past 8 years in her neighborhood. 

Philipa believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful sellers of groceries. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of groceries to serve her customers, especially during the Easter festivities. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to educate her children to at least the tertiary school level.

loans.use: To purchase to assorted groceries like candies, toiletries, bottled water, etc.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad, a 26-year-old who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with his wife and their child, has known how to cut hair perfectly since he was 20. Upon seeing that he did it very well, he decided to establish his own barber shop five years ago. In order to open his own shop, he received the help of his father, who has been very supportive. In the future he plans to expand his shop in order to accommodate more customers and earn more. Jihad is now requesting a loan to buy certain products and tools that he needs for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and is happy for the opportunity Kiva lenders are giving him. For the future, he hopes that he can continue improving his business.

loans.use: To buy products and tools.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda P. is from the village of Sta. Isabel. She is 26 and married with one school-aged child and one infant. To make a living, Cresilda owns a business making and selling food including snacks and other delicacies. 

In 2007, Cresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to be used as capital for a small carenderia (home restaurant). This will be the 6th loan taken out by Cresilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: put-up capital for small carenderia

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba F. is single and has acquired knowledge up to the senior high school level. She sells porridge at a nearby station at Abura where people come to buy the food for their breakfast before going to work. 

Aba will use the loan she hopes to get to purchase more bags of millet for her porridge and to change her table since it is too small for her. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy extra bags of millet since the price keeps increasing as time passes by.

loans.use: To purchase bags of millet for making porriadge and to change her table

loans.name: Tavsirakhon

texts.en:
Tavsirakhon has a small business selling children’s clothing. She is a widow and has been in business for 10 years. Tavsirakhon is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this are the times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. 

Tavsirakhon has requested a loan to help renew her clothing inventory. The change of seasons means a busy time of year for clothing vendors. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for children for the summer season

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 47 years old and is single. Ferdinand owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 10 years.

Ferdinand joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ferdinand is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizers. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ferdinand from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking up and selling corn

loans.name: Risueñas De Calimaya Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “RISUEÑAS DE CALIMAYA” y esta formado por 11 integrantes y dentro de ellas esta la señora Teresa S.C. doña “Tere” para los vecinos y nos cuenta que su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, también nos platica que desde que era niña su mama le enseñó a hacer las tortillas a mano ya que a la edad de los 11 años, se tuvo que encargar de realizarlas para el consumo de la familia ya que su papá enfermó y ya no la pudo apoyar para que siguiera estudiando. Ahora la señora “Tere” lucha día a día en su negocio para apoyar a sus dos hijos que estudian el bachillerato, ya que ella quiere darles la oportunidad que ella no tuvo, y así puedan estudiar una carrera y triunfar en la vida.

   En este mismo grupo se encuentra la señora María de la Luz R.G. que cuenta con un taller de costura, la señora comenta que durante 13 años trabajo para otras personas y su mayor anhelo era tener su propio taller la primer maquina la obtuvo en un apoyo del gobierno, la segunda se la gano en una rifa que se llevo acabo en la iglesia de la comunidad, y la tercera es una ver de 5 hilos que la compro. Y el crédito lo destinará para comprar telas y poder hacer pans, la señora comenta que su negocio ha sido un millón de esfuerzos y dedicación ya que ha sido su fuente de ingresos en la actualidad, y con esto aporta a los gastos de la casa ya que con lo que gana su marido no es suficiente.


Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA: 
Rosa María V.R. 
TESORERA: 
Beatriz Adriana R.S.
INTEGRANTES: 
Aida R.R.
Teresa S.C.
Adriana E.G.
Laura R.C.
Maricela R.C.
Nayely J.A.
María de la Luz R.
Noelia H.R.
texts.en:
This group is named “Risueñas de Calimaya” (Cheerful Ones from Calilmaya). It is comprised of 11 members. Teresa S.C., “Tere” to her neighbors, tells us the she will use the loan to buy corn to make tortillas. She also says that her mother taught her to make tortillas by hand when she was very young. When she was 11 years old she had to make them for her family. When her father got sick he could not pay for her to continue in school. Tere struggles day to day in her business. She does this to support her two children who are in high school. She wants to give them the opportunity that she did not have. That way they will be able to study for a career and triumph in life. María de la Luz R.G. has a seamstress shop. She tells us that for 13 years she worked for other people. Her greatest wish was to have own shop. The first machine she got was with help from the government. The second machine she won in a raffle in the community church. The third is a five thread overlock that she bought. The loan is to buy fabric and to be able to make bread. She comments that she has put a million efforts and dedication into her business. It has been her source of income. She contributes to the household expenses because her husband does not earn enough. The other members of the group are: PRESIDENT: Rosa María V.R. TREASURER: Beatriz Adriana R.S. MEMBERS: Aida R.R. Teresa S.C. Adriana E.G. Laura R.C. Maricela R.C. Nayely J.A. María de la Luz R. Noelia H.R.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn to make tortillas, buy fabric, and supplies to make bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell pagnes and clothing fabrics

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, lugar caracterizado por sus caminos de tierra y montañas,  ella tiene un puesto en la calle de venta de “bolones” (plátanos aplastado con queso o cerdo en forma de balón de béisbol). 

Desde que su esposo la abandono ella inicio con el negocio de los “bolones” para poder mantener a su hija, poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo clientela. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 05:00pm hasta las 20h00pm. La elaboración de los bolones la hace con una paila de aceite hirviendo introduce los plátanos y los saca para apastarlos y así revolverlo con el queso o cerdo.  

Para tener mas clientela ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una carreta. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y que su hija termine sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Rosa is forty-three years old and lives in a suburban area, Fortin de Guayaquil. This is an area of dirt paths and mountans. She has a street-stall where she sells "bolones" (mashed plantains covered with cheese or pork shaped like a a baseball). She started her "bolones" business to support her daughter after her husband left her and bit-by-bit, with effort, has gained clustomers. Now she works from five in the afternoon to ten at night. She makes the "balones" with a large metal pot of boiling oil that she puts the plantains in. She then takes them out, mashes them, and then cover them with cheese and pork. To get more customers, she wants to buy a cart with the loan. In the future, she would like to expand her business and she wants her daughter to finish school successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida L. is from the village of Calaran Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old and single. To make a living, Florida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising and selling pigs.  She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase breeding livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This will be Florida’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Silvio José se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida. Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y es un excelente clientes, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita crédito. El inicio este negocio por no tenía una trabajo estable, que proporcionara ingresos para mantener a su familia, siempre le ha gustado este tipo de negocio y así fue que él decide hacerse cargo de este medio de vida. Actualmente llegan muchos clientes a comprar a comprar los diferentes platillos que ofrece como gallo pinto, maduro, queso frito, tortas de carne, tajadas entre otros. La inversión de este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, aceite, verduras entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en:
Silvio José works in the preparation and sale of food. He has a great desire to advance himself and he is an excellent loan customer, since this is not the first time he has applied for a loan. He began this business because he didn't have a stable job that would provide income to maintain his family. He had always liked this type of business, and so it was that he decided to take on this way of life. Now many customers come to buy the different dishes that he offers, such as gallo pinto (a rice and bean dish), ripe plantains, fried cheese, meat pies, and sliced fried plantains, among other items.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients such as basic grains, oil, and vegetables, among other necessary items.

loans.use: Buy ingredients such as grains, oil, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercedes Mabell

texts.es:
Mercedes Mabell A. M. tiene 30 años. Es soltera vive con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo. 
 
Mercedes es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Mercedes trabaja en el comercio vende productos de veterinaria y da asistencia medica para animales en las granjas del sector, además es profesor de un colegio, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta da servicios.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro, y una granja con sus propios animales.

Le gusta escuchar música y actualizar los conocimientos con relación a al medicina de los animales.
texts.en:
Mercedes Mabell A. M. is 30 years old.  She is single and lives with her son in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.  She has one son.

Mercedes is a member of the rural communal bank "La Esperanza,"  which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas.  This is a community where there is a lot of wholesale trade activity.  This group meets every month in the San Vincente neighborhood.

Mercedes works in retail trade, selling veterinary products and giving medical care to animals in the farms in her area.  In addition, she teaches at a school.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from her home, and she provides services door-to-door.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise to expand her business.  This loan will help her to buy the supplies that she needs.  Her dream is to have the money to buy a car and to have a farm with her own animals.

She enjoys listening to music and updating her knowledge of veterinary medicine.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Alex David

texts.es:
Alex tiene 27 años, es soltero y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Alex es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo platería como por ejemplo aretes y otras cosas más, él vende sus productos en la ciudad de Aguas Calientes. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Alex con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, él invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alex is 27 years old, single, and participates in the Arariwa Micro Finance Unit's “Señor De Los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Alex is a hardworking and enterprising youth who sells handicrafts made of silver, such as earrings and other items.  He sells his products in the city of Aguas Calientes.  (The city of Cusco is located near one of the 8 wonders of the world, the citadel of the Incas called Machu Picchu.)

Alex is awaiting his next loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which he will invest the purchase of supplies such as silver.

Alex is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and, in addition, promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: he will invest the money to buy supplies such as silver

loans.name: Julienne Félicité

texts.fr: Julienne est âgée de 33 ans. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Pour contribuer au menage, elle fait la vente de pagnes où elle tire ses revenus. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier vakpossito. Elle achète en gros les pagnes et redistribue en détail. Elle a remboursé  plusieurs prêt déjà à WAGES. Avec ce nouveau credit, Elle espère augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Julienne is 33 years old. She is married and has 3 children. To help with the housekeeping, she sells traditional garments which gives her some income. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Vakpossito neighbourhood. She buys the garments wholesale and redistributes them retail. She has already repaid several loans to WAGES. With this new loan she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: purchase of garments

loans.name: Luz Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Grupo .Solidario . LUZ DEL AMANECER

BERTA CARINA C. P..tiene 21 años de edad es soltera, estudia un curso de ingles los fines de semana, ella se dedica a la venta de roscas de feria,  su negocio lo realiza en diferentes lugares de ambulante , porque en el lugar donde haya feria es donde ella va a vender su producto y a veces entrega por mayor cuando le encargan, su credito lo necesita para comprar cereales para elavorar dulces porque necesita extenderse a otros lugares.
GRISELDA MARISOL G. S.. tiene 23 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo de 1 año, ella se dedica al alquiler de sillas, mesas, manteles etc., Su credito lo necesita para poder comprar mas sillas pero pequeñas, porque cuando le alquilan las sillas le piden pequeñas pero ella cuenta con pocas sillas pequeñas, ella dice que para que pueda obtener mas clientes tendria que tener lo necesario.
ANGELA P. C.
 tiene 54 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos, pero de los 7 tiene 3 ya casados, solo mantiene a cuatro con ella, que la ayudan a sacar su producto que vende, ella se dedica a la venta de panitos de feria, dulces tipicos, y papas fritas, ella necesita su credito para comprar cereales para elavorar dulces y extenderse a otros lugares, para mejorar la venta de sus productos y surtir mas producto, para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Solidarity Group "Luz del Amanecer" [Dawn Light]

Berta Carina C. P. is 21 years of age, single, and is taking a course in English on the weekends. She earns a living selling baked goods in various places as a street vendor. Wherever there is a street market that's where she goes to sell her product and sometimes she delivers wholesale when she gets orders. Her loan is needed to buy grains to make sweets because she needs to branch out into more areas. 

Griselda Marisol G. S. is 23 years of age, married and has a one-year-old child. She earns a living renting chairs, tables, tablecloths, etc. Her loan is needed to be able to purchase more chairs, small ones because when people rent the chairs they ask for small ones and she has only a few small chairs. She says that in order to get more customers she would have to have what's needed. 

Angela P. C. is 54 years of age and has seven children. Of the seven, three are already married; only four of them still live with her and they help her get her product out for sale. She earns a living selling baked goods, traditional candies and french fries. She needs her loan to purchase grains for making sweets and to branch out into more areas in order to improve her sales and have more product to offer, in order to make better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase grains for making sweets and to purchase small chairs

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Madres Trabajadoras ” tiene  más de 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, e incluyen entre sus integrantes a 2 señoras que emprenderán actividades para generar ingresos.
 Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales  para  su desarrollo y formación.     
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Zadi, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y de esa forma ella obtiene su ingreso. 
Ella vende sus mercaderías en su casa y también sale a ofrecer en casas de clientes. 
Se encuentra muy contenta con su actividad y desea continuar en el comité y seguir trabajando con él para fomentar la unión entre ellas. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que quiere contar con productos nuevos y novedosos para sus clientes, quiere comprar remeras, shorts, vestidos, blusas, zapatillas y otros.
texts.en:
The “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers) committee has been in existence and collaborating with Fundación Paraguaya for over three years.  Most of its members are already engaged in productive activities but there are two women in the group who will be starting out in income producing activities.

They strive towards a better future for their children and this is why they double their efforts to provide the tools for their development and growth.
