One of the members is Zadi who sells clothes to earn income.  She sells her merchandise at home but also sells door to door.  She is very happy with her activity and wants to continue in the committee working with it to encourage unity among the members.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise in order to have new and original products for her customers; she wants to buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, blouses, slippers and others.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, dresses, shorts, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Edelvina

texts.es: Edelvina tiene 36 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa de su suegra. Hace más de 13 años junto con su esposo realizan 2 actividades que son esenciales para la economía de su hogar; en donde fabrican guitarras hechas artesanalmente, asimismo ofrece  el servicio de espectáculos donde ella misma es la vocalista y deleita a su publico con su bella voz. Este trabajo lo realiza todos los fines de semana, y ahora más que se encuentra en temporada de fiestas navideñas tendrá más espectáculos. El sueño de Edelvina es tener mayor popularidad en su zona para que los contratos que perciba aumenten. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de micrófonos y nueva vestimenta.
texts.en: Edelvina is 36 years old, she lives with her husband and their 4 chldren in her mother-in-law's home. More than 13 years ago with her husband they set up 2 businesses which are essential for the finances in their household; they make handmade guitars, and they also perform shows where she is the vocalist and she delights the public with her beautiful voice. They do this work every weekend, and now as they in the Nativity season they will have more shows. Edelvina's dream is to gain more popularity in her area so that the contracts that they receive will grow. This is loan number 2 with MFP, she is very happy to know that she has financial support, in addition she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all their members are people that she knows, responsible and very supportive. She is grateful to all the peope who will be providing the loan that she is requesting as it will be very useful in progressing their business activities. With the loan requested, she will use it to buy microphones and new clothing.

loans.use: To buy microphones and new clothing for her musical shows.

loans.name: Soila Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Soila, tiene 67 años D. edad,  resiD. en San Rafael Oriente, departamento D. San Miguel, se dedica prestar servicio con un molino D. motor y corriente donD. tritura granos básicos, este molino lo administra desD. hace 35 años, atienD. a los vecinos cercanos y algunos D. la zona que aun que no les queD. muy cerca asisten donD. ella, D. este negocio recibe a diario ingresos para su gasto personal y cubrir sus necesidades.
Ella está con el proyecto D.  ampliar y mejorar la vivienda por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento D. su casa D. habitación, ella quiere construirle un corredor para descansar y tener más espacio; Su objetivo es realizar el trabajo D. la mejor manera y mantener su vivienda bonita y en buenas condiciones para sentirse más segura dentro D. ella.
texts.en:
Soila is 67 years old.  She lives in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department and provides a service with her motorized mill, grinding basic grains.  She has been providing milling services for 35 years.  She serves her neighbors and some other people who live in the area who come to her even though they aren't very close by.  She makes daily income from this business that covers her personal expenses and needs.

Soila is working on extending and improving her home.  She is requesting a loan so that she can carry out improvements to her home.  She would like to build a porch where she can relax and have more space.  Her goal is to carry out the work in the best way possible and to keep her house beautiful and in good condition so that she can feel safer insiD. it.

loans.use: To expand and improve her home

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Karla Angelica

texts.es: Karla Angélica tiene un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 2 años, el cual se ubica en lugar muy concurrido, donde se observa prosperidad. Ella es madre de 1 niño al que quiere ofrecerle una mejor calidad  de vida. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo para surtir su negocio y así sus ganancias se incrementen para la economía familiar.
texts.en: Karla Angelica has had a prosperous used clothing business for the past 2 years and it is located in a well traveled area. She is the mother of one and she wants to provide him with a better quality of life. She currently requires a loan to stock her business and to improve her earnings which contribute to the family’s finances.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to a former member, Ms. Silvina Cañete. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in the area. The committee's name is "Santa Catalina", and they are currently in their seventh cycle. With 13 members, it is a group that is highlighted in the community for its commitment to responsibilities and way of work. The members of the committee have different activities and they try hard every day to improve income for their families. The women are borrowing 1,200,000; 1,100,000; 1,000,000; 700,000 and 500,000 guarani (PYG) to buy merchandise for subsequent sale.

Ms. Eulogia A. has a small fruit stand and she is well known in her community for her good quality service and good merchandise. Although she has a good income, she wishes to increase it by diversifying her products and improving quantity.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia L. is from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old. Lucia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood, bananas & coconuts in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional firewood & coconuts for copra to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao..

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood & coconuts for copra to sell

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: G.s. "san Nicolas" Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario “San Nicolas” está conformado por Ismael Antonio, Blanca Nubia y Sonia Del Carmen. Ellos son personas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras que disfrutan de su medio de vida. Ismael se dedica a una pulpería, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, el se ha caracterizado por brindarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Sonia en cambio se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, desde hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este medio de vida ya que ha sido una persona que le gusta el trabajo ella tiene a dos hijos menores a su cargo. Juntos se han unido para realizar el financiamiento de materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en: The name of this group is "San Nicolas" and the members are Ismael Antonio, Blanca Nubia, and Sonya Del Carmen. They are very persistent and hard working people who enjoy their way of life. Ismael has a convenience store that he has made a success with a great deal of effort. He is known to provide his clients with whatever they request. Sonia has a livestock business, buying and selling swine. For the past 10 she has dedicated herself to this business and she has always been someone who enjoys work.  She has two young children in her care. They have come together to access a loan to purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 43 years old. He has five children who are between the ages of 1 and 11 years old. Three of his children are in school while the other two are not in school yet. 

Pierre  is a bicycle mechanic and he has been one for 12 years. He is requesting a loan to buy bicycle spare parts. In the future he plans to sell bicycles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Teresa Alejandra

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hija. Vive en casa de su padre junto a su familia en el Pueblo Joven José Olaya, ubicado en el distrito de Chiclayo.

Teresa se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y  salchipollo, plato que consiste en papas fritas, pollo frito y cremas.  Los vende desde hace más de 3 años, antigüedad que le permite a la fecha haber acumulado el número de clientes fidelizados con los que cuenta.

Teresa quisiera ampliar su negocio, es por ello que desea adquirir bebidas gaseosas para su venta, así como sillas para atender a más clientes, y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has one daughter.  She lives with her family at her father’s house in Pueblo Joven José Olaya, located in the Chiclayo district.

Teresa sells hamburgers and salchipollo, a dish that consists of fried chicken, fried potatoes, and cream.  She’s been selling them for the past three years, which has allowed her to accumulate the faithful customers that she has.

Teresa would like to expand her business and needs to buy soft drinks and chairs to better serve her customers.  In order to achieve her objective, she has seen fit to request a loan of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and chairs

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbold is a 49-year-old carpenter. He has been running a furniture making business since 2006. He lives with his wife and only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a chef in a cafeteria. 

Ganbold's family lives in a house which he built a few years ago. Ganbold uses his garage as a workshop and he employs two more carpenters. He produces different home furniture such as beds, sofas, wardrobes, shelves, chairs and so on per customer order. His products are in high demand, especially furniture for gers, which are traditional Mongolian nomadic tents. He gets enough orders to complete. He also sells some of his products at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

This loan Ganbold is asking for will be used to replenish some of his tools and to stock more materials such as wood, planks, metal sheets, and other necessary things to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy hardware, tools, and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marietta is 46 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a pottery-making business in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy mud and bamboo for her pot making business.

Marietta has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Marietta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy mud and bamboo for her pot making.

loans.name: Ma. Clarissa

texts.en:
Ma. Clarissa is 23 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Clarissa has a business buying and selling RTW (clothing) products in the Philippines. Ma. Clarissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ma. Clarissa has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Ma. Clarissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Edna has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Edna is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Alia's Group

texts.en:
Alia is a caring & supportive lady by nature. She not only carries out her responsibilities as a housewife well but also operates her business selling bed sheets very efficiently. She does this work to support her husband financially. They both help each other to sustain their finances. Her husband also sells bed sheets and he sells rugs. He is a very hard worker. He puts the bed sheets on his bicycle everyday and sells by visiting different areas of the city. They both have no children yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who also sells bed sheets and rugs. With the loan, he will buy bed sheets and rugs in larger quantity to be able to offer more variety to his customers and earn better profits. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Alia is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits by improving his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets & rugs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, a 40-year-old mother who is blessed with three school-aged children, owns and manages a general store where she sells rice and agricultural supplies. In business for almost one year, she usually earns about PHP 7,000 each month. Now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional stocks of rice and agricultural supplies, Juliet hopes to improve this business in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice and agricultural supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

El socio; El socio tiene 66; el socio es casado y tiene 8 hijos los cuales ya estan todos independientes;  El socio tiene un pequeño restaurante llamado el Cienciano ubicado en Urubamba; el restaurante del socio es atendido por su esposa y sus hijos, el socio es trabajador en el área administrativa de educación en Urubamba y con todos sus ahorros puso este restaurante para que su familia trabaje y puedan tener otro ingreso extra, les ha ido muy bien y con lo que ahorran pueden comprar al por mayor los productos requeridos por la demanda de insumos, el socio desea el crédito ahora para comprar cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor, para implementar el negocio familiar y de este modo mejorar las ventas. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank belonging to Urubamba District, Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He was born in 1945, is married and has 8 children who are all now independent.  He has a small restaurant called “El Cienciano” located in Urubamba.  His restaurant is tended to by his wife and children.  He’s employed as an educational administrator in Urubamba and used all his savings to open the restaurant so that his family would have work and extra income.  They have done very well and with their savings they are able to buy at wholesale the products and ingredients they need to meet demand.  He needs the loan to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale to stock the family business and improve sales.  He’s asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

He is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay his debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari, aged 30, is married to Hellen. He sells curios and has been doing this for eight years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES. 50,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more curios for sale.

He hopes to join international exporters in the future.

loans.use: To buy curios

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 57 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with 4 children.  To earn a living, Benita has a retail business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Benita has requested a loan of 5,000PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Benita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Benita would like to own a stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Seberina

texts.es:
Seberina nació en la ciudad D. Ayacucho (Perú) y tiene 60 años D. edad. Ella es casada y fruto D. unión tiene siete hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad D. Urubamba y donD. realiza sus actividades. Ella se dedica a la venta D. frutas en el merado modelo D. la ciudad D. Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Seberina es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo naranjas, piñas, papayas, paltas, plátanos y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Señor D. los Milagros D. Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Seberina was born in the city of Ayacucho (in Peru), and she is 60 years old.  She is married, and has had seven children from her marriage.

Currently she lives in the city of Urubamba, which is where she works. She works selling fruit in the Modelo Market in Urubamba city.  She has been doing this for several years now, and it's been going very well for her.

The loan that Seberina is requesting is to buy merchandise, for example oranges, pineapples, papayas, avocados, plantains and other additional items.

The Communal Bank "Señor D. los Milagros D. Urubamba", ("Lord of Miracles of Urubamba"), meets monthly in the city of Urubamba (in Cusco, Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a tourist and business area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, for example oranges, pineapples, papayas, avocados, plantains, and other additional items.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal, 58, is a farmer with her husband and their income is $2 a day. They have four children, all of whom work in a factory for $3 a day  each. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on housing rent, $17 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. In the future, she hopes to be able to repair her house to make it more livable than it is now.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, vive con su suegra y sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 18 y 11 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva, junto con su suegra quien le enseño el oficio, D. lunes a viernes trabaja vendiendo, D. siete D. la mañana hasta las cinco D. la tarD., y sábado D. ocho D. la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más ropa para todas las edades (vestidos, pantalones, faldas, short)y surtirlo para tener más variedad, y D. esa forma tener más clientes, y mejores ingresos.
Su aspiración es comprar un lote para hacer su casa, y siempre tener su negocio propio para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her mother-in-law and her two children, ages 18 and 11.  She sells new clothes together with her mother-in-law, who taught her this traD..  She sells Mondays through Fridays from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon.  On Saturdays she works from eight in the morning until noon.

She will use the loan to buy more clothes for all ages (dresses, pants, skirts, and shorts).  She will stock her store in order to have greater variety.  This way she will have more customers and improved income.

Her goal is to buy a lot to build a house.  Her other goal is to always have her own business in order to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothes (dresses, pants, skirts, and shorts).

loans.name: Cheun

texts.en:
Cheun is a widow with two daughters - one is married and the other is a garment worker. Cheun lives along National Road No. 5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Cheun is a rice farmer. She also sells boiled peanuts when she is not farming. Cheun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help with her farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, pipes and a water pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, pipes and a water pumping machine

loans.name: Luzvina

texts.en:
Luzvina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Luzvina has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

Luzvina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luzvina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Arlene has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages. 

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with seven children, one of whom attends school. The others have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of inadequate food supply for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a barbershop since 2008; and has a previous experience of five years working in the same occupation. With his requested loan of $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to improve his business by purchasing added materials needed and redecorating his shop in order to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop.

loans.use: purchasing added materials needed and redecorating his barbershop

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Adjouavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un transitaire et a 04 enfants.
Adjouavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. depuis 2003. Elle vend à son domicile après achat à Lomé.
Adjouavi a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale afin de répondre à la demande de la population.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjouavi voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente et assurer un radieux avenir à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjouavi, age 31, is married to a freight agent and has four children. Since 2003, she's been reselling grocery products.

She purchases her supplies in Lomé, and resells at her home.

Adjouavi is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more products to better meet customer demand.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to open other points of sale and ensure a shining future for her children.

loans.use: to buy and resell grocery products

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat is 40 years old, married and has three children who all are still in school. She lives in a rural area of the Kang Meas district. She has worked in farming for 18 years in order to make a living, and sometimes works for others to raise additional income. Her husband sells coconuts. With her current business, she earns more than 15 U.S. dollars per day. 

Savat is a second-cycle loan client who has a good repayment record. She is requesting another loan to buy a motorbike for her husband’s business. This loan will enable him to increase his coconut business so as to earn more income to better feed their children and also keep them in school

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband’s business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 43 years old, with one child. She has a produce business and has been running it for 10 years now. She faces a challenge of high inflation rates, and her family goal is to educate her child. She hopes to expand her business to new markets and wishes to take a loan for buying more products like rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Sanounou

texts.fr:
Sanounou est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants qui ne vont pas encore à l’école. Le premier a 3 ans et le dernier a 5 mois.
Sanounou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il vend des produits d’alimentation générale pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Sanounou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sanounou voudrait rendre l’activité plus rentable. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de préparer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sanounou is a 27-year old man, who is married to a retailer. He has two children who do not yet go to school. The elder child is three years old and the younger five months old.

Sanounou has worked as a retailer since 2006. He sells groceries to all types of customers in his shop. He buys his products in Lomé and works alone. His main problem at the moment is the competition. 

Sanounou has requested a first loan from WAGES to buy groceries. He wants to reinvest in his business and in the coming years he would like to make it more profitable. He says that he is planning to prepare his children's future with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 23 years to 34 years. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a ready and established area for dairy farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a cow. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow for milking.

loans.name: Danuvio Group

texts.es: Danuvio es un grupo nuevo, esta integrado por 8 mujeres deseosas por salir adelante. Ana es una joven de 24 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 niñas de 4 y 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios y novedades en mercados rodantes, tiene un pequeño puesto y el crédito lo usará para obtener un local establecido, ya que en un futuro Ana desea retomar sus estudios y terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Danuvio is a new group, composed of 8 women who are eager to get ahead. 

Ana is 24 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 girls, aged 4 and 2. She makes a living selling accessories and novelties in street markets, where she has a small stall. She plans to use the loan to obtain a storefront. 

In the future Ana wants to resume her studies and complete a degree.

loans.use: to pay for a storefront.

loans.name: Khaly

texts.fr: Khaly est cultivateur âgé de 57 ans établi dans le département de Dagana, il est marié et père de 7 enfants. Il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage depuis qu'il est petit accompagné de ses parents. Avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de patate douce, d'herbicide et de fertilisants.
texts.en: Khaly is a 57-year-old farmer, who is married and a father to seven children. He lives in the department of Dagana. He has been working in farming with his parents since he was very young. He will buy sweet potato seedlings, herbicide and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy sweet potato seedlings, herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Las Cariñosas De Kalaque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CARIÑOSAS DE KALAQUE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, pesca, venta de queso, servicio de transporte, venta de leche, venta de ganado, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, y ella ya tiene años en él, cuando tuvo su hijo decide emprender su negocio independiente para generar mayores recursos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes de pesca) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará los mismo en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el crédito que ofrece la institución.

El compañero del grupo esta parado pero no se enfoco su rostro
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las cariñosas de Kalaque” [The affectionate women of Kalaque] will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer. The group belongs to the regional office of Achacachi and is composed of eight members and led by a board where Claudia is the president. The members have different businesses, such as fish sales, fishing, cheese sales, transport services, milk sales, livestock sales and grocery stores.

These loans are useful for micro entrepreneurs like Claudia. She says that this is the first time that she works with Pro Mujer. She was invited by a promoter who visited her house. She has a fishing business. It started as a family business and she has many years of experience. After having a child, she decided to start her own business in order to make more profits.

Claudia is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. She will buy fishing nets from the wholesalers at El Alto and then install them in her fishing area. With this activity she is able to provide for her family; she lives in a common-law marriage and has a child.

Claudia says that what she likes the most about Pro Mujer are the loans they offer. The only man in the group is standing and his face is not in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 38 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ailyn has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as footwear, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Ailyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as footwear, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna lives in a suburb called Lumo, adjacent to the Dar es Salaam International Airport (DIA)  in Dar es Salaam.  She is neither married nor has a kid, but she supports a family of seven people including her parents.  She sells fried fish near her home.  She has been in this business for three years now.  Her business has been stagnant with unexpected improvement.  This has been contributed by poor capital base and the high cost of living the family demands.  She is planning to expand her business.  The expansion plan will demand extra stock of cooking oil and charcoal.  Also she will need a big display cage for offering fish for sale.  She is in need of USD 400 to make her plan work.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Afoua Anne

texts.en:
Mother of one child and having two younger brothers to look after as well, Afoua Anne E. was born in Badou in the Wawa Prefecture on September 23, 1983. She left her studies after finishing middle school because her parents could no longer afford to pay school fees. After staying at home with her mother for several years, she began to work as a peddlar.

In that way, she managed to save enough to open a little stall selling foodstuffs and household necessities. She also provides for her husband, who is jobless.

This is a woman who is devoted to her business and would like to enlarge it by opening a little store and increasing her stock of goods for sale. In view of the present size of her business, she is asking for a loan of $1000 which will allow her to refurbish and enlarge a little store and add to her inventory. This loan will certainly allow her to increase the income from her store and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Mère d’un enfant avec deux frères à charge, Madame E. Afoua Anne est née à Badou dans la préfecture de Wawa le 23 septembre 1983. Elle arrêta ses études après son CEPD faute de moyen financier des parents. Après plusieurs années passées aux côtés de sa maman, elle entreprit de faire de petits commerces ambulants ou liquidation.

C’est à travers cette activité qu’elle a fait de petites économies lui permettant aujourd’hui d’installer son étalage de vente de produits alimentaires de premières nécessités. Son mari sans emploi est également à sa charge.

C’est une femme très dévouée à son commerce et veut l’agrandir par l’ouverture d’une boutique et la constitution de stocks plus importants de produits et articles qu’elle vend. Compte tenu de l’ampleur que prend son commerce, elle sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui permettra d’aménager, d’agrandir sa boutique et de constituer un stock de marchandises. A coût sûr, ce financement augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et la rentabilité de son activité et lui permettra au mieux d’améliorer sa condition de vie.

loans.use: refurbish and enlarge her little store and add to her inventory (aménager, agrandir sa boutique et constituer un stock de marchandises)

loans.name: Hy

texts.en: Hy Chanthorn is 46-year-old and a mother of 5 children who lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Camboida. She generates her income by selling palm sugar in the village and usually makes about $10/day of income. Her husband is self-employed as a tuk-tuk driver and makes  around $10/day. Two of Chanthorn's sons are tuk-tuk drivers as well, while another one is a construction worker. Their daily revenue is contributed to the household. Furthermore, the loan allows C. to purchase a trailer for her business and buy some wood to repair the house from leaking in the rainy season. In the future, C. wants a stand to sell her sugar at the market, where she will make her additional income. Eventually, if she saves enough money, she thinks about being able to build a new house and send her children to a university.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a business and repair house from leaking during the rainy season.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Business Description

Teresa has been in business for 12 years. Four years ago, with her own capital and savings, she modified her house to accomodate a grocery shop. This business has gone very well for her, and she has provided good service to her clients. She works every day from 6am to 11pm. She is also starting to sell lunch from her house.

Use of the Loan

She will use the loan to buy merchadise for her business. It will also help her with the lunch business. She will buy fruits and vegetable in bulk.

Personal Information

Teresa is 58 years old. She has 6 children, all adults. They help her with whatever she needs and they are always looking out for her. Her husband sells slippers as an outdoor vendor. Little by little, loans have allowed her to finish construction on her house. With this loan, she hopes to continue work on it.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Teresa tiene una experiencia de 12 años en la actividad del comercio. Hace 4 años con capital propio y dinero ahorrado adecuo su casita y puso venta de víveres. Le ha ido muy bien con esta actividad dando buen servicio a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 11 p.m. También esta iniciando con la venta de almuerzos en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres para su negocio. Y también para elaborar los almuerzos. Comprara legumbres y frutas al por mayor.

Información Personal

Teresa tiene 58 años. Seis hijos los cuales ya son adultos. Le ayudan en lo que necesita y siempre están pendientes de ella. Su esposo trabaja de manera ambulante vendiendo zapatillas. Poco a poco con los créditos que le han otorgado han podido terminar su casita. Esperan con esta inversión poder seguir adecuándola.

loans.use: Comprar viveres para su tienda y para elaborar almuerzos

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 35-year-old mother of 5. She sells charcoal and "vitenge" (a common local clothing). She gets her "Vitenge" from Malawi and supplies it to Arusha and Moshi (Northwestern Tanzania), where it is in high demand. She travels frequently upcountry for the charcoal and sells it as a retailer.

Both of Lucy's businesses are booming, and she now wants to open a shop selling traditional attire. She is in need of a loan of US$ 400, to help her expand her micro-business venture.

loans.use: Expand on business

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo is an artesan who works with leather and suede. He creates footwear for men, with the help of one assistant. His products are sold by the dozen in the popular fairs in La Paz. He counts on this income to take care of himself and his wife. They live in the zone of Tupac Katari in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase leather and other materials to grow his business. This is fourth loan with Impro. With his good compliance with the previous three loans, he qualifies for this other loan to help meet the demands of his market.

Carmelo es artesano en cuero y cuerina; elabora calzados para varones y tiene un ayudante. El producto es comercializado por docena en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de La Paz, constituyéndose en su fuente de ingreso con que mantiene a su esposa y a él mismo; vive en la Zona de Tupac Katari de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido será utilizado para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de materia prima cuero, cartón, etc.). Es el cuarto crédito con Impro y su buen comportamiento de pago en los tres créditos anteriores le permite acceder a otro préstamo para que pueda satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY LEATHER AND OTHER MATERIALS TO GROW HIS MENS FOOTWEAR BUSINESS

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en: Kiki is 32 years old married woman. She  has been selling flowers since being a member of MBK.  Her husband is a worker who has small income. She has to work hard to cover their daily needs. She requests thisloan to expand her business to earn more income so that she could finance her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Asminah

texts.en: Asminah is a 33-year-old woman whose her husband, M. used to be the sole breadwinner. But since joining MBK, Asminah has started her own bamboo-matting business at her house. She usually earns US$22 per month. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Don Cristóbal is 40 years old and as a living he extracts sand and his wife sells clothing, shoes and course material. There are 7 members in Cristobal’s family; his children study and live with their parents who have their own house. The mother sells her merchandise in a village far from Yapacaní and she is at home Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, while Cristobal works all week with his dump truck extracting sand which activity he has carried out for several years.

Cristobal competes with several individuals who extract sand, but his insistence and dedication to his work has made him well-known and popular in the area. With this application his wife will buy pencils, pens, notebooks, binder sheets, bond paper, erasers, etc. to be sold before school starts. This is Cristobal’s fourth application with our institution and he has always been a responsible and punctual payer of his installments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cristobal es un señor de 40 años de edad que se dedica a la extracción de áridos y su esposa a la venta de ropa, zapatos y material escolar. La familia de Cristobal consta de 7 miembros, sus hijos estudian y viven junto a sus padres en casa propia. La mamá lleva la mercadería a un pueblo lejano de Yapacaní para poder comercializarla y sólo se la encuentra en su casa los días martes, miércoles y jueves, mientras Cristobal trabaja toda la semana con su volqueta extrayendo áridos, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace varios años atrás.

Cristobal compite con varias personas que se dedican a la extracción de arena, pero el empeño y dedicación de su trabajo hacen que sea muy conocido y solicitado en la zona. Con la presente solicitud la esposa comprará lápices, bolígrafos, cuadernos, hojas de carpeta, hojas de papel bond, borradores, etc. para poder comercializar los mismos antes de que empiecen las clases. Esta solicitud es la cuarta de Cristobal en nuestra institución, donde demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase material for stationer's to increase sales.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.en: Munavvar M. is 42 years old and married with four children.  She makes a living selling fabrics used to make her nation's national dresses. Her trading place is located in the local market, where she has many beautiful and popular items for sale. Demand is also strong because women are expected to have various dresses for use at different family occasions, and because the national dress is an important item in any girl's dowry. Munawar's business has been so successful that she can support her large family and save for the future education of her children. She is requesting a loan of $950 to buy new items to sell. She has been an IMON client for several years and has proved herself to be very reliable. Munavvar thanks everyone who supports her and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and increase the range of items availalbe for purchase.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel is 26 years old and has lived with his partner Felicia, with whom he has a three year old child, for five years. He worked in his brothers business selling engine lubricants until he began his auto mechanic studies.

After some time and much effort, Ángel was able to go out on his own and open his own shop. Four years have passed since then and, today, his shop is a success.

He tells that in addition to dedicating himself to his profession he also serves as a volunteer fireman in his city, an activity which he loves because it allows him to serve and help others in times of need. His volunteer work is greatly satisfying to him because he feels he can contribute positively to society, and he knows how important the job can be given that his own life was once saved by a fireman.

Ángel’s dream is to one day have a well-equipped shop. He needs a loan to be able to buy oil and lubricants of all types to sell, given that these are in great demand and provide him with a good profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel tiene 26 años, vive en pareja con Felicia hace 5 años y juntos tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ángel empezó a trabajar como vendedor de lubricantes para vehículos en la empresa de su hermano hasta que comenzó a estudiar mecánica para motos.

Luego de un tiempo y con mucho esfuerzo, Ángel logró independizarse y abrió su propio taller, desde entonces han pasado 4 años y su taller hoy día es todo un éxito.

Comenta que además de dedicarse a su profesión, también realiza otra actividad como Bombero Voluntario en su ciudad, esta actividad la realiza con mucho amor, pues dice que el desea servir a las personas, ayudarlas en los momentos en que necesiten. Ser bombero voluntario le da una satisfacción pues de ese modo siente que útil a la sociedad, además el sabe lo importante que es su ayuda pues el paso por una situación difícil en la que un bombero también le salvo la vida.

El sueño de Ángel es contar algún día con un tinglado bien equipado para utilizarlo como taller. En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de aceites y lubricantes de todo tipo para vender, pues cuenta que tiene mucha demanda y le deja un buen margen de ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase engine oil and other lubricants for vehicles.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica  N. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 25 years old, married, and has three children aged one, four, and seven.   Veronica also has three dependents, who live with her because they would otherwise be street children.  In 2001, Veronica  established a café with the help of SELFINA which serves traditional foods made with local ingredients. She now requires a new loan of $350 in order to buy additional kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To buy additional kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria started her own business because she is a very sociable person but is almost always alone; her two children, ages 9 and 5, attend school. She started selling the clothes that no longer fit her children. Upon realizing that sales were good, she decided to sell clothing in order to help herself financially. Her husband is a truck driver who is not able to come home when he travels far distances until he returns to the city with his load, so sometimes she had to wait for his return in order to get funds. Thus, selling clothing has helped her cover the daily household expenses. She started selling clothing to her neighbors approximately 2 years ago. She has now established her business in her porch and opens on weekends.

She needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase clothing and resell it. With your help, she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio porque como casi siempre esta sola ya que sus 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años estan en la escuela, a ella le gusta convivir con la gente, inicio vendiendo la ropa que ya no les quedaban a sus niños y vio que si se la compraban , entonces decidio dedicarse a eso para ayudarse economicamente ya que su esposo es trailero, no podia regresar cuando salia muy lejos de viaje, hasta que regresara con carga nuevamente a la ciudad, habia ocasiones que tenia que esperarse hasta su regreso para tener ingresos, y a ella le ayudo el vender para sacar los gastos diarios de su casa. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años vendiendo a sus vecinos, ahora ya establecio el negocio los fines de semana en el porche de su casa.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de ropa y revenderla. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (apparel)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Santi

texts.id:
Mrs Ni Ketut Santi lives in the village of Berawantangi-Tukadaya. The very tight economy makes supporting her growing family difficult, especially because she must pay for her children's schooling. Because her husband's income as a farmer is not enough to meet her family's needs, Ketut Santi has started to raise pigs at her home. After receiving her first loan, Ketut Santi was able to purchase 1 sow and one piglet for fattening. The sow has since given birth to 10 piglets. By selling the piglets and the fattened pig, Ketut Santi made a profit of 1,500,000 Rupiah in 6 months. With this profit she repaid her first loan and would now like to secure another loan to purchase another sow and pig feed. With this additional sow she hopes to bring in even more profit than she did with her first loan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ni Ketut Santi tinggal disebuah desa di Berawantangi –Tukadaya, dengan kondisi ekonomi yang sangat pas-pasan dan dipersulit lagi dengan kebutuhan keluarga yang tinggi serta ditambah harus menyekolahkan anaknya. Karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, Ketut Santi berusaha menambah penghasilannya dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI serta pembinaan yang cukup, Ketut Santi mampu membeli 1 ekor induk babi dan 1 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Setelah dipelihara, induk babi tersebut melahirkan anak babi sebanyak 10 ekor. Dari penjualan bibit-bibit babi serta babi penggemukan miliknya tersebut Ketut Santi mampu mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Selanjutnya Ketut Santi kembali meminjam ke DINARI untuk menambah modal dari keuntungan yang didapatkan dari pinjaman pertama yang akan digunakannya untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi lagi serta membeli pakannya. Dengan tambahan induk peliharaan diharapkan akan mendatangkan keuntungan yang lebih dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: to purchase a sow and pig feed

loans.name: Asolat

texts.en:
A. Asolat is 49 years old. She is married with two children. 

Asolat has been running her own business for more than ten years. She rents a shop at the center of the town where she sells clothing for women and baby items such as carriages, baby bicycles and different kinds of toys. 

All the goods are delivered by Asolat’s son, who appears in the photo. Asolat and her son are trying to purchase goods of good quality, to sell them for prices acceptable to clients with average levels of income. 

Being a very nice and friendly woman by her nature, Asolat is working hard and trying to serve the clients so that they have a positive experience and want to come back. The business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerably to the family budget. 

Now Asolat is planning to purchase clothing for women in order to increase her range of goods for sale. For this purpose, she requests a loan of $600 for a term of 6 months. She is grateful to everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing to sell

loans.name: José Virgilio

texts.es: El cliente José Virgilio está solicitando  su 4to  refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente en la Escuela César Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 10 años, este cliente tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de  18 años de edad estudia su 5to año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 15 años estudia su 3er año de Educación secundaria,  este cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesto, trabajador: Su esposa es comerciante, viaja a las colonias del Municipio de Nueva Guinea,  ambos comparten con los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia pobre pero unida, este prestamo lo piensa pagar en 2 años y así poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda, viven en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que estos van adquiriendo con AFODENIC, también desea estabilidad laboral y salud para su familia
texts.en:
José Virgilio is soliciting his fourth loan so as to invest in the improvement (construction) of his house. He has been working for ten years as a teacher in the César Augusto Salinas Pinell School. José has two children. The oldest child is 18 years old and is in his fifth year of secondary education. His daughter is 15 years old and is in her third year of secondary education. José is a responsible and honest worker. His wife is a retailer who travels to the Nueva Guinea municipality. Despite being a poor family, they are nonetheless united and thus divide the household costs. They intend on repaying the loan within two years. In the meantime, he intends on improving his home. His family lives in a neighborhood whose population is growing every day. His dream is to improve his home with every loan solicited from AFODENIC. For his future, he wants to maintain a stable job and provide a healthy lifestyle for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his home

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina Q. es una dama que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a la actividad económica de la agricultura en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella desde muy temprano todas las mañanas comienza su actividad económica y a medida que el día avanza en medio del cansancio y del sol siempre continúa esforzándose en su actividad.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de ajonjolí para la siembra y así continuar con su ardua labor en su municipio.
texts.en:
Guillermina Q. is a woman who has been farming in the Somotillo municipality of Chinandega city for a few years. It is important to note that from the early morning hours she begins her work and as the day advances even though tired and in the sun she always continues on with her work. Today she has approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy sesame seed to sew and inthsi way continue her arduous work in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her farming buying seed

loans.name: Yein

texts.en: Yein S. is 37 years old and is a rice farmer who resides with two young children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She typically makes about $3 each day, while her husband works selling coconuts in the village. He owns a motorbike and trailer and transports the coconuts to the village. On average, he makes $10 per day. Yein S. would like to take out a loan of $400 to replace an old motorbike for her husband. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas, and often needs repair, costing a lot of money to maintain.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en: Marleny is a member of the Union II Village Bank.  Marleny is 37 years old and married with one daughter. Marleny sells two different lines of cosmetics by catalogue. She sells on credit to her clients, most of whom are friends, family members, and work associates.  Marleny needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy creams and perfumes.  Marleny’s dreams are to build her own house, provide her children with a good future, and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy creams and perfumes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
A 51-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, earnestly watches her fishpond. Carmelita E., married with 4 children, grows "bangus" (milkfish) in their pond.  Her husband who is a fisherman also takes charge of their business.  Their son-in-law works for them as support. The business is inherited from Carmelita's parents. It's a family business that has been handed down for generations.  She humbly said that the elders have passed down techniques on how to enjoy the business and at the same time make earnings from it. But it's a fact in a business that there are ups and downs. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. Jackpot!, she said when the "bangus" grew nicely.  They bring their produce to nearby Calamba Town Market.  

But the couple sees a good opportunity to expand their business. They wanted to utilize another section of pond. They are requesting PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to be used for additional bangus and to purchase fish feed as well.

They deeply wish to pass the business to their kids and have fishponds on their own. And if time permits, pass it to their children's children as well.

loans.use: To invest in "bangus" (milkfish) for her fishpond

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат отец троих детей , возраст 36 лет работает колхозником в колхозе.Жена домохозяйка, помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Сам Шавкат очень любит заниматься купля продажей мелкорогатого скота.Он кредитуется уже третий год в Микроинвесте. Сейчас у него кроме баранов имеются ещё две коровы.Для закупа корма для скота и ещё двух дойных коров он хочет получить 3000 сомони.Сейчас на рынке скот подешевел, поэтому скотоводы хотят приобрести скот.
texts.en:
Shavkat is 36 years old and the father of three children. He works as a rancher on a kolkhoz, a collective farm. His wife, a housewife, helps him care for the cattle. Shavkat himself really loves the buying and selling of small-horned cattle, and this is the third year he has had a loan with MicroInvest. In addition to rams, he now has two cows. Shavkat wants to take out a loan of $875 (approximately 3000 somoni) in order to buy feed for the cattle and two more dairy cows. The market price of cattle has dropped, so it is a good time for ranchers to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Laura Segura

texts.es:
Laura Segura B. es una señora de 39 años vecina de una pequeña comunidad rural montañosa de Costa Rica llamada San Cristóbal Norte. En su comunidad se desarrollan actividades como la producción de café, hortalizas, así como el comercio y la producción de artesanías. Laura lleva 20 años casada y tiene tres hijos: Adriana de 19, Karen de 17 y Kevin de 14 años. Los tres son estudiantes. Cuando se casaron su esposo era un agricultor y ella se dedicaba a las labores del hogar. 
Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida buscaron alternativas diferentes y desde hace 15 años iniciaron juntos un negocio de confección de ropa. Al principio no conocían nada del negocio así que fueron experimentando poco a poco. Actualmente doña Laura elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores con ayuda de su esposo. Su negocio ha hecho que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado mucho. La principal satisfacción para ella es haber logrado que todos sus hijos puedan estudiar.
Doña Laura forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un total de 10 micro-préstamos que le han permitido crecer como empresaria y atender las necesidades de su hogar. Todo esto le ha permitido mejorar su autoestima al pasar de ser una persona dedicada a las labores del hogar a ser una empresaria. 
Actualmente doña Laura requiere un préstamo de 1.200 dólares para comprar una máquina especial (marca Kober). Esta máquina le permitirá hacer ruedos en blusas, camisetas y otras prendas de vestir. Con esta inversión espera poder aumentar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los productos. Doña Laura dice que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer mejores opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Laura Segura B. is 39 years old and lives near a small, rural, mountain community in Costa Rica called San Cristóbal Norte. In her town the people work in such activities as coffee production, vegetable farming, commerce, and the production of crafts. Laura has been married for 20 years and has three children: Adriana, who is 19, Karen, who is 17, and Kevin, who is 14. All three are students. When they got married, her husband was a farmer and she worked in the home. They hoped to improve their living conditions, so they looked for alternatives. Fifteen years ago they started a business making clothes. At first they didn’t know anything about the business, so they experimented bit by bit. Now, Laura makes different types of clothing and sells it to businesses in the community and nearby towns, with the help of her husband. The business has greatly improved her family’s living conditions. Her greatest satisfaction is the fact that all of their children are able to study. Laura is part of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) (Communal Credit Enterprise of San Cristóbal Norte), one of the 100 EDESA partner organizations in Costa Rica. As a member, she has received a total of 10 micro loans, which have allowed her to grow as an entrepreneur and to provide for her household’s needs. All of this has allowed her to improve her self-esteem, as she has gone from being a homemaker to a business owner. Laura is currently requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to buy a special sewing machine (Kober brand). This sewing machine will allow her to make hems in blouses, t-shirts, and other clothing items. With this investment, she hopes to increase her production and improve the quality of her products. Laura says that thanks to this loan, she will be able to offer better options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a special sewing machine (Kober brand)

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 31-year-old married man with two young children, living in Ouzai in Beirut suburbs. He used to work in a linen shop since 1999, and opened his first shop in 2002. Today, Haitham is requesting $1,000 in order to improve the shop's decoration.

loans.use: Improve the shop's decoration

loans.name: Diama 2 Group

texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/oussouye.php

We’ve had a loan that enabled us to get started in commerce and the renting out of bicycles in our eco-village. Demand is stronger and stronger, and we live in an area where traveling on bikes is easier, due to paths that lead towards surrounding villages. With the first loan, we began marketing and renting mountain bikes to tourists, who prefer this mode of travel for exploring the most remote corners of our area that they couldn’t usually reach with a car.

But for a time now, thanks to the first loan that Kiva granted us, we are managing with difficulty to cope with the demand, which is leading us to augment our capacity to meet the demand through increasing the number of bikes available for renting and also for selling, since the demand for buying is much greater. With the first loan, we managed to resolve the problem of our children’s schooling costs. And we wish to expand our commerce. This is why we have come to request a renewal of our financing, since we’ve finished paying back the first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycles and spare parts

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Mrs. Merlyn D., from Blancia, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, is asking Paglaum MPC for a loan of 14,000 PHP to scale up her palay trading business. She is 45 years old and married with 3 kids. Merlyn and her husband work together to earn their means of living. She admit that the ups and downs of their business are not easy to handle.  It requires hard work and patience. She has high hopes for her children to fulfill their dreams and for them to own land to grow rice someday.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of palay to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria Isabel P. es una mujer que desde muy  joven se ha dedicado ayudar a su mama, y con deseos de superación opto por poner su propio negocio de venta de tortilla. Tiene 47 años de edad y reside en el barrio Comarca la Hoyada de la Iglesia Católica  2 kilómetros al Sur. Su esposo trabaja como jardinero en una casa particular, tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales tres trabajan y la menor estudia contabilidad, lleva doce años palmeando tortillas ricas para los nicaragüenses, con este crédito quiere comprar maíz, leña y frijoles ya que también vende frijoles cosidos que se venden bastante. A futuro espera crecer mas, captar clientes y poder ofertar sus productos a más restaurante para obtener mejores ingresos, a si como ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is a woman who, from a very young age, dedicated herself to helping her mother. From her desire to succeed, she opted to start her own business selling tortillas. She is 47 years old and lives in the La Hoyada region of the Iglesia Católica, 2 kilometers to the South. Her husband works as a gardener at a private home and she has four children, three of whom work and the youngest one is studying accounting. She has been making delicious tortillas for Nicaraguans for twelve years. With this credit, she would like to purchase corn, wood, and beans, given she also sells baked beans that sell very well. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, capture more customers, and be able to offer her products to more restaurants to augment her income, as well as to help her daughter with her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, wood, and beans.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe G. vive en pequeña isla llamada Tasajera ubicada en el departamento de La Paz, Felipe está casado y tiene dos hijos que aun están estudiando, en La Isla donde vive Felipe las principales fuentes de ingresos de las familias es gracias a la pesca que se da mucho en la zona, es por ello que Felipe se dedica a la venta de mariscos; también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien aporta económicamente para los gastos de la familia. Felipe solicita este crédito como capital de trabajo que le ayudara con la comercialización de los mariscos.
texts.en:
Felipe G. lives on a small island called Tasajera located in the department of La Paz. Felipe is married and has two schoolgoing children. On the island where Felipe lives the main income sources of the families are fishing which is very popular in that area, and therefore Felipe sells seafood for a living. He can also count on economic support from his wife to cover the family expenses. Felipe requests a loan to be used as work capital to help him market his seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

location.town: La Herradura,  departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba H. is married and has three children. She has not received any formal education. Aba's husband is a trader, but his income is too small to care for the family. Since 2003 Aba has operated a small chop bar in Abura, where she cooks rice and stew. She uses her earnings to pay her children's school fees and to buy food for the family. Aba will use her loan to buy rice, oil, tomatoes and other ingredients so that she can increase the amount of food she cooks and sells. With the new profits from her expanded trade, Aba plans to both reinvest in her business and save in the Susu savings scheme.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, tomatoes and other ingredients

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy B. is the mother of three children, all daughters, who are all currently in the primary school. She is thirty years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm while she is a food vendor.

Mercy fries doughnuts in her community. She supplies to other retailers and sells the rest by hawking (selling door-to-door). Mercy buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients, such as cooking oil, in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi N. is 42 years old and she is married with 6 children. She sells provisions at retail. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions for resale

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 2 Group

texts.en:
Yessenia R. (far left) has created a living selling shampoo, makeup, and other Avon beauty products from her home near Samaná, Dominican Republic. Living with her husband and three children, ages 13, 11 and 8, Yessenia travels to Santo Domingo to buy the products which she sells. Currently on her eighth loan cycle, Yessenia has faithfully repaid loans for more than three years. With the support of her husband, she has seen her fledgling business grow since she received her first loan with Esperanza.

Yessenia, previous to her loans with Esperanza, was selling clothing to those in her local area. However, finding it difficult to sell these for a good profit margin, and due to slow sales in general, she sought to change her business with her new loan. She then changed to buying her own Avon products – the shampoo, makeup, rings, etc. – and selling them locally. This way, she gets to be flexible with the products she delivers to her customers, and is able to make a better profit margin when she buys the products directly from Santo Domingo.

With these extra profits, Yessenia has been able to improve the quality of living for herself, her husband and her children. She can buy extra food and has been able to pay for unexpected medical bills. Without this financial security, sudden medical bills many times can be extremely hard to overcome, and Yessenia has been able to pay them when needed.

In the future, Yessenia first is seeking to grow her business, and to incluD. different products for sale, such as incorporating some of the clothing sales she maD. in the past and adding in more beauty products than she currently offers. With this income, she hopes to continue to proviD. for her family and support her children as they get older.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Buy additional shampoo, makeup, rings and other beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other agricultural inputs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 51 years old and is married with one child. She has a small grocery store. Her husband works as a driver at the Ministry of Transport. Mercedes and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.

Mercedes has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for ten years and is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Natividad.”  Mercedes used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to invest in her grocery store and will do the same with this loan of 2,700 soles.  She plans to purchase products and soft drinks to sell at her store.  

Mercedes has enjoyed working with Manuela Ramos.  She appreciates the fact that the organization not only gives loans, but also informs its borrowers about women’s rights and other topics.  Mercedes’ goal is to have a larger business and to eventually begin selling her products wholesale.

loans.use: To buy items to sell at her store

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
B. Jennifer is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children, all of whom are her dependents. She has a drug shop business in Kanyarugiri that she has been running for 8 years. She has strategically positioned her business to enable her to make more money as long as she has the necessary stock.

She hopes to turn her drug shop into a pharmacy and to have a happy and educated family. At the moment, she makes 150,000/= in profits, and she would like to increase this. She needs a loan to help buy more stock for her drug shop to avoid a shortage. She is really determined to prosperous.

loans.use: Buy more drugs for her shop

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Ester is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Ester owns makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. Ester has been in business for over 17 years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ester is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ester from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Maurielle

texts.fr: A. Maurielle est mariée à KIFOULI Prosper, un chauffeur. Maurielle et Prosper ont trois enfants tous encore à leur charge. Maurielle et sa famille vivent à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis huit ans. Maurielle est couturière mais en plus de la couture elle vend des articles de mercerie et des tissus ainsi que des fournitures scolaires. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Maurielle s'approvisionne en ces différents produits et les vend chez elle à la maison à son atelier de couture. Pour mieux développer son atelier de couture et élever le niveau de ses services, Maurielle sollicite un crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Maurielle A. is married to Prosper Kifouli, a driver. Maurielle and Prosper have three children, all of whom are still in their care. Maurielle and her family have lived in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, for eight years. Maurielle is a seamstress, but in addition to that, she sells dressmaking and tailoring supplies and fabric as well as school supplies. It is at Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, that Maurielle obtains her supplies of these different products, which she sells at home in her dressmaking shop. To further develop her shop and raise the level of her services, Maurielle is seeking a loan through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and dressmaking/tailoring supplies

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Our client is Gabriela. She is part of a communal bank consisting of 26 members in Cusco. The group is called El Amanecer, which means "daybreak" in Spanish.  She is from Siquani, and lives in Cusco. She is 28 years old and is single.

She has been an early education teacher for the past 3 years, and was a teacher’s assistant for 5 years before that.  She also has a side business selling educational wall adornments for classrooms and children’s rooms. Since Christmas is coming up, she is also selling Christmas decorations. With this loan, she will buy more wall adornments and decorative items to sell.

Gabriela appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more educational wall adornments and Christmas decorations to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other products

loans.name: Sherimar

texts.en:
Sherimar M.'s main source of income comes from selling cosmetics and apparel products from Avon in her community. She is a 28-year-old married woman from the village of San Manuel. Sherimar has been in her business for many years now and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Sherimar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sherimar has successfully repaid her previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dany

texts.es:
