Dany es un joven de 18 años, vive junto a sus padres: Luis de 50 años y Rosa de 42, y con sus 8 hermanos que ayudan con la economía de su hogar como él, a pesar de sus pocos años.
Él se dedica al cultivo de plátanos y café en su chacra propia, la cual su madre le cedió como parte de la división de tierras entre todos sus hermanos. Desde muy pequeño quiso ayudar a sus padres, pero éstos le decían que debía crecer, por ello empezó a ayudarlos desde que tenía 11 años por voluntad propia, y le gustó mucho hacerlo, además se dio cuenta que las propinas crecían y las ganancias eran muy buenas. Hoy sabe que mientras mayor tiempo le dedique a su chacra, mejor será la producción y obtendrá mejores ganancias. 
Este joven agricultor tiene muchas metas por cumplir: quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad, lograr estudiar dos profesiones (agronomía y administración) en la ciudad, pues ambas le gustan y quisiera ejercerlas en la zona donde vive, ya que tiene las esperanzas de que esta parte de la selva del Perú surgirá como una de las mejores productoras de frutas y café.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual y responsable como en todo lo que hace, porque según él dice: “la juventud no es motivo para ser desganado”.  El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Dany is a young man who is 18 years old and lives with his parents, Luis (age 50) and Rosa (age 42). He has 8 siblings who also help with the household expenses even though they are young.

Dany grows bananas and coffee on his own property, which his mother gave him as part of the land that was divided among all of the siblings. His parents have helped him since he was a young boy, but then they told him that he needed to grow up. They began helping him when Dany was 11 years old and he approached them for their assistance. He really enjoyed farming and also realized the profits were good and that his parents provided him with good advice. Today, Dany knows that the more time he devotes to his farm, the better his production improves and the greater profits he is able to achieve.

This young farmer has many goals he wants to complete: growing larger quantities of crops and taking classes in the city for two trades (agriculture and administration, since wants to be able to do both). He hopes that this part of the Peruvian jungle will emerge as one of the top producers of both fruit and coffee.

This is his first loan with MFP. Dany promises to be punctual and responsible in everything he does. He says, “Youth is no reason to become apathetic.” The money he requested will be used to purchase compost and fertilizers for maintaining his land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her four children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her elder two daughters are in university and her younger two sons are in a local secondary school. She and her family live in Mongolian traditional tent called a "ger." Dolgorsuren operates a consumer goods trading business at the local market in her town. She sells a variety of household and consumer goods out of a rented stall.  In 2002, Dolgorsuren started her business by selling small household items such as socks, scotch and brushes with capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). She has found success with her business and has stable earnings. Now her working capital exceeds 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD). Her profits have enabled her to provide financial stability for her family. For the future, Dolgorsuren says, "I want to expand my business and hope to one day own my own shop." She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase new products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase small items

loans.name: Nelsa Dith's Group

texts.en:
Nelsa Dith E. is from the village of Minsubong in Tangub City. She is 32 years old. Nelsa Dith is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nelsa Dith is single. To make a living, Nelsa Dith sells "uling" (charcoal) in the local community. Nelsa Dith has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nelsa Dith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Nelsa Dith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Nelsa Dith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to buy more charcoal to sell. This will be Nelsa Dith's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of foodstuffs and other products

loans.name: Raquel Ivania

texts.es:
La señora Raquel Ivania es trabajadora de una tienda donde se vende y se elaboran vestidos de damas para toda ocasión destacándose como estilista esta tienda es en Esteli.
Raquel va usar el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción. Ella espera que con la compra de los materiales pueda construir un cuarto de las siguientes medida de 4 metros ancho por 4 metros largos.
Raquel es casada y tiene dos hijos  a su cargo ambos en edad escolar.
Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel Raquel dice que sus créditos han sido de mucha importancia ya que ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel Ivania works in a store where they sell and make women’s clothing for all occasions and she stands out as a stylist in this store that is in Esteli.

Raquel will use the loan to buy construction materials. She hopes that by buying the materials she will be able to build a room of the following measurements: 4 meters wide by 4 meters long.

Raquel is married and has 2 children under her care, both are of school age.

This is her second loan with Ceprodel (Kiva’s field partner), Raquel says that the loans have been very important and they have improved her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials like:  sand, bricks, tiles, cement, zinc, iron, etc.

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cereza lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la joven Linda Urania F. López quien como muchas jóvenes nicaragüenses son madres y padre para sus hijos. Ella con tan solo quince años tuvo que aprender a ser estudiante, madre y comerciante lo cual ha logrado durante estos seis años.  F. se dedica a la venta de cerdo y todos sus derivados como nacatamales, frito, chicharro, moronga en fin platos típicos a base de este animal.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María Milagros A. M. vende café, cigarros, galletas, bombones entre otros productos y María Leonida Galán comercializa platanitos, frescos y helados desde hace 19 años.
texts.en:
The Cereza (Cherry) Group consists of three hard-working women, including Linda Urania F. López, a young woman who like many Nicaraguans her age is a parent to children. In only 15 years she had to learn how to be a student, a mother and a merchant, a job she has been doing for the past six years. Linda makes a living selling pork in all varieties, such as tamales, fried pork, rinds, sausage in typical regional dishes. The other members are María Milagros A. M., who sells coffee, cigars, cookies and chocolates, among other products, and María Leonida Galán, who has sold plantains, sweets and ice creams for the past 19 years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Francisco Daniel

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la cuidad de león trabaja en el instituto señor de esquipulas telica, en el area de computación,  soltero
texts.en:
This client is a native of León. He is a computer teacher in the Señor de Esquípulas institute. He is single.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair a roof

loans.name: Shittu

texts.en: Shittu is 45 years old, married with 4 children. She is a hard-working women and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. She sells powder, perfume, tailoring materials, etc. With businesses, she hopes to assist her husband with the basic needs of her immediate family. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more powder, perfume, and tailoring materials. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more powder, perfume, tailoring materials, etc.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: EL SR. ADRIAN ESTA CASADO TIENE UN HIJITA PEQUEÑA, SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE YA HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 8 AÑOS INICIALMENTE COMENZO COMO AYUDANTE DE CHOFER, LUEGO CHOFER DE OCASIÓN LUEGO PASO A SER CHOFER ASALARIADO DURANTE 6 AÑOS, TIEMPO DURANTE EL CUAL PUDO AHORRAR DINERO PARA COMPRARSE UN VEHICULO PROPIO, EL CUAL EN ESTE MOMENTO NECESITA UNA REPARACION Y MANTENIMIENTO ES PARA ELLO QUE EL NECESITA ESTE CREDITO, SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA A LABORES DE CASA, EL SOLO  MANTIENE EL HOGAR RAZON POR LA CUAL TRABAJA TODO EL DIA, VIVE EN CASA EN ALQUILER Y UNO DE SUS DESEOS ES EL DE COMPRARSE UNA CASITA Y PODER IR A VIVIR CON TODA SU FAMILIA, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y DINAMICA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDR Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Adrian is married and has a young daughter. He has been working in transportation for some 8 years. He began as a driver's helper, then as a part-time driver, and for the last 6 years he has worked as a full-time salaried driver. During these 6 years he saved up to buy his own vehicle, which now needs to be repaired and maintained. This is why he needs the loan. Adrian's wife works at home, and since Adrian's salary is the only source of income for the household he works all day long. They currently live in a rented house and one of Adrian's dreams is to buy a little house where his family could live. He is a responsible and energetic person and is very thankful to Kiva and Emprender [the Kiva field partner] for the confidence they have placed in him by granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy P. lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She was born in 1976. She and her husband, Mr. Nak Kak, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables that they sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile and it is a long way from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sophy P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a small restaurant and purchase food products

loans.name: Fru

texts.en:
Born in 1945, Fru A. is married to Nangah Frida and they have brought forth eight children. As a man who does not like to look too much on the wife for all the family needs, and finding it so difficult to accomplished this task as man who should be the breadwinner of the family, he joined GHAPE in 1998.

Fru has been having a lot of marital problems with his family. This has made him sad all the time but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive. His desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small for his children.

Fru’s inability to get investment capital, which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs, is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE. Given the loan, he plans to sell motor spare parts. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site and he has a good sales boy who has sold for him for several years.

Fru plans to use the profits generated to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family.

 The first installment will be paid on the fourth month from date of disbursement.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.

Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina M. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, cassava tubers and Irish potatoes and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and onions to sell. Rejina is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is an electrician. She has no children yet and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase undergarments, hangers, brushes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two high-speed floor machines and a carpet cleaner

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr .Daniel es de la ciudad de Acahay, vive en compañía  de su esposa Sra. Liza Martínez y juntos tienen una hija menor de edad.

    Hace varios años que se dedica a la venta y distribución de remedios naturales en los diferentes mercados de diferentes ciudades.

        Comenta que es un trabajo que le genera  muy buen ingreso  ya que ellos mismos son los encargados de la venta, también manifiesta que gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación al trabajo van  mejorando  su calidad de vida.
Actualmente viven en una casa alquilada y tienen un capital ahorrado por lo que solicita el préstamo para completar la suma que les falta para el pago de un terreno.
texts.en:
Daniel is from the city of Acahay and he lives with his wife, Sra Liza Martínez and their young daughter. For various years, Daniel has worked selling natural remedies in different markets in different cities. He says this job has provided him with a good income because they themselves are responsible for the sales. He also says that thanks to his sacrifice and dedication, he and his family have improved their quality of life. Right now he and his family live in a rented home and they have some savings. They are asking for a loan to make a down payment on a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying land

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 63 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija Norma de 25 años y su nieta Melani de 4 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días Manuela trabaja en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra plátano y café, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que puedan perjudicar su siembra. Para el futuro espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción actual. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Manuela is 63 years old. She is a very sincere and hard working woman. She lives in her own home together with her beloved daughter, Norma, who is 25 years old and her granddaughter Melani, who is 4 year sold. They are her reason for all her efforts. Every day Manuela works in her plantations. With a great deal of effort she has managed to make her fields very productive and she now grows all kinds of produce, making sure that all her products are of excellent quality. Her main products are bananas and coffee, these are the products that are in greatest demand in the La Merced markets. What she likes best about her work is making sure her plantations are free of pests that may harm the harvest. In the future she hopes to have more land to increase her harvest. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the development of her business. Within her community bank group she is a very responsible woman, a source of great pride for her. The two thousand nuevos soles that she requests will be invested in the improvement of her cultivation, and to purchase more fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan Jebet

texts.en:
Susan is a 38-year-old mother of four and married to Mr. K. who is a businessman. She has been in the used clothes business for 18 years now and has a good number of customers who keep returning to check on new arrivals and make purchases. She makes a profit of more than 10,000 KES every month and from it she has been able to support her family.
Susan learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a friend who is also a KADET client. This is her second loan with KADET and she plans to use it to buy additional stock such as jackets, dresses and curtains to ensure a continued supply to her customers. Her future plan is to own a big second-hand wholesale business and supply others who are in the business of used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio Antonio tiene 27 años, tiene 1 hijos a su cargo. El dio inicio a su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general porque es un padre responsable. Trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche de lunes a sábados y esta persistencia logra resultados, por eso recupera su inversión, pero no responde rápidamente a sus clientes porque no tiene un capital adicional, pues sale  a vender en los mercados que es donde tiene mayor cantidad de clientes nuevos cada día, con este crédito quiere realizar la compra de bolsos, calzados, cosméticos, ropa en general y otros encargos. Su sueño es aumentar los ingresos del negocio, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mauricio Atonio is 27 years old and he has a son in his care. He started out his business selling general store items because he is a responsible father. He works from 8 in the morning until 9 at night from Mondays to Saturdays, and this hard work has yielded good results. He is able to recover his investment but he is not able to quickly respond to client demands. He doesn't have additional capital funds. He goes out to the markets to sell where he is able to capture new clients every day. With this loan he will purchase purses, shoes, cosmetics, general clothing items and other special orders. His dream is to improve the profits from his business, to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle P. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business. She lives in Pasil, Brgy. Malabugas, Bayawan, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Annabelle is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase feeds and vitamins for the pigs she is raising. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Annabelle aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Karina Desiree

texts.es:
Karina de 36 años, tiene un pequeño puesto de cabinas telefónicas. Vive con sus tres hijos en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por la necesidad económica y debido a que su esposo lo mataron y la dejo con tres niños pequeños que aun estudian en escuelas fiscales se vio en la necesidad de invertir todos sus ahorros en unas cabinas telefónicas. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene un centro de llamadas que le ha ayudado ha mantener a su familia. Trabaja desde muy temprano con una empleada que le ayuda cuando ella tiene que ir atender a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar recargas para celulares y una copiadora. En el futuro quiere comprar computadoras para tener un Cyber.
texts.en:
Karina, age 36, has a small phone booth business. She lives with her three children along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a periurban area surrounded by a salt marsh).

Out of financial necessity resulting from the death of her husband, Karina decided to invest all of her savings in a few phone booths in order to support her three young children who were attending public schools. This turned out to be a good decision because she now has a call center that helps to support her family. She starts work very early and has one employee who helps her whenever she has to leave to take care of her children.

With this loan, Karina wants to buy rechargeable phone cards for mobile phones and a photocopier. In the future, she wants to buy computers in order to start a cybercafé.

loans.use: Purchase rechargeable phone cards & a photocopier

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Felix Antonio P. M. tiene 25 anos. Vive en Unión Libre,  vive con la compañera y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1  hijo de 3 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Felix trabaja en la bananera como Paletizador y enfundador  en la hacienda, trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Antonio P. M. is 25 years old.  His is in a common-law marriage, and he lives with his life partner and son.  They live in the Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos canton in the Los Ríos province,  He has a three year old child.

The members of the Dole 2 Communal Bank are agricultural workers.  They work on the Dole banana farm, which is located in the center of the canton.  All of the members live in the Ventanas Cantón.  Most of the members have worked on the farm for over one year, and their activities are related to the farm. There are approximately 13 members.

Felix works on the banana farm as a bag packer and pallet stacker.  He has worked there for one year.  He makes his purchases in the Cooperative Store 1 in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to put a business in his house, adapt the place, and buy products for his business.  The help from the loan will help him supply the necessities.  His dream is to improve his house and reach the goal of the business.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: Business in his house and to adapt the place

loans.name: Santos Natividad

texts.es: Santos Natividad tiene 26 años es una joven muy luchadora. Su negocio es una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que ha sido un gran avance. Inicio con fondos propios pues tiene que mantener a su hijo y esposa que viven con él. La mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar materia prima necesaria. La competencia que tiene es muy fuerte pero esto no le impide el mejorar el servicio y brindar los mejores precios.
texts.en: Santos Natividad is 26-years-old and is a young man who fights to get ahead.  His business is a small grocery store.  This is not the first time that he has taken out loans and it has helped him to advance.  He began with his own funds, but he has to support his son and his wife who live with him.  The majority of his customers request a great variety of products from him and because of this he is requesting this loan with the goal of purchasing the necessary supplies.  His competition is very strong, but this doesn’t stop him from improving the service he offers and offering the best prices.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
el señor Omar O. es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su trabajo, se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanias de madera, distribuye su producto a tiendas y suvenirs de San Pedro Sula, Tegucigalpa y Choluteca, tambien vende a comerciantes individuales, Omar tiene su taller en su casa de habitacion, trabaja muy 
fuerte para sacar adelante a su familia. Omar trabaja de lunes sabado y se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para terminar los pedidos que le hacen cada semana.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para la elaboracion de sus artesanias.
ya que es epoca de navidad muchos turistas ingresan a nuestro pais y ellos son los clientes mas fuertes que hay.
texts.en:
Omar O. is a very hard-working person who is committed to his work.  He makes handicrafts from wood and distributes his products to stores and souvenir places in San Pedro Sula, Tegucigalpa and Choluteca.  He also sells to individual salespeople.

Omar's workshop is in his home.  He works very hard to get his family ahead.  Omar works from Monday to Saturday.  He gets up at 4 o'clock in the morning to finish the orders that he has every week.  He will use his loan to buy materials that he needs to make his handicrafts since a lot of tourists come to our country during the Christmas period and they are the most important customers that there are.

loans.use: To buy wood, adhesive, sealant, sandpaper, oil, screws, nuts, nails and tacks

loans.name: Lucerito 1 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the group "Lucerito 1" which translates to "Guiding light".  The group is in Los Alcarrizos which is located north of the city of Santo Domingo which is a very industrialized city with a large population.  Los Alcarrizos is dependent on the companies and economy of Santo Domingo.  Like in many other cities, Los Alcarrizos has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and includes a Dominican population as well as a population of Haitian immigrants. 

Carmen is dedicate to the art of creating things, like jewel.  She make rings, necklaces, bracelets and other creative things.  She is the mother of two children.  Her biggest challenge is to become a designer and to expand her art so that it can be known in other places.  She likes to create things.

Carmen is very happy to be receiving her fourth loan with field partner Esperanza Internacional.  With this loan she hopes to be able to get ahead and to have a successful business.  She plans on investing her loan in purchasing various materials like thread and accessories to make different styles of jewelry.  She plans on using her profits for her house and to improve her designs.

loans.use: To buy thread, jewels, etc.

loans.name: María Cumanda

texts.es:
La Señora María O. es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad cuenta con la belleza de sus paisajes que se mezclan entre lo colonial y lo moderno, sus 4 ríos que la bañan hacen de esta una ciudad única, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
 
La Señora María tiene 58 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, e casados y viven independientes. Su esposo no se encuentra en el país, ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María tiene un local en donde se dedica a la venta de bisutería, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años, labora desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche  de lunes a sábados.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 11 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio y hogar, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio. Su meta es  prosperar mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María O. is a member of the Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) Community Bank. She lives in the Totoracocha neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca which is renowned for beautiful scenery, its mixture of colonial and modern architecture, its unique four rivers, as well as its wonderful food beloved by locals and foreigners alike.

Sra. María is 58 years old, married, and has three adult children who are married and have left home. Her husband does not live in the country but has left in search of better work opportunities. She does not own her house but lives in rented accommodation.
 
María runs a stall selling jewelry, a business she began five years ago. She works from 9am to 7pm Monday through Saturday. She has been a member of her bank for eleven years, and the loans have helped her greatly with her business and home. The money from this loan will be used to buy more merchandise for her business. Her goal is to have a much more prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel A. López tiene un negocio de abarrotes y Snake  llamado “Angel” con una antigüedad de 3 años donde ofrece Botanas, dulces, refrescos, latería, abarrotes, tortas nachos y burritos. En este momento el recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en  dinero para poder surtir su negocio y así seguir ofreciendo mas calidad a su clientes.
texts.en: Angel A. L. has had a convenience store named "Angel" for the past 3 years. He sells snacks, sweets, soft drinks, milk products, general groceries, hamburgers, nachos, and burritos.  He has approached the organization for financial support in order to supply his business and to provide his clients with quality service.

loans.use: To add inventory to his business.

loans.name: Maria Erma

texts.es:
La señora Maria Erma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene  39 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva varios años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad, cuenta con 16 motokares, las cuales cada motokar  tiene un personal, que lo hace trabajar a diario.  Maria Erma, recibe  un ingreso de 350.00 nuevos soles diariamente.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Maria Erma, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Maria Erma belongs to the Esmeralda Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District of the San Martin Province within the Department of San Martin. She is 39 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of two children who are students and are still her dependents.

She has worked for many years providing urban transportation services in her motorcar. Her husband is responsible for going to different places in the city. She has 16 motorcars, each of which has a driver who works daily. Maria Erma earns 350 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) each day.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will purchase spare parts and oils such as lubricants, steering wheel hubs, and spark plugs in order to provide better service and tend to the customers much better. Today, she is an independent woman and it is her and her husband who make the decisions and manage their business.

Maria Erma tells us that belonging to a women’s group has helped her to better know her rights and together, they make themselves respected. She is grateful for Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to begin in the area of business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and oils to improve her service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy more pharmaceutical supplies for resale and to make repairs to his shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Maria Auxiliadora tiene 36 años. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general. Por lo que siempre ha buscado como ganarse el alimento diario. Es una Señora con espíritu emprendedor y cada uno de sus clientes disfruta del buen humor de Maria. En la comercialización de ropa, es ayudada por sus 2 hijos, ya que entrega a domicilio la mercadería, tanto en la ciudad como en algunas comarcas.  Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y calzado. El mayor sueño que ella tiene es satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora, 36, has been selling general merchandise for over four years.  She has always sought ways to earn her daily bread.  She is a woman with an enterprising spirit and every one of her customers enjoys Maria’s good humor.  She works selling clothes, helped by her two children, door to door both in the city and in some of the outlying areas.

She is asking for the loan for working capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts and shoes.  Her greatest dream is to meet every customer’s need.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Take And Pay Group

texts.en:
Rugie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Rugie was born in the town of Moyamba, in southern Sierra Leone, about 33 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children, one in primary school and two in secondary school. 

Rugie sells ready-to-wear-clothes: shirts, skirts, baby clothes, etc., and has been managing this business for many years now. 

This is the first loan that Rugie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Rugie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A. lives in the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is married and the mother of four adult children. 

To make a living, Dionesia has been selling seafood for more than 22 years, earning a monthly income of 5,600 PHP. She works very  hard so that she has been able to retain her business up to now. 

In 2007, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Dionesia has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 30,000. She is now requesting her eighth loan in the amount of PHP 35,000, which will be used to purchase more fish to sell and for the expansion of her business.   

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell for the expansion also of her business

loans.name: Tsendjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Tsendjargal, 24 years old, lives with his wife and only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son attends a kindergarten. Tsendjargal’s wife, Tumendolgor, 24, is an orphan and she carries the duty to look after her three younger sisters.

Tsendjargal runs a shoe retail business in the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. He works all year round and it is very hard to stay outdoors all day long, especially in the winter, because the average winter day temperature is minus 25 degrees Celsius. He has been running this business for 5 years has gained a lot of experience in the shoe sale market. Tsendjargal is planning to expand his business by enlarging his stall and increasing his working capital. Therefore, he needs to rent one more neighboring stall and to fill it with shoe products. He will use this loan to buy more summer shoes to increase his inventory and to pay for his first stall rental payment.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for the summer season and to enlarge his stall.

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille B. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Lurcille is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lurcille owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines & milk fish in the local community. Lurcille has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lurcille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lurcille has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lurcille is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Lurcille from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg is a 28-year-old widow who lives with her two children in a house in Hentii province, Mongolia. Her older son goes to a local secondary school while younger one is in kindergarten. 

She manages a meat-trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2009 and is planning to continue it in the future. Now her daily business earning is 60,000 - 110,000 MNT. She has managed to build a strong customer base and has become a very experienced businesswoman. 

In addition to her meat-trading business, she also operates a transportation service in order to supplement her earnings. 

She is an honest and hardworking lady who says, "My business is the only income for my family. So I will work hard to expand my business in the future." 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase many sheep for her meat-trading business.

loans.use: To purchase many sheep.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Myrna has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & biscuits. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Myrna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Myrna hopes to her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La Sra  Perla tiene 38 años, tiene 2 hijos colegiantes. Empezó vendiendo pescado como 10 años y luego viajo a España por 2 años y luego regreso para poner el copetin donde vende todo lo que sea pescado.
Ella se considera una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Tiene gran creatividad en la elaboracion de todo tipo de platillos con pescado.
El sueño de la sra Perla es que su hijos sean unos grandes profesionales, y no quiere que sigan sus mismos pasos ya que considera que una vida muy sacrificada, ya que en el comedor donde trabaja se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y empieza la actividad. Su trabajo no tiene fin de semanas ni feriados, es por eso que ella se sacrifica por sus hijos,para que no pasen por eso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado y demas ingredientes para sus platillos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pearl is 38 years old and has two college age children. She has been selling fish for the past ten years. Before that she traveled to Spain for two years. When she returned she started a café where she sells all types of fish. 
Pearl is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She creatively prepares all types of fish dishes. Mrs. Pearl dreams that her children will be professionals. She doesn’t want them to follow in her footsteps, as she has had to make many sacrifices in life. She wakes up very early in order to work in her café. Her work doesn’t stop on weekends or holidays. This is how she makes sacrifices so that her children do not have to work this way.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for her dishes.

loans.use: to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for the dishes that she prepares.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is married and the mother of five children: four sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a painter and paints walls, buildings, etc., while her second son works with his father at his restaurant. Her remaining three children are getting their education attending a local school. 

Khursheed's husband runs a Punjabi food restaurant in the nearby market. He is expert at making Punjabi food and has a good number of clients who come to his restaurant daily for food. Khursheed herself is a housewife. She stays at her home and carries out her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband by preparing food for his restaurant. 

Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband improve his business. With this loan, he will buy the required ingredients to be able to prepare better quality food and also buy some chairs and tables to provide better seating for his clients. He has been in this business for the past many years and Khursheed is optimistic about the growth of her husband’s business after this loan investment. She is a regular Asasah client and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy required ingredients, chairs and tables for a restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.


She is 32 years old and has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with selling groceries.  She sells basic need items like rice, sugar, milk, oil and noodles.  She works from 8am until 6pm and is able to support her children through this business.  She wants to expand her grocery store and is asking for a loan to buy such products as rice, sugar, oil and milk.


She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: A married parent of two children, Editha works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling meat. Editha  is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities with her past 20 loans from NWTF. Editha hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 5 children.  Margie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.  Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: 4 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En la D. Paraguarí, se reúnen un grupo D. mujeres con el fin D. interiorizarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, el cual les resulto una buena oportunidad, es por eso que ellas deciden realizar la reunión para formar el comité. D. allí surge el grupo que lleva por nombre 4 D. Mayo, así se llama la calle donD. viven ellas, han asumido el compromiso D.  mantener reunido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco D. respeto mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  11 mujeres.
La señora Justina se dedica a la venta D. leche, comenta que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas D. la mañana para que la leche ya esté en la casa D. sus clientes para el desayuno. Dice que es un trabajo muy sacrificado y que requiere mucho esfuerzo físico, pero gracias al mismo pueD. obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención D. su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. leche, que le ayudará en la provisión para sus clientes, para que D. esa forma pueda tener siempre leche dentro D. su stock.
texts.en:
In Paraguarí, a group of women gets together with the aim of familiarizing themselves with a program offered by Fundación Paraguaya, which turned out to be a good opportunity for them. 

It is because of this that they deciD. to have a meeting in order to form a communal bank. From here arises the group known as 4 D. Mayo, which is the name of the street where they live. They have taken on the commitment of keeping the group together and working within a framework of mutual respect. Currently the group is maD. up of eleven women. They are taking out their second loan with excellent qualifications. 

Justina earns a living selling milk. She says that every day she gets up very early in the morning so that the milk is at her customers' homes in time for breakfast. She says it's a job that requires a lot of sacrifice and also a lot of physical effort, but thanks to this same job she is able to obtain the necessary income to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy milk, which will help her supply her customers so that in this way she can always have milk in stock.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale.

loans.name: Gunjilmaa

texts.en:
Gunjilmaa is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her family in the outer ger district, an area without basic infrastructure, in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  Gunjilmaa’s family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent.  Both of her daughters attend secondary school while her elder son works as a driver at local company. 

For the past 10 years, Gunjilmaa has supported her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia, with help from her husband. She usually sells women’s clothes which are imported from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. Today, her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT. 

Gunjilmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing and increase the range of goods she offers. Gunjilmaa is a responsible client who has repaid previous loans. Her long-term aim is to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinorah, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ellos le ayudan a trabajar, se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátano verde, aprendió el oficio gracias al apoyo  de su hermana,ya tiene experiencia, no tiene horario para vender ya que todos los días se dedica a este negocio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materia prima como yuca, plátano,y aceite para elaborar las tostadas y de esa manera tener los ingredientes para preparar los productos y atender mejor a sus clientes.
El sueño de dinorah es que su negocio crezca  y de esa forma darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dinorah lives with her husband and two children.  They help with her work.  She sells fried green bananas, a business she learned thanks to help from her sister.  Now she has experience.  She does not have a fixed schedule for sales since she works at this business every day.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like manioc, bananas and oil to make her snacks and to have all the ingredients available to make her products and provide better customers service.

Dinorah’s dream is that her business grows to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy manioc, bananas and oil.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 57 years old and is married with three children. She raises hogs to fatten and for future sale to butchers who come into their village. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and she proudly says that she was able to support her children's  studies. According to Precila, raising hogs needs patience and proper maintenance to make a profitable net income when they are ready for disposal.

She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to have additional capital to buy vitamins, medicines and feed for her hogs. She also wants to buy additional hogs to raise.

In the future, she wants to improve her hog raising business and keep growing as an entrepreneur, and someday make herself financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise, plus vitamins, medicines and feed for them.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 34-years-old and is married with two children.

Winnie owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Winnie is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 1 child. 

Cherly has a shop that sells recycled materials like plastics, bottles and metals. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics.

Cherly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cherly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like bottles and plastics

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en:
Sarvan is a 32 years old man who breeds and sells sheep. He has four years of experience in this field. 

He is married and has four children.  He usually buys lambs, raise and fatten them and sells them in the livestock bazaar to people who want meat and fur. 

Sarvan`s income is 150 AZN per month.  His father actively helps Sarvan run the business.  Now he has applied for 1200 AZN loan to purchase 15 lambs and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase 15 lambs and fodder.

loans.name: Álvaro

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos.

Él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la veterinaria básica (practica), ya que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo lo enviaron a estudiar un bachillerato agrícola, pero solo hizo un año y medio, pero por falta de recursos económicos no continuo. En este tiempo aprendió muchas técnicas para desempeñar esta actividad y lo hacia en los animales de su familia, luego se dedico a trabajar de manera individual desde las 4:00 a.m. hasta el anochecer cuando le llaman los clientes.

Álvaro compra la medicina que le va a suministrar a los animales, en el lugar más cercano a su vivienda, pero hay ocasiones en que no encuentra los medicamentos y debe viajar a otro lugar.

Álvaro solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos vacas lecheras de repasto. De esta forma él dispondrá de otra fuente de ingresos para su familia. Álvaro tiene la disposición de continuar aprendiendo veterinaria y estudiar unos cursos, con el objetivo de tener mayor conocimiento y tener mejores conocimientos.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 47 years old and lives with his companion and five children.

He has dedicated himself to basic veterinary services (practice) for 8 years since his parents, with much effort, sent him to study for a bachelor’s.  He only completed a year and a half, as he did not have the financial resources to continue.  During this time, he learned many technical skills to carry out this activity, which he was able to use on behalf of his family’s animals.  Later, he started working independently from 4:00 am until dark when customers called for him.

Álvaro buys the medicines he administers to the animals at the place closest to his house.  There are times, however, when he can’t find what he needs and must then travel to another location.

Álvaro requests a loan from Fundación Campo to buy two milking cows, which will provide another source of income for his family.  Álvaro has the disposition to continue learning veterinary science and to take some classes, with the goal of increasing his knowledge in this arena.

loans.use: buy two milking cows.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
ABI, qui est assise à gauche fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires il y’a onze ans. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 paniers d’orange + 1sac de 25kg de sel + 100kg d’oignons et  2 cartons de cube maggie. Elle s’approvisionne dans les jardins potagers  des villages environnants et au grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  grand marché à Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Sabaly group are married women, who average 38 years of age with an average of three children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Sikasso. 

They are on their eighth loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with a view to satisfying their customer demand. 

Abi, who is sitting on the left of the photo, has been buying and selling condiments for the past eleven years. With her loan she is planning to buy two baskets of oranges, one 25kg sack of salt, 100kg of onions and two cartons of Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies from vegetable gardens in surrounding villages and at Sikasso's Grand Market. She resells at Sikasso's Grand Market and within her family, to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on a retail basis.  

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,500FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments and fruit

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. Catherine lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

Catherine has operated a retail business for the past 5 years, selling yellow bananas at the market. She works six days a week, and also sells water as another source of income. Catherine has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of yellow bananas and vegetables. Her major business challenges are seasonality and traveling to villages for the bananas. Her goals and hopes are to become a wholesaler, to buy a plot of land and to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with 2 children, aged 17 and 4 years. He has been in active farming for 3 years and produces milk and eggs for the local market. He is age 28.

Andrew has requested Juhudi Kilimo, a Kiva partner, to advance him a loan of 31,200 KES to help him purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says his focus is to own four dairy cows and to buy a motorcycle to help him in making cheap deliveries to the markets. He hopes improved farming will enable him to educate his children and give them better living standards.

He also points at the challenge poised by animal diseases as the major drawback. He is, however, keen on fully repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: 02-Đại Long-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Thành is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. 

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 060302-Đại Long-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2003, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thành has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thành works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thành has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Thành faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to to purchase baby livestock to raise.

In the future, Thành hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise.

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en:
Sasho S. lives in the village of Stambolovo which is 10 km. far from the small Bulgarian town Pavlikeni. Sasho’s only business is cattle breeding. He has two cows and a calf.

Sasho needs $ 1 000 to buy a new cow. This will increase his monthly income with 30 %. Callte breeding and milk selling is Sasho’s only source of income.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Dorila

texts.en:
In my neighborhood I am well known because I have sold food for many years, which are known in Honduras as "golosinas" (snacks), which are really fast-food types of food such as tacos, pastries, and french fries. I currently have many customers who buy my foods in the evening hours and since school has started again, many students who buy my food in the afternoons as well as the evenings, since my business is located near one of the school centers. With this activity I have been able to help my children with their studies and cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

En mi colonia soy bastante conocida ya que desde hace muchos años me dedico a vender comidas, en Honduras a este tipo de comida le llamamos golosinas que son comidas tipicas rapidas, como tacos de tortillas con pollo, pastelitos, papas fritas. Actualmente tengo bastantes clientes quienes por las noches me compran, ahora que iniciaron clases los estudiantes me compran por las tardes y en la noche, ya que mi negocio esta ubicado cerca de un centro de estudios. Con esta actividad he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios, y apoyar en los gastos de mi casa.

loans.use: To sell pastries, french fries, tacos and other foods.

loans.name: Paskazia

texts.en: Paskazia lives in the Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children. In her tailoring business, Paskazia makes and repairs both men's and women's clothes. She employs one assistant. With additional capital of $750, she can buy two sewing machines, employ another assistant, and buy other tailoring supplies. This expansion strategy will help her increase her income. One of her two sons is in secondary school and an increased income will help her pay for school fees and other associated costs.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yaho

texts.en: Yaho K. A. is a 46 year old woman. She is married and has 9 children. Her husband is a retired mechanic worker. She has never been to school. She sells food-stuffs in order to be independent. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. She started her career as a dressmaker, but due to some pain in her eyes, she was forced to stop. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods and increase her margin.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung (32) and his wife Cuc (35) run a small butcher stand in the commune marketplace. They sell pork at their stand. Before working with Mekong Plus and Kiva, they took out loans from other sources. They had to pay high interest on those loans, which severely cut into their profits. They were not left with much to raise their 2 sons, M. Nhat Hong (12) and M. Nhat Huong (10). They hope that they can partner with Mekong Plus and Kiva so that they can increase their profits and save money to send their children to school.

Cuc usually tends to their stand in the market. They earn about 20-25,000 VND (US$1.25-1.56) per day from selling pork. They would like this loan in order to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to provide pork to sell at their meat stand

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María B. A. is part of the village bank “Kusikuy” which is Quechua (native language) for “Happiness.” María, who is a proud mother of seven children, has been in the industry of “ganadería,” or stockbreeding, for more than 20 years. Her daily business consists of traveling great distances to the countryside where she buys young bulls and cows. These she takes to her corral outside the city where they stay for several months as she fattens them up to eventually be sold to her clients. She began when her best friend, who is also a stockbreeder, invited her to be a business partner. Together, they began with small products such as eggs and wool, and eventually branched out into the profitable business of stockbreeding.

This 27-year-old, who lights up the room with her friendly conversation and energetic character, has another business in artesanías. She and another friend meet on a regular basis to weave beautiful blankets, which she then sells to her many clients. Most of her work is on a contract basis and the majority of her clients are foreigners who wish to return to their country with a colorful souvenir. María says her goal has always been to save up enough money from both of her businesses and open a small artesanía shop around the corner from her home. As stockbreeding is a particularly strenuous way to make a living and as María grows older, opening a small store would become an especially ideal source of income.

María says she feels very happy and content to be a part of her village bank because it has taught her how to save her money and earn interest. It is also an important place for women to meet and share ideas. María is requesting a $1,000 loan with which she will be able to fund both of her businesses through the care of her cattle and upkeep of her corral, as well as materials to continue weaving artesanás.

loans.use: María is requesting a $1,000 loan with which she will be able to fund both of her businesses through the care of her cattle and upkeep of her corral, as well as materials to continue weaving artesanás.

loans.name: Subgroup D Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
Hellen, age 26, is the leader of Subgroup D of group Sungura (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. Hellen owns a beauty salon which she opened in 2004. Before starting this business, she worked as an assistant hairdresser in other salons. Now her salon brings in around 10-15 customers a day and makes about $35-45 a week. Her sister assists her in her work. She lives with her sister and brother at their relatives’ home.

Hellen will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members Mwamtumu B. (selling fruits), Godfrey M. (selling fruits), Juma M. (photographer), Martha M. (selling chicken), and Stella J. (honey vendor). This subgroup has taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses, and they were able to pay each back successfully.

Hellen used the previous loans to pay for her sister’s school fees and to enhance her business. With the new loan, she hopes to purchase more hair treatments and a new hair dryer. Her ultimate dream is to one day open a pharmacy.

In the picture, Hellen is the woman standing next to the man on the far right.

loans.use: To buy hair salon treatments and equipment

loans.name: Sarhani

texts.en: Sarhani is a 40 year old woman who has a small food shop from which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She can earn US$5.50 per day. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She requests a IDR 800,000 loan to expand her business. Sarhani hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Jose Celedonio

texts.es:
The business that José Celedonios works at is carpentry, which he has developed over the past 10 years with much sacrifice. His business is located in the market at the bus station in León. Since he was young he has had experience in this type of work, as he was in a carpentry workshop for many years. He tells us that this business has been the only means of support for him and his family. In addition, because of the business, his daughter is able to study.

One of Jose´s greatest achievements has been that he has been able to capture a number of clients in the area, owing to the fact that his carpentry work is of high quality and very professional. For the past year he has worked with CEPRODEL and he is very satisfied with the loans granted to him, as they have been made at opportune moments, helping him to supply the needs of his workshop. In this way he has been able to fulfill requests from his clients and continue to pay for his daughter´s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica el señor José Celedonio es la carpintería que con mucho sacrificio ha venido desarrollando desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de León en el mercado la Estación. Desde muy pequeño ha tenido experiencia en lo que respecta a este trabajo, ya que por muchísimo tiempo trabajó en un taller y nos cuenta que este negocio ha sido el único sustento para el y su familia. Además por medio del negocio beneficia a su hija que es estudiante.

Un merito muy grande que ha tenido el señor José es que ha logrado captar varios clientes en su zona debido a que los trabajos de carpintería los realiza muy finamente y con alta profesionalidad. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace un año y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del taller y de esta manera poder satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes y seguir manteniendo los estudios de su hija.

loans.use: Purchase equipment and wood.

loans.name: Lweza A (2007) D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ssaku C.. She is a tailor and is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth. Ssaku is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children, ages 6 and 8, who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Ssaku hopes to be able to expand her business.

Ssaku is joined in her small group by Christine N., Harriet N., Harriet N., and Harriet N.. Christine N. sells charcoal and wants to stock more sacks of charcoal. Harriet N. operates a stone quarry and wants a loan to boost her business. Harriet N. sells fresh food and wants to increase her inventory. Harriet N. has a piggery and is requesting a loan to purchase more piglets.

loans.use: To add to her tailoring business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo is 56 years old and has been married for 34 years to Prisciliana, who is 55 years old. They have 5 children aged 32, 29, 27, 22 and 20. The three oldest are married and live with their respective partners and have their own houses. The two youngest children, on the other hand, still live at home and help them with the business.

Ricardo tells us that previously he used to work at an oil factory that later went bankrupt. Due to this turn of events he decided to find a different way to earn a living and this is how he got started selling charcoal and firewood.

Thanks to his efforts he was able to support his family and help them get ahead. Additionally he was able to enjoy the comforts of owning his house and a truck that he now uses to deliver his products.

Ricardo proudly mentions that he is doing well in his business and that he can count on the constant support of his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase charcoal and firewood for him to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo tiene 56 años, está casado hace 34 años con Prisciliana de 55 años. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos de 32, 29, 27, 22 y 20 años respectivamente. Los tres hijos mayores ya están casados y viven con sus respectivas parejas, ya poseen sus casas propias mientras que los dos hijos menores aún viven con ellos y les ayudan en el negocio.

Ricardo cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica aceitera que luego fue a la quiebra. Por tal motivo comenzó a buscar una actividad a la cual dedicarse y fue así que comenzó con la venta de carbón y leñas.

Gracias al fruto de su esfuerzo pudo mantener y sacar adelante a toda su familia, además de obtener comodidades como su casa propia y una camioneta que hoy día emplea en la distribución de sus mercaderías.

Ricardo comenta orgulloso que le va muy bien en su trabajo y que además cuenta con el apoyo constante de toda su familia. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de leñas y carbón para la venta.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Karankay Group

texts.en:
The members of Karankay group grow vegetables, such as tomatoes, lettuce, carrots and cabbage to sell. Nema and Fatmata are also engaged in small-scale retail sales. They said they would use the loan to grow vegetables to sell and use the income from their retail sales to pay the loan instalments.

The group would like to increase their farm activites and each member guarantees each other for loan repayment. Nema is 40 years and is married with 3 children. She serves as the group leader.

The Karankay group works together to produce vegetables, and to sell their produce at the market. They need a small loan to increase their yields and incomes.

loans.use: To grow vegetables to sell in the market.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny is 32 years old and lives with her partner in Puerto de Salaverry in Trujillo, Peru. A native of La Libertad, Marleny completed her secondary schooling. She has one daughter who attends school.

Marleny works selling cosmetics for a well known company. She also buys and sells clothing for children and adults by request from friends, family and acquaintances. She received her first loan 2 years ago and invested in beauty products to sell. She is a member of the communal bank called Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more clothing for the winter season to meet the requests of her customers. She dreams of having enough capital to invest even more in her business and continuing to increase her income.

La señora Marleny es conviviente, tiene 32 años, natural de La Libertad, cursó estudios secundarios completos, tiene 01 hija estudiante; vive en el Puerto de Salaverry - Trujillo – Perú. Marleny; se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una conocida empresa , así como compra - venta de ropa de niños, y adultos, los cuales son pedidos por familiares, vecinos y demás conocidos. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace dos años concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza como son colonias, shampu, etc. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Triunfadoras De Salaverry” Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual cancelará en 4 meses comprará chompas, camisas y ropa de niños para estación de invierno, ella entrega a domicilio los pedidos de sus clientes. Marleny sueña con tener un gran capital con lo cual pueda hacer mayores inversiones y generarse mayores ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER BUSINESSES SELLING CLOTHING AND COSMETICS.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir B. is a 47-year-old salesperson who owns a grocery store in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has three children. He is requesting a loan to diversify and expand the number of products he sells in the store.

loans.use: To diversify and expand the number of grocery products for resale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha K. is a fish seller in Preak Konlong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Teav, is a teacher who receives only a small salary to support his family. They have five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Their neighbor wants to sell a piece of land at a reasonable price so Mrs. Chantha Coub and her husband want to buy it in order to resell later at a better price. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money so Mrs. Chantha Coub requests a loan for this purpose. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Pek

texts.en: Mrs. Pek M. is a farmer in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. On her plantation, she faces a problem: she does not have enough animals to plow the rice field, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more ox to plow the field with the old one. Her husband, Mr. Chhit Sophea, is a firewood seller who earns a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Pek M. is 22 years old and the mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru:
Хашимова Зухра 1983 года рождения. Предпринимательством занимается пять лет и на данный момент торгует мужскими одеждами.  Местом ее деятельности является рынок «Шохмансур», магазин «Наргис» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большой выбор мужских летних и демисезонных футболок и накидок из хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. Она закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая и Турции и мечтает сама ездить за товарами в эти города. 
Зухра узнала о программе Кива от подруги которая тоже участвовала в этой программе и хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zukhra K. was born in 1983. She has been an entrepreneur for five years and currently trades in men’s clothing. She works out of a shop named Nargis at the Shokhmansur market in the city of Dushanbe.
