Her inventory includes a large variety of men’s summer and cool-weather t-shirts, as well as cotton and knitted jerseys manufactured in China and Turkey. She buys her wares from suppliers in China and Turkey and dreams of traveling to their cities to make purchases. Zukhra found out about the Kiva program from friends who had also participated and she wishes to take out a loan in the amount of $1175 (4000 somoni) to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing, t-shirts, and sweaters

loans.name: Anbenakan (We Are In Agreement) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe anbenakan est un regroupement de huit femmes de la grande famille élargie des bûcherons du village de Kimparana préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). Toutes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 6 enfants.
Appartenant à une ethnie du Mali qui s’occupe de la confection de calebasses, des ustensiles, la fabrication des cantines et des boites à bijoux en calebasses. Cette activité a été apprise auprès des parents pendant l’enfance. En plus de cette activité, elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
Afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre premiers prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire), le groupe est à son cinquième prêt et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, la matière première entrant dans l’exercice de leur activité principale à savoir les cuirs, les ficelles, les gourdes, les calebasses, les feuilles de rôniers etc.
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans en feuilles de rônier, en calebasses et en gourdes et en cuirs et ficelle auprès des commerçants du marché.
Les travaux sont exécutés à la maison pour fabriquer des calebasses, des cantines et boites à bijoux. Par contre elles se déplacent de familles en familles pour réparer ces dits objets. La clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes et des fans des objets d’art traditionnels du Mali.
Avec les revenus qu’elles généreront, elles comptent rembourser les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Anbenakan consists of 8 women from the big extended family of woodcutters of the village of Kimparana, Prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). All are married, have an average age of 44 and on average 6 children.

They belong to an ethnic group which works with gourds, making utensils, trunks, and jewelry boxes from the calabash (bottle gourd). This technique is passed on from parents to their offspring in childhood. Besides this business, these women sell condiments.

So as to expand the size of their businesses, they decided to all join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso more than 2 years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first four group loans (solidarity loans), this group is ready for their 5th loan and hopes to use it to buy raw materials for their main business, i.e., leather, string, gourds, calabashes and palm fronds.

They buy their palm fronds from peasants and calabashes, gourds, leather, and string from merchants at the market.

The handiwork is done at home to make drinking gourds, trunks, and jewelry boxes. They then go from family to family to gather these objects. Their clientele is composed essentially of women and people who are keen on these traditional Malian handicrafts.

With their earnings, they expect to make payments on the loan and help support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying raw materials (leather, palm fronds, calabashes etc.)

loans.name: Miriam Danixa

texts.es:
La señora Miriam tiene 38 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y vive en la calle Sepúlveda 300, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, pero por su situación económica no continuó estudiando. Se casó a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes.
Miriam vende carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado La Amistad.
Con su primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas compró carne de gallina y empezó también a vender dicha carne.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en productos naturales para la salud. 
Miriam sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ms Miriam is 38 years old and belongs to the community bank Luis Alberto Sánchez II. She lives on Sepúlveda 300, in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her elementary schooling but because of her economic situation, was unable to continue her studies. She married at 19 years of age and has 5 children who are in school. Miriam sells chicken meat in a stand in the La Amistad market. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she repaid in 4 months, she bought chicken meat and began selling it. With this loan of S/. 500, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase natural health products. Miriam dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural health products

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 43 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital llamado 380, en la capital de Managua casado, sus hijos ya están mayores y son profesionales. Los planes que tiene para su familia es asegúrales un patrimonio mejor para su esposa y  hijos. Don Luís se desempeña como taxista desde hace siete  años, anteriormente trabaja como ejecutivo de venta y posteriormente adquirió un crédito para comprar su propio auto y trabajarlo. Sus planes en el ámbito económico es aumentar sus ingresos  comprando una nueva unidad de taxi dándolo a trabajar, en estos momentos necesita comprar llantas para el vehiculo y darle mantenimiento para poder ofrecer un buen servicio  a sus clientes. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra que su unidad de taxi  siga ofreciendo ingresos y un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. Para nuestra empresa  es importante el desarrollo de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Luís is 43 years old, lives in a neighbourhood called 380 in the capital Managua. Married, his children are grown and are professionals. His plans for his family are to ensure a better inheritance for his wife and children. Luís has worked as a taxi driver for the past seven years; before that he worked as a salesman and prior to that he borrowed in order to buy his own car and work with it. His financial plans are to increase his income by buying another taxi and putting it to work. He will need to buy tires for the vehicle and perform maintenance on it in order to give his clients good service. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, his taxi business continues to make good revenues and offer ever better service to his passengers. For us, the development of our clients is most important.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for the maintenance of a vehicle

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Yen C. is a group leader of five residents who all live in Peam Tonlea village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs.Yen C. and her husband, Mr. Sum Kuoy, are farmers who own three hectares of land and cultivate rice for a living. The couple now faces a problem because their field is quite far from an irrigation system. They do not have enough money to buy fuel for their pump to water the field, so Mrs.Yen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for this purpose.

Mrs.Yen C. is 44-years-old and the mother of four children. Three children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump in order to irrigate the rice field.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is 50 years old, divorced, and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school through the help of government free compulsory education. She lives with her children in their family house in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Felicia works tirelessly to provide for the needs of her children as a single mother. Her husband abandoned his responsibility, leaving everything on her. The family responsibilities rest on her indeed; she provides food on the table, pays the utility bills, etc.

Felicia was in tears and at the verge of giving up when we spoke to her concerning her current situation. She is an artisan and manufacturer of mortar. One may wonder what we use it for in Ghana. It serves only one purpose here.

Mortar is used to pound fufu; it serves as the bowl in which the cassava and plantain are poured in to be pound with a pistol. There is a particular tree in the forest that can be used to design or manufacture the mortar. Felicia goes to the forest and places the timber logs in order to be used for the mortar. It is said that the Ashanties use mortar more than the other tribes in Ghana. 

For the past two years now, Felicia has been doing this to take care of her home. It has become a challenge as she finds it difficult to get wood for the mortar as a result of a government warning on the frequent cutting of timber in our forest reserves. She is requesting the loan to buy wood to manufacture the mortar. With her larger customer base, Felicia believes she can make lots of profit from the business growth to help her kids in school. Felicia belongs to a village bank called ‘Onuado’ which means brotherly love. She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her family.

loans.use: To buy timber logs needed to make mortar

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with a toddler son. His family lives in the small town of Veliky Luchki. He owns a bakery. His business has been running for 6 years. Demand for bread has always been high, which is why Anatoly’s business has flourished. Presently, he has about 40,000 UAH in working capital. His profit amounts to 5,000 UAH.  

Anatolyi has requested a loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase ingredients for his bakery. The ability to buy more inventory at low prices will give him the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee cuenta con 33 años de edad, está felizmente casada y es madre de dos hijos que viven en su casa. Los padres de Haydee toda su vida se dedicaron a diversos cultivos, tanto de papa, arveja, y demás hortalizas; y en los primeros años de su matrimonio continuaba con estas labores, pero ha ella no le gustaba mucho la agricultura, por lo que cuando nació su hija, hace 5 años, motivó a su esposo para abrir una bodega, entonces él se hizo cargo de los cultivos, y ella al cuidado de sus hijos y a atender su tienda. Desde esa época le presta todo su tiempo y dedicación a su bodega, que al transcurrir los años ha ido captando clientela, y esto la motiva a seguir invirtiendo y trabajando en ella. Haydee está muy contenta con su negocio, ya que cuando la cosecha falla, o el precio del mercado no es tan bueno; su bodega es quien cubre los gastos básicos de la familia. Haydee es la presidenta de su banco comunal, es la encargada de convocar a las reuniones a los demás integrantes en casos de sesiones extraordinarias y estar pendiente del buen desenvolvimiento del grupo. Este es su 11vo préstamo con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, para de ese modo captar más clientes que le permitan acumular ganancias para la mejora de su economía.
texts.en:
Haydee is 33 years old and happily married. She has two children who live at home. Haydee's parents have always been farmers, raising potatoes, peas, and other crops. In the early years of her marriage Haydee continued raising these crops, but she doesn't particularly enjoy farming. When her daughter was born five years ago, Haydee convinced her husband to open a bodega. He did, agreeing to take charge of the crops while Haydee cares for the children and tends to the store. Since that time, Haydee has spent all of her time and effort on the store, which has grown a client base over the years. This motivates Haydee to continue investing and working on it. She is very happy with her business, because now when the crop fails or market prices are down her store is able to cover the family's basic expenses. Haydee is president of her community bank, in charge of organizing member meetings in extreme cases and staying in tune with the involvement of the group. This is her 11th loan with MFP and she has always demonstrated responsibility in her repayments. The money that she's asking for will go toward increasing the merchandise in her store so that she can capture more clients and earn more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.ru: Абдуразок 1964  года рождения женат ,имеет  4 детей. Работает в трактористом в колхозе. Но вместо заработной платы иногда выдают масло, муку и рис.  По этому он  также зарабатывает себе на жизнь продажей  скота или сельским хозяйственной культурой. Дома есть небольшой колодец, в колодце он установил насос для полива огорода и поить коров. Доволен кредитом и условиями Микроинвест.  Благодарен Микроинвест и КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdurazok was born in 1964, he is married and has 4 children. He works as a tractor driver at the collective farm. However, instead of a salary sometimes he is given oil, flour and rice. Because of this he also earns money by selling livestock and by agriculture. At home he has a small well, where he installed a small pump in order to water the garden and give water to the cattle. He is happy with the loan and terms from MicroInvest. He is gratefull to MicroInvest and Kiva for their support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
AIDA H. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Dalilas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Sucre N°  1014 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 37 años de edad, 03 menores hijos y su esposo se desempeña actualmente como chofer de auto colectivo (Transportista).

Desde hace ya 01 año que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles con lo cual compró ropa, ahora amplió el negocio a la venta de peluches

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de peluches y ropa de temporada al por mayor directamente de Lima (ciudad) para estas fiestas patronales de  San Juan donde aumenta la demanda de estos productos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos y está conforme con el trabajo que viene realizando en la región, es una ayuda para las mujeres que quieren seguir adelante, apoyando al ingreso económico de las familias.
texts.en:
Aida H. P. belongs to the “Las Dalilas” community bank. She lives at Jr. Sucre N° 1014 in the Callería district. She is 37, and she has 3 minor children. Her husband is a collective taxi driver. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought clothes. Now she is expanding her business and selling stuffed animals. With this loan of 1,200 PEN she will buy stuffed animals. She will also buy wholesale seasonal clothes from Lima for the patron saint’s day in San Juan, where there is an increased demand for these products. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, and she is satisfied with their work in the region. It is a help to women who want to get ahead by supporting the economic income of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stuffed animals and articles of clothing

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna U. is 40 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married to a carpenter and they have four children. 

Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in dried-fish vending. Her business is a big help financially, specifically in their daily basic needs and school allowances.

Mrs. U. is now on her 4th loan, obtaining PHP8,000. Her loan is intended for additional capital for dried fish vending. Her regular customers are her friends, neighbors, and relatives.

She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs, having a stall in the public market and being able to send their children to school and having them attend a degree course.

loans.use: As additional capital for dried-fish vending

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en:
The group, United Women, was formed through the gathering of several neighbors from the district Ypati from the city of Villa Elisa.  The participants formed a committee in order to apply for a group loan and to satisfy the needs for capital that every one of them had for their respective businesses.  All of the participants of the group depend on their businesses and with time have been growing and improving little by little, thanks to the teamwork and the unity among the participants. 

1	Demetria C. - Coal sales 
2	Ceferina M. - Grocery store  
3	Antonia Lopez - Vegetable sales
4	Ramona C. - Convenience store 
5	Petrona C. - Grocery store 
6	Basilia M. - Cosmetic sales 
7	Elida Benitez - Dressmaker 
8	Ester A. - Handicrafts 
9	Zunilda H. - Ice cream sales 
10	Higinia A. - Recycling 
11	Karina A. M. - Plastics sales 
12	Maria Josefina G. - Cosmetic sales 
13	Sonia E. V. - Dressmaker 
14	Digna G. - General store 
15	Emelda M. - Food sales

loans.use: The credit received from the Paraguay Foundation was invested in the small businesses of each one of the participants.  Each one used the loan for necessities, whether they were raw materials or goods to sell.  For example, the women who invested in small stores bought things like rice, sugar, meats and fruits.  The women who work as dressmakers acquired raw materials such as thread, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos A. D. M. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. CD´s, DVD´s, juguetes, ropa entre otros productos más los cuales los comercializa en la afueras D. una escuela, donD. venD. la mayoría D. sus productos con los estudiantes D. ese lugar. María solícita un préstamo ya que desea comprar más productos para el negocio, ella desea aumentar sus ventas debido a que este es la única entrada económica que posee ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella.
texts.en:
María Santos A. D. M. is 47 years old. She lives in La Libertad with her husband and their three young children. She sells CDs, DVDs, toys, clothes, and other products outsiD. a school. She sells most of her products to the students in that area. María is requesting a loan because she would like to buy more products for her business. She wants to increase her sales because, as her husband works alongsiD. her, this is the only source of income for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more products for her business

loans.name: Owolo

texts.en: K. makes a living selling various types of foodstuffs. She is 41 years old, married, has four children and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. K. is applying for a loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and wishes to thank all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband is a mason.

Vida sells earrings, panties and cosmetics at Abura, which she has done since 2007. Vida uses her income to pay for house-keeping expenses. She will use the loan to buy more of the cosmetics since they are in high demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics since they are in high demand by her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 51 años, vive con su esposa Flor y sus hijos; Estefano de 14 y Mariela de 8, en su casa propia. Hace 6 años, decidió incursionar en un negocio propio debido a que acababa de perder su trabajo. Por tal motivo compró una máquina fotocopiadora para brindar este servicio a sus vecinos. Posteriormente tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar con su negocio a un colegio, por lo que compró otra fotocopiadora e implementó un pequeño kiosko de golosinas y bebidas. Ángel está muy contento por sus logros, pero aun así, consiguió otro trabajo como vigilante, donde se ocupa todas las mañanas. Entonces, su esposa atiende el kioko y su servicio de fotocopiado en el colegio por las mañanas y Ángel lo hace por las tardes, dejando a cargo de su hijo mayor la otra fotocopiadora que tienen en casa. De esta manera todos ponen de su parte para poder salir adelante, pues saben que unidos, con mucho empeño y dedicación lograrán sus objetivos. Es el sexto préstamo de Ángel con MFP y durante sus créditos anteriores siempre demostró ser muy responsable con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará papel y útiles de escritorio para empezar a vender estos artículos, tanto en su casa, como en el colegio y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ángel is 51 years old and lives with his wife, Flor, and his children, Estefano, 14, and Mariela, 8, in a home they own. Six years ago he decided to start up his own business because he was about to lose his job. For this reason he bought a photocopier to provide this service to his neighbors. Later he had the opportunity to take his business to a school, so he bough another photocopier and set up a small kiosk offering snacks and refreshments. Ángel is very pleased with his achievements, but even so he took another job as a security guard, which he does every morning. His wife then tends to the kiosk and copier at the school in the mornings, and Ángel does it in the afternoons, leaving his eldest child in charge of the copy machine he has at their home. In this way everyone does his or her part to help the family make headway because they know together, with a lot of hard work and dedication, they will achieve their goals. This is the sixth loan for Ángel with Kiva partner MFP, and during his previous loans he has always shown himself to be very responsible with his payments. With the money he is requesting, he plans to purchase paper and office supplies so he can start selling those items in both his home and at the school, and thus increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase paper and office supplies

loans.name: Dina

texts.fr: Z. Dina est née le 13/09/1976 à Agblangandan à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Dina est mariée à DJOSSOU Frédéric. Dina est mère d’un enfant. Dina et sa famille habitent AGLA un quartier de Cotonou. Dina a été initiée au commerce dès son enfance par sa mère qui vendait des lubrifiants pour véhicules. Dina a aussi appris la coiffure qu’elle a exercé pendant trois ans avant de l’abandonner au profit du commerce. Dina vend en effet des mèches de tissages et de tresses ainsi que les produits cosmétiques.Dina a pour ambition et projet d’ouvrir une grande boutique de produits de toilette et de produits de coiffures. Dina a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de la part d’ALIDé. Dina a bien remboursé ce prêt et sollicite aujourd’hui un second pour augmenter le volume de son activité, son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de produits de beauté et de coiffure.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora de 44 años  de edad, es madre de seis hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad, y cuatro menores, se dedica a la costura y a la venta de pollos, cuenta para ello con la ayuda de su hermana, y de sus hijos mayores ya que ellos se dedican al pilado de arroz, ella es madre soltera. Es parte del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza”  desde hace un año y medio, su primer préstamo fue de 500 soles, que lo invirtió en telas, blondas, botones.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles, invertirá en la compra de pollos vivos, los mismos que serán enviados a su hermana, que tiene un restaurante en el caserío Roaboya, ambas son socias de este local.
La meta de Nelly es tener un restaurante propio en la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde pueda ofrecer platos típicos de la región .
texts.en:
Nelly is a dynamic and hard working woman of 44. She is the mother of six children, two older and four younger. Her business is sewing and the sale of chickens. For this, she counts on the support of her sister and her two older children, who also have a rice milling business. Nelly has been a member of the “La Forteleza” community bank for a year and a half. Her first loan, of 500 soles, she invested in fabric, lace and buttons. With this loan of 1200 soles, she will invest in the purchase of live chickens. These will be sent to her sister who has a restaurant in the village of Roaboya, and who is also a member of the community bank. Nelly’s goal is to have her own restaurant in the city of Pucallpa where she will serve traditional dishes of the region.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase live chickens

loans.name: M'balu

texts.en:
For four years, M’Balu K. put aside a small portion of her household food allowance as savings. Her hope was to start her own business selling food products in the local market. Last year M’Balu achieved that goal and began her new enterprise in a central, open-air market in Makeni. She sells food products—her bestsellers being macaroni, a local spice (Maggi), and tomatoes. Among many other small stalls selling dried fish in plastic containers, M’Balu’s shop stands out. Her products are arranged in neat, tidy rows resembling a pyramid. In her first year in business, M’Balu has been very happy with her turnover but is always thinking of how she can move her inventory “fast, fast” and increase her sales volume. Smiling, M’Balu spoke several times about her desire to expand her business. She hopes to one day own a proper shop of her own and is sticking to her tried and true past strategy of accumulating daily savings until she is ready to purchase a store.

M’Balu is a 38-year-old, married mother of five children. In addition to her children, aged four to seventeen, M’Balu and her husband, who is a welder, support two of her younger brothers.

This is M’Balu’s first loan.

loans.use: To buy additional food items for her market stand

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Mrs. Subdra K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati. She opened her shop to raise the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, and bitten rice. Her husband and daughters also help in her work. She is requesting a loan of 25000 NPR to buy more grocery goods for her shop.

Mrs. Subdra K. lives in a single family home with her husband and two daughters. Her husband, Mr. Ram Kumar K., works in a private office. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9, and her younger daughter is studying in grade 6. Mrs. Subdra K. uses her income to provide a better education for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos; dos de ellos cursan estudios primarios y los otros dos, estudios secundarios. 
Desde hace 10 años es propietario de una chacra donde también está su vivienda, allí siembra caña de azúcar y una variedad de productos de pan llevar, también cría vacas.
Para esta actividad cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa. 
En el caso de la caña de azúcar, una vez cosechada la envía a otras ciudades para su comercialización, y también la vende en el mercado local. 
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad laboral es dar todo de él y sentirse útil ante los demás, y como ya cuenta con clientes estables obtiene muy buenas ganancias.

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta trabajar de ser parte de un banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros se comprenden y son puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido íntegramente en el aumento de producción de su chacra.
texts.en:
Narciso is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children; two of them are in primary school and the other two in secondary school. For 10 years he has been the owner of a farm where he also lives. There he plants sugar cane and a variety of local staple foods; he also raises cattle. For these activities, he counts on the help of his children and his wife. Once the sugar cane is harvested, he sends it to other cities to be sold, and he also sells it in the local market.

His favorite part of his work is giving all of himself and feeling useful to others. Since he relies on steady customers, he obtains very good profits. This is his third loan from MFP. What he likes about working and being part of a community bank is that all his fellow members understand each other and are punctual in their payments. The money that he is asking for now will be wholly invested in increasing the production of his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase agricultural production

loans.name: Tsevel

texts.en: Tsevel L. is 66 years old and lives with her husband and 19-year-old daughter in Zuunmod town in Tuv province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Bayantuul, has already graduated from her university and is operating her own business. Tsevel is a retired lady who operates a grocery retail business out of a small booth at a local market in her town. She began her business in 1998 after retiring from her previous work. She works hard to provide for her family and wants to be able to continue to conduct her business in the future. Tsevel is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase different kinds of products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of food products

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel S. is from Maloro, Tangub City. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Raquel owns and operates a general store, selling different products such as candies, coffee, shampoo, soap, sugar, some food for snacks, etc. in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo con el nombre de Las Flores, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de mancuernas pertenece al municipio de S. Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca; está integrado por 10 personas todas necesitan apoyar economicamente al gasto de sus familias ya que tienen hijos pequeños y su principal preocupación es que tienen que proporcionarles eduación escolar sin dejar de considerar los gastos de subsistencia normal, razón por la cual tienen que trabajar en la elaboración de chorizo de puerco para venderlo en la misma comunidad y de ese modo ontener ingresos, el dinero del credito otorgado por Fundación Realidad lo utilizarón para comprar ingredientes como son: chiles seco, sal, ajo, pimienta, carne molida de puerco, tambien pagan a las personas que apoyan a realizar estas actividad, transporte para realizar las compras que generalmente acuden ala Cd. de Pinotepa Nacional y transporte cuando acuden a realizar sus ventas a comunidades cercanas ó cuando se trasladan para vender a la Cd.de Acapulco Guerrero.
Un día a la semana apoyan a la Sra. Gelasia Alberta S. ya que esta persona distribuye mayor volumen de chorizo en la Cd. de Acapulco Guerrero por esta actividad tambien obtienen ingreso economico.
En el caso de la Sra. Luz Maria S. N. ademas de la venta de chorizo se dedica a la elaboración de blusas de algodon con bordado de chaquira para vender (Ropa Tipica).
Todas ellas comentarón que van a poner todo lo que esté a su alcance para que paguen bien su credito en tiempo y forma y así continuar recibiendo los beneficios que Fundación Realidad les puede ofrecer.
texts.en:
The Las Flores group is in one of S. Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca’s affiliated communities. It is composed of 10 members who all need to contribute to the support of their families because they have small children and their main worry is to provide them an education while not ignoring basic household expenses either. This is the reason that they have gone into chorizo making as a way to earn income. The funds from the Foundation were used to buy ingredients like: dried chili, salt, garlic, pepper, ground pork. They also pay labor costs for the people that help them do the work, transportation costs to the city of Pinotepa Nacional to buy ingredients and transportation costs to nearby towns and to Acapulco, Guerrero, which is where they do their sales. Gelasia Alberta S. goes to Acapulco once a week; she has the highest volume of chorizo sales; this activity generates economic income. Luz Maria S. N. not only sells chorizo but she also manufactures beaded cotton blouses (Typical Costumes). All of them stated that they will do everything in their reach to repay their loan on time so that they can continue to receive whatever help Fundación Realidad can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for chorizo and supplies to make typical costumes.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina was married when she was 20 years old. She is the mother of three sons and three daughters: two of her daughters are married and the third one is working in a sewing workshop in Jineen; one of the sons is an employee of the Palestinian Authority while the other two are college students.

Fatina's husband is a farmer besides owning a small general store. Fatina runs the store when her husband is working on the farm.

Fatina's loan from FATEN is going to be used to help her husband improve his small general store as well as participating in paying off her sons' college tuition fees.

loans.use: To improve her husband's store and to pay her sons' tuition fees

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily B. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 48 years old. Emily is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emely B.'s Group.

Emily is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $153 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Emily is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil, pepper, seasonings, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento LIBERTAD es nuevo, esta conformado por 8 integrantes D. los cual todos los socios cuentan con negocio propio y servicios hace muchos años en la zona del mercado central del torno y otros  ambulando, la gran mayoria del banco D. emprendimiento viven en la zona D. puerto rico B/ libertad por eso el nombre del banco y todos son oriundos D. santa cruz, son personas responsables que se conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.

La presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento es la Sra. Edilia, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo y como segunda actividad a la venta D. ropa D. temporada, su esposo es chofer asalariado y el dinero que le pagan no alcanza para mantener a su familia, por eso la Sra. Edilia se dedica a estas dos actividades para colaborar con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del c redito comprara mercaderia en cosmeticos que se encuentran en promosion para despues poder venderlos al precio original, y asi poder tener una mayor gananancia, es una persona responsable, dinamica y trabajadora solidaria con sus compañeros del banco por esta razon la nombraron presidenta dle banco.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas que en muchos casos sacan solas a su familia adelante, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Libertad Group is a newly-formed group that has eight members, all of whom have had businesses for several years in the central market and surrounding areas. All of the members of the group are natives of Santa Cruz and the majority live in the Libertad neighborhood of the Puerto Rico district, which is how they chose the group's name. They are responsible people who know each other well and guarantee each other's repayment of the loan. Edilia is the president of the group. She is married and has three school-aged children. She sells cosmetics from catalogs and also sells clothing seasonally. Her husband is a salaried driver, but his pay does not cover their household's expenses so Edilia has her two businesses to help meet her family's needs. She will use the money from the loan to purchase cosmetics while they are on sale to later sell at full price and in that way make a better profit. She is a responsible, dynamic, and hardworking member of the group, and for this reason they named her president. All of the group's members are responsible and dynamic and are working hard to help their families get ahead. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in the group by granting it this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sam-oeun Khloeng, a widow with two sons and three daughters, lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has just started a business selling finished silk fabric, buying silk products from the weavers in her village and transporting then to sell in other provinces.  Previously, Sam-oeun was a silk weaver. She is  now requesting a loan of $900 to purchase finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 51 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de hot dog y gaseosas. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están a su cargo, el inicio este negocio hace 5 años, como una alternativa de ingresos para su familia pues él es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar las compras de los productos que ofrece, el tiene un carretón en donde sus diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, pan, salchichas, carne y especies. Su deseo es poder mantener a su familia que para él son muy importantes.
texts.en:
Roberto is 51 years old and sells hot dogs and soft drinks. He has six children, three of whom he still supports. He started this business five years ago as an alternative source of income for his family. He is very responsible, enjoys his work, and he rises early every morning to buy the products he sells from his cart. He will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, juices, buns, franks, meat, and spices. He wants to continue to be able to support his family, who is very important to him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 50 years old. She is married and has six children. Her youngest child is 8 years old and the eldest is 28 years old.

Beatrice has different businesses so that she can have a steady income. She sells charcoal and tomatoes on the roadside and she has a store with different foods, such as rice and sorghum. She has become well known for selling these items.  Her husband helps her with the business in addition to rearing cattle. 

Beatrice’s dream is to have a sorghum store and a bigger cattle kraal (corral) with her husband.  With this loan, Beatrice wishes to buy a few sacks of cement to sell. With the profits, she wishes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: A. Jeanne est née en 1965 et est mariée à AFOTON, un pêcheur. Jeanne a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Jeanne habite le quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Jeanne vit avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple supporte ensemble les divers charges familiales. Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Jeanne est dans la restauration. Jeanne prépare en effet, de la pâte de maïs accompagnée de différentes sauces qu’elle vend à la devanture de sa maison. Jeanne s’approvisionne au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. Jeanne  exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans environs. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu déjà six prêts de ALIDé, prêts qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de développer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Jeanne sollicite un septième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne A. was born in 1965 and is married to Mr. Afoton, a fisherman. Jeanne has one child who is in school. Jeanne's family has been living in the Lokokoukoumè quarter of the Sèmè-Podji commune for about twenty years. Together, the couple manages the household's needs. Jeanne has not been to school. Jeanne runs a food service business. She makes maize pasta with different sauces, and sells the dishes from the front of her house. Jeanne buys her supplies at the Houègbo market in Benin. She has been doing this for about fifteen years. She has already received six loans from ALIDé, all of which she repaid on time. She wants to build her business and meet the needs of an ever growing number of customers, so Jeanne is seeking a seventh loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and condiments

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
Jose Arturo R. T. tiene 30 años.  Es casado vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Mila (2) y Diojenes (1). 

Jose es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Jose se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de ciclo corto maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en Matilde Esther.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz y cacao para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para sacar a la familia adelante. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta cocinar, y celebrar las fiestas del Recinto San Jose en el mes de Diciembre.
texts.en:
José Arturo Rodríguez T., 30, is married and lives in Chillanes canton, Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children: Mila, 2, and Diógenes, 1. José is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank located fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish and two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. José farms short growing cycle corn and cacao. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and he makes his sales in Matilde Esther. He is asking for funds to buy corn and cacao to plant in order to increase his business. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to get his family ahead in life. He says that the greatest challenge he faces is during harvest time because rain has damaged the access roads He enjoys cooking and celebrating the Recinto San José festivals in December.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and cacao plants.

loans.name: El Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Brenda  trabajaba en una financiera  como supervisora, al casarse cambiaron muchas cosas  cuando llegaron los hijos  tubo que dedicarles mas tiempo esto  la obligo a dejar el trabajo, ya en casa pudo juntar algo D. dinero D. lo que su esposo le daba y pensó hacer algo en su propia casa,  el hermano D. Brenda es mayorista D. huevos fue el que le dio la idea D. venderlos en su misma casa  así empezó su negocio  vendiendo huevos por menor  solo por kilos sus principales compradores eran sus vecinos y algunas personas que  pasaban por la puerta D. su casa, en la actualidad también los venD. por mayor tiene muchos clientes  reparte a tiendas, restaurantes y otros negocios, D. otro lado también se ayuda con otro negocio D. venta D. celulares esto le deja ganancias extras además D. ser un negocio rentable  ella  quiere dedicarse a este negocio por completo  es un  proyecto que espera concretar  junto a  su esposo que siempre la apoya para eso están ahorrando para hacerse D. un capital.
Su préstamo actual le servirá para abastecerse D. mercadería  para su negocio D. venta D. huevos y seguir trabajando para lograr sus objetivos.

* La Sra Brenda esta con polo rojo
texts.en:
Brenda worked in a financial firm as a supervisor. When she got married, many things changed. When her children arrived, she had to dedicate more time to them, and she was obliged to leave her job. At home, she was able to save some of the money that her husband gave her and she thought of doing something in her home. Her brother is an egg wholesaler, and he gave her the idea of selling eggs in her own home. This is how she started her business selling eggs retail, only by the kilo. Her main buyers were her neighbours and those who passed by the door of her home, but she now also sells them wholesale. She has many customers; stores, restaurants and other businesses. She also helps with another business, cell phone sales. This gives her external earnings. On top of having a profitable business, she wants to dedicate herself fully to this business. It is a project that she hopes to fulfill with her husband who always supports her. She is saving for this to store up capital. This loan will be used to proviD. merchandise for her egg sales business and to continue working toward her goals. * Brenda is in the red polo.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of eggs

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo de 36 años, y de su pequeño hijo Luis de 3 años. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas del cultivo ayudando en la labor a sus padres, luego cuando formó su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo. Dice que la labor de campo es muy sacrificada, pues siembra papa y arveja en sus chacras propias, y debe vigilar sus cultivos todos los días, desde muy temprano, para cuidarlos de las plagas de insectos y de las inclemencias del tiempo que muchas veces afectan y atacan sus cultivos y echan a perder la mayor parte de la producción. Lo que no le gusta es cargar, junto con su esposo, los pesados sacos de productos naturales, para llevarlos a comercializar hasta los mercados de la ciudad, aunque asegura que obtiene regulares ganancias de las ventas al por mayor. Como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado aumentar su producción de arvejas, además quiere comprar reses para criarlo y luego venderlo a mayor precio. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y promete ser puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar progresando. Marleni tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de abono y fertilizantes pues desea mejorar sus cultivos para producir en mayor cantidad y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marleni is 28 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Eduardo who is 36 years old, and their small son Luis who is 3 years old. She has been dedicated to agriculture from a very young age. She learned cultivating techniques by helping her parents, then she formed her own family and began working with her husband. She says working in the fields is very demanding since she grows potatoes and peas in her own small farm and must keep an eye on the crops daily, from very early in the morning to protect it from pests and insects and the harshness of the weather that many times affect and attack their crops ruining the majority of the production. What she does not like is carrying, along with her husband, the large sacs of natural products to take them to sell all the way to the markets in the the city in spite of assuring that she earns regular profits by selling wholesale. Since she is an aspiring woman she plans to increase her pea production in the future. In addition she wants to buy and raise cows and then eventually sell them at the highest price possible. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual and responsible in her loan payments. She is also very thankful for all of the people who made this loan possible that will allow her to continue progressing. Marleni plans using the requested loan to buy fertilizer to improve her crops and produce the greatest quantity possible and obtain optimal profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es: Jesusa, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Martín de 37 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Con mucho esfuerzo Jesusa ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva plátano y café, los cuales luego lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta La Merced, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 36 years old. She is a Mom and a very unpretentious and hard working person. She lives in her own home together with her husband Martin, 37 years old, and their 3 beloved children, to whom she hopes to provide a better education. With a great deal of work Jesusa has managed to work her fields and make them very productive. She cultivates bananas and coffee and she later sells the harvest in the city of La Merced. There she sells in wholesale. Her harvests have provided them with the necessary income to support the family and so she enjoys investing all her energy in her business. What she most enjoys about her work is caring for the plantations. She has worked in business for the past 8 years. The most difficult part of her work is having to transport the harvest all the way to the city of La Merced. The sacks she carries are very heavy and tire her very much. In time she hopes to purchase more land to increase her production. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been very punctual with her previous loans and she hopes to keep up her record. Within her community group she is a very involved member, always aware of the groups business and agreements. With the three thousand nuevos soles she requests she will purchase more fertilizer to improve her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: 03.01.02 Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Yen T. T. (9) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Yen is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02 Dien Bien (03.01.02 Dien Bien).

Yen is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Yen runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Yen has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Yen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

She is now requesting a new loan of 4.248.000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  T. T. Hue (178) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall.

2.  T. T. Oanh (7) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yen T. T. (9) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Yen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dien Bien (03.01.02 Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Yen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yen kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Yen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Hue (178) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  T. T. Oanh (7) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa Aminta Benítez tiene 44 años de edad y junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos de 19, 14 y 12 años reside en el Barrio San Francisco en Catacamas, Olancho. Doña Rosa inició hace 10 años vendiendo granos básicos y el producto lo sacaba al crédito en una bodega, pero hace 3 años ella tuvo la idea de instalar una pulpería en su casa de habitación y como en ese momento no contaba con dinero disponible solicitó un préstamo en FAMA y con el apoyo recibido pudo hacerlo. Ahora ella tiene una pequeña pero bien surtida pulpería que atiende junto a su esposo desde las 5:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos necesarios para la dieta alimenticia de las familias, como ser arroz, lácteos, verduras, frijoles, maíz, etc. Rosa no cuenta con otra entrada de dinero así que necesita mantener bien surtido su negocio para que este le genere las ganancias suficientes para mantener a su familia. Su meta es tener un negocio más grande y mantener la unidad familiar. Es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y por bajas en las ventas se ha retrasado en el pago de sus cuotas 2 o tres días, pero siempre paga.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta Benítez, 44, lives with her husband and three children, who are 19, 14 and 12 years of age in the San Francisco neighborhood of Catacamas, Olancho.

She started selling groceries ten years ago.  She would buy her stock on credit from a warehouse.  Three years ago, though, she decided to install a grocery store in her home and since she lacked funds at that time she asked FAMA for a loan and with that help was able to do so. She now has a small, well-stocked grocery store that she and her husband tend to from 5am until 9pm.

She will use the requested funds to buy needed stock items common in families’ daily nutrition: rice, dairy products, vegetables, beans, corn, etc. Rosa does not have any other source of income so it’s important to have the store well stocked so that it will produce sufficient income to support her family. Her goal is to have a larger store and keep her family together.

This is her third loan cycle with FAMA.  Due to drops in sales she's sometimes late a day or two with her payments but she always pays.

loans.use: To buy cornflour, rice, soap, soft drinks, salt, coffee, bread, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nery Ivone

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nery Ivone; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de alquileres de departamento, ella tiene un departamento que alquila los diferentes cuartos, la socia quiere mejorar los cuartos. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar y comprar materiales para los cuartos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nery Ivone is a member of the community bank named Machupicchu. It is located in the district of Cusco, within the province and region of the same name. 

Nery Ivone is 36 years old and she is single. She balances her daily activities with her business. She rents out rooms and she would like to improve the condition of her facilities. She requests a loan to implement those improvements and to purchase those materials needed. 

She is very grateful to all of those that are taking part in the realization of his dream and he is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To implement improvements to rooms for rent.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.en:
Henry is 38 years old and lives in El Transito department in San Miguel together with his wife and daughter.  He is employed as a driver in a delivery company.  He earns $360 a month and has been working for this company for 10 years.

Henry is in the process of improving his home and for this he is requesting a loan to buy iron, cement and sand and pay the workmen.  His intention is to extend his house little by little so that he can live more comfortably.

Henry's dream is to finish extending his house, to have enough income to support his family and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy iron, sand and cement

loans.name: Ángel Rodolfo

texts.es:
Ángel Rodolfo E. M. tiene 33 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive  con la compañera y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Angel trabaja en la bananera como calificador y colocador de cintas de banano, trabaja desde hace dos año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ángel Rodolfo E. M. is 33 years old, in a common law marriage with his companion, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has one child.

The members of the VRC Dole 2 Communal Bank are farm laborers who work at the Dole banana plantation in the capital of the canton. All of the members live in the canton of Ventanas. Most of the members have worked on the plantation for more than a year and their activities are related to cultivating bananas. There are approximately 13 members.

Ángel works on the plantation as an inspector and is responsible for placing stickers on the bananas. He has been employed there for two years. Ángel buys what he needs at the #1 commissary in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to establish a business in his home. Ángel plans to equip his store and buy products for his business. With the help of this loan, he will be able to meet his needs financially. His dream is to improve his home and complete his goal of having a business.

Ángel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Initial capital to start a business in his home

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.es: Glicerio, de 45 años, está casado con Julia, de 43 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El valeroso y honrado, Glicerio, hace 2 años que se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos. Anteriormente, él, se dedicaba a trabajar en los cultivos de otras personas como peón, ahora con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró obtener un pequeño terreno agrícola de una hectárea de extensión. Ahí comenzó a sembrar sus propios frutos y granos. Su producción de plátanos es todo un éxito, como son plantas nuevas, dan muy buenos frutos; pero el café, los vende al señor Juan, que es un intermediario que constantemente visita la zona. Los planes de Glicerio, son mejorar sus plantaciones y comprar más hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y como nuevo integrante de su banco comunal, espera lograr incrementar su capital para poder invertir en la mejora de su producción. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 8 sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café y si el dinero le alcanza podrá contratar peones, para que le ayuden a cuidar sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Glicerio, 45, is married to Julia, 43.  They have 7 children but only four still live with them in their own house located in Sanchirio (Peruvian central jungle).  Courageous and honest Glicerio has been growing coffee and bananas for two years.  He used to work as a hired hand on fields that belonged to other people but now, with much effort and dedication, he managed to acquire a small, one hectare, piece of farmland.  This is how he started to plant his own fruits and grains.  

His banana crops are quite the success.  Because they are new plants, they produce very good fruit.  He sells the coffee to Juan, who is a middle man that constantly visits the area. Glicerio’s plans are to improve his plantings and to buy more hectares of farmland.

This is his first loan with MFP and, as a new communal bank member, he hopes to increase capital to invest in production improvement.  If he were to get the requested loan, he plans to use it to buy 8 sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee plants.  If there is still money left over he will hire field hands to help him care for his farmland.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of manure and hire hands to help him care for his crops.

loans.name: Josefa Del Rosario

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Para  la señora Josefa este es el cuarto crédito en el  Banco comunal y le agrada el Banco por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero  dos de ellos aun viven con ella, Su esposo hace algún tiempo sufre de una enfermedad y no trabaja. Uno de sus hijos estudia medicina.

Produce y vende dulces de distintos sabores y formas, también fabrica diferentes  tejidos en almohadas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 22h00,  ya que también vende sabanas y sobrecamas, las mismas que las va a comprar directamente de la fabrica. Nos cuenta que a veces se siente cansada pero el trabajo que ella realiza le gusta mucho y que lo hace con amor.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más materia prima como lana, hilos, telas, Sabanas, etc. Sus sueños es ver que su hijo terminen sus estudios y  que sea un gran medico.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank La Union Hace La Fuerza (Union Makes Strength) meet every 15 days in the Rocafuerte canton. This area is known for its delicious sweets, which the local people prepare and which are known throughout the country.

This is Señora Josefa's fourth loan with the community bank, and she is pleased with the bank for the additional benefits that the institution offers and for the ease of obtaining loans. She is 53 years old. She is married and has four children from her marriage. They are adults, but two of them still live with her. One is studying medicine. Her husband has been suffering from an illness for some time and does not work. 

She makes and sells sweets of different flavors and forms. She also makes pillows from different fabrics. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m., since she also sells sheets and bedspreads, which she buys directly from the factory. She tells us that sometimes she feels tired but she likes the work that she does very much and she does it with love.

She is going to use this loan to buy more basic materials such as wool, thread, fabrics, sheets, and so forth. Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and be a great doctor.

loans.use: Buy wool, thread, fabric, and sheets.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 24-year-old engineer who works in an air conditioning and heating systems company. Mahmoud holds an engineering degree and he works in the field installing systems. Mahmoud wants to start another business besides this work. Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN to purchase the needed tools to start installing and fixing heating and air conditioning systems for houses. Mahmoud appears in the picture above, in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To start up his own air conditioning and heating systems business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen G. G. tiene 74 años de edad y su esposo tiene la misma edad que ella, tuvo 9 hijos de los cuales viven 8 y uno ya fellecio, a pesar de su edad ella se didca a la venta de frutas y verduras, en su domicilo esta ubicado su pequeno puesto de venta, con lo poco que saca de las ventas ella vuelve a comprar mas mercancia y suplir algunas necesidades de ella y su esposo, doña Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora porque a pesar de tener tan avanzada edad y la enfermedad de la diabetes ella no esta sin hacer algo para lam obtencion de recursos. A doña Carmen le ha gustado ser independiente de sus hijos y tener su propio dinero por cualquier emergencia que se l epueda presentar, ella no depende del todo de sus hijos ya cada quien tiene su propia obligacion con sus familias y dependientes.
Doña Carmen solicito un credito de dinero, primero porque necesita un poco mas de capital para invertir en su pequeño negocio y segundo porque ella tiene la capacidad y la confianza en poder liquidarlo, con este dinero ella pudo comprar; platanos, naranjas,mandarinas, manzanas, duraznos, piña, sandia, melones,tambien compro,jitomates, chiles, cebollas, ajos, lechuga romana, papas, zanahorias, chayotes y calabacitas.
Carmen lo que puede desear es primero que su salud no se complique, ya que la diabetes ees un padecimiento que necesita mucho cuidado y un tratamiento un poco complicado, ella espera no caer en una crisis, pero tambien quiere ver prosperar un poco mas su negocio que sus ventas no caigan y que ese entusiasmo y ganas de trabajar no le falte cada dia.
Su esperanza que la conserva y la mantien de pie es mirar a sus bisnietos, y que su espodos esta bien de salud si el padecimiento que sufre ella, ella espera un dia partir sin tanto sufrimiento. Ella nos dice que esta tranquila para la hora de su partida.
Les agradece a todos los que puedan leer un poco de su vida alrededor del mundo y para quienes se sienten tristes o desanimados, que puedan mirar en ella un ejemplo de vida y lo hermosos que es llegar a esa edad, la viad es una cajita de sorpresas, pero hay que estar preparados para cada detalle que tiene para nosostros, gracias a kiva y a fundacion realidad, que DIOS los llene de vida y salud.
texts.en:
Carmen G. G. is 74 years old and her husband is the same age as her. They had 9 children, of whom 8 are living and 1 has passed away. Despite her age she still sells fruits and vegetables. She has installed a small stand in her home and whatever profits she makes in her  business she reinvests them in the purchase of more merchandise and to provide for some of her  husband's needs. Carmen is a very hardworking person and despite her advanced age and her diabetes she's never without an occupation to earn an income. Carmen has enjoyed being independent of her children by having her own money for whatever emergency comes up. She does not depend at all on her children. They each have their own obligations, family, and dependents to take care of. 

Carmen requested a loan to supplement her working capital, to invest in her small business. She is confident she will be able to repay the loan. This loan was used to purchase: bananas, oranges, mandarin oranges, apples, peaches, pineapples, watermelons, cantaloupes, tomatoes, chilli peppers, onions, garlic, romaine lettuce, potatoes, carrots, chayotes, and zucchini. 

Carmen's wish is to have no further complications in her health. Diabetes is a disease that requires much attention and a somewhat complicated treatment. She hopes not to have a health crisis, but she also wants to prosper with her business. She wants to see steady sales and to never fail to have enthusiasm and wish to work.

Her hope is kept up when she is able to see her great grand children. Her husband is in good health. She hopes to not have to suffer and to one day pass away without pain. She says that she is not upset about the hour of her passing. 

She is grateful to all of those around the world who have taken the time to read about her life.  To all those individuals who feel sad or depressed, she wishes them to look up on her life as an example of how beautiful it is to reach her age. Life is a little box full of surprises, but one has to be ready for all those things that are in store for us. Thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner). May God bless you and fill you with the joy of life and good health.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Manuel es propietario de un taller de Soldadura y tiene la necesidad de comprar una maquina cortadora ya que la que tiene actualmente ya esta muy deteriorada, el señor tiene 19 años con su taller y de ahí ha sacado a su familia adelante y ha logrado dales una buena calidad de vida, con la compra de esa maquina el podrá dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y por lo tanto hacer su trabajo mas rápido y con calidad para así poder tener las ganancias que el requiere.
texts.en: Victor Manuel is the owner of a welding shop and he needs to purchase a cutting tool to replace the one he has now. He has had his shop for 19 years and he has been able to provide for his family with it. He has managed to provide them with a good quality of life. With the purchase of this tool he will be able to provide better service to his clients and to speed up and add quality to his work. He will be able to secure the earnings that he requires.

loans.use: To purchase a cutting tool for his workshop.

loans.name: Mónica Mercedes

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

La señora Mónica  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, además es la secretaria  del banco y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella y sus compañeras han podido surgir en sus negocios y así pueden aportar con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 43años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 23, 22 y 14 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en Universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en el Ministerio de Agricultura. Ella es orientadora en una escuela de la localidad.

Tienen una finca en el campo en la cual junto a su hijo mayor que estudia para médico veterinario han construido una granja en la cual empezaron un negocio de cría de cerdos, recién tienen este negocio seis meses, con un crédito anterior empezaron con la compra de unas chanchas las mismas que ya parieron y están en la cría de estos y otros cerdos que compraron pequeños, piensan vender los cerdos cuando estén grandes a comerciantes de la ciudad.  En este negocio su hijo que es el encargado trabaja todos los días ya que además  le sirve de práctica en sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos, medicinas y otros productos para el mejor crecimiento de estos animalitos. Sus sueños son comprase un carro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Las Piedras' community bank meet in Las Piedras neighborhood, in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This city is known for its traditional culture, the cheerfulness of its people and the San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas.

Mónica is a founding member of the community bank and also its secretary.  She likes being a member of the bank because, through the loans, she and her fellow group members have been able to make progress in their businesses and help with their household expenses.
