Mónica is 43 years old, married, and has three children aged 23, 22 and 14.  Her two eldest are studying at university and her youngest is in high school.  Her husband works for the Ministry of Agriculture.  Mónica is a counselor at a local school.

Mónica and her husband have a plot of land in the country where, together with their eldest son who is studying to be a vet, they have built a farm and started a business raising pigs.  They have had this business for six months.  They used a previous loan to start buying pigs.  These have already given birth and they are raising them and some other young pigs that they bought.  They are planning to sell the pigs when they are bigger to salespeople in the city.  Their son is in charge of the business and he works in it every day as it provides him with practice for his studies.

This loan will be used to buy feed, medicines and other products needed to better raise their animals.  Their dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy feed, medicines and other products to help grow their pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Ismael

texts.fr: Monsieur  Ismael  a  30  ans  et  est  marié.   Il  a  4 enfants  à  nourrir.  Pour cela, il  vend  la viande  de  bœuf  pour s’occuper  de  sa  famille. Il a déjà  remboursé  2  crédits  à wages. Pour acquerir les bœufs, il le fait à  Adetikopé et    a  commencé  cette  activité  en  1990.  Il demande  un prêt  pour  acheter  deux   bœufs, un mâle  et  une  femelle. Le monsieur en question est celui qui est entrait de couper la viande.
texts.en: Ismael is 30 years old and he is married. He has 4 children to feed. He sells beef meats to support his family.  He has already had 2 past loans with Wages (Kiva Field Partner). He buys beef cattle in Adetikope and he started his business in 1990. He requests a loan to purchase two heads of cattle, a male and a female. The individual in question is the one pictured butchering the meat.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle.

loans.name: Niteka Group

texts.fr:
Ernest T.  est un  commerçant âgé de 27ans qui habite  la localité de Masanganzira en province de Ngozi au Nord du Burundi. Il fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme le haricot, le riz et le grain de maïs depuis 5 ans alors qu’il était élève  avant de pratiquer ce metier. Il a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de la 6e année primaires. Il  est marie a Rwasa Emeline, une cultivatrice, et ont ensemble 3 enfants  âgés respectivement de 5ans, 3ans et 7 mois. Il arrive au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de produits alimentaires  à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Il espère un jour être un grand commerçant qui fait le commerce de gros. 

Il est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Niteka».
texts.en:
Ernest T.  is a 27-year old retailer who lives in Masanganzira, in the province of Ngozi, in the north of Burundi. He has been selling food products such as haricot beans, rice and corn for the last 5 years, when he was a student before taking up this activity. He went to school up to the 6th year of elementary school. 

He is married to Rwasa Emeline, a market gardener, and together they have 3 children aged 5, 3 and 7 months. He is at his 6th cycle with of community credit with Turame. He is asking Kiva for a loan to increase his capital by buying a large amount of food products to re-sell and make a significant profit. One day, he hopes to be a large-scale trader and work in wholesale. He is a member of the community group "Nitkea."

loans.use: to increase capital by buying a large quantity of food products to re-sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A., age 39, is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice to offer for sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She and her husband have three school-aged children. 
 
In 2008, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. 

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure to use in her rice field. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for use in her rice field

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She tills her land for planting rice crops. She also grows vegetables. Nancy raises her pigs in her backyard. Nancy sells her harvest and grown pigs to the market.

Nancy's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and piglets.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Ana is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Ana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Ana has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ana is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo, a 40-year-old married father of a grown child, has been a farmer growing corn for the past 10 years in the Philippines. His wife works as a housewife and helps him in managing their farmland. Romulo is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizer and seed, and hopes in the future to improve his farm to better support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Sorbeh United Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sorbeh United” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 4,200,000 for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ibrahim is the leader of this group. He is approximately 30 years old and is married, with three children who attend primary school. Ibrahim sells rice and palm oil (the most favorite cooking oil). With many years of experience in business, Ibrahim is going to use his share of the loan to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm oil in large quantities

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a hardworking, 55-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with eight children. She has been selling firewood since 1998. Eunice has retained her business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She supplements her income by farming. She also owns rental houses. Eunice needs 30,000 KES to buy firewood. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Madres Unidas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija la cual es  mayor de edad y está casada pero vive en su casa con el esposo y sus pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años. Su esposo es agricultor.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas, ella deja sus productos  a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez  que necesite. Nos cuenta que este negocio lo empezó con el primer créditos que recibió del banco ya hace muchos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren a ella a pesar de que hay mucha competencia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 18 años y  le gusta por la ayuda y los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the lowlands of Montecristi, a city known for the great diversity of its traditional products such as the woven Panama hats that are famous inside and outside of the country, the communal bank "Madres Unidas" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Juana, 59, who is married and has a grown daughter who is married but lives in her house with her husband and their small children who are 8 and 3 years old.  Juana's husband is a farmer.

Juana has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door and also sells from her house where she has set up a small store.  She works 3 days a week, mostly in the mornings. She sells her products on credit, and collects every 15 days.  Every time she needs merchandise she goes to buy it in Guayaquil.  She tells us that she started this business many years ago with the first loan that she received from the bank, and that it has always gone very well because she has a lot of customers that prefer her business even though there is a lot of competition.  

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her communal bank since it was started 18 years ago, and she likes it because of the help and the benefits she receives from the institution.

Her dreams are to carry on and continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 28 years old and married. For the past five years, she has successfully earned a living by selling child and adult clothing. Her business is well-organized. Joyce operates her business daily from seven in the morning through eight at night and she employs one person to help her. 

Joyce is requesting a Kiva loan via the Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying various types of clothing for children and adults. By expanding her clothing choices, she hopes to earn more profit. Joyce will save her profits for her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to expand her clothing selection

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma, age 61, operates a dress-making business. She primarily offers curtains, but she also offers clothing items such as dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, and skirts. Neighbors come to her to request made-to-order clothes or curtains. In addition to her business, Lerma offers rooms in her house for rent as a dormitory. She earns a minimum of 8,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

Lerma and her husband Maximo have two children and live in Malibay, Pasay City. Maximo is a carpenter. At this time, Lerma is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Lerma believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children, particularly as she herself has been an undergraduate. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. A portion of the loan will be used to renovate a room to prepare it for rental. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lerma dreams of being able to give her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business, and hopes to have her own shop for her clothes and curtains. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha de 39 años de edad, nacida en el departamento de Granada, casada, de oficio comerciante, madre de tres hijos, tiene una distribuidora de alimentos y granos básicos, tiene alrededor de tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Inició a la edad de 36 años y el negocio lo siguió porque ya estaba establecido por su hermana donde inicio como ayudante por muchos años, al final ella quedo con el negocio siendo este  a la vez es su primer  negocio, su venta de granos básicos la tiene localizada en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada. Doña Martha solicito el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, jabones al por mayor para surtir su negocio, de modo que le ayude a diversificar sus productos dándole una mejor calidad de atención a sus clientes. Una de sus metas es tener una cadena de distribuidora de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Señora Martha is 39 years old.  She was born in the department of Granada, is married, works in retail, and is the mother of three children.  She has a distributorship of food and bulk grains, which she has been doing for about three years.  She started when she was 36, and followed this line of business because it had been started by her sister whom she initially helped out for several years  Ultimately she left, it being time for her first business.  She sells bulk grains from a location in the municipal market in the city of Granada.

Doña Martha is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and soap at wholesale to stock up her business so that it will help her to diversify her products and provide a better quality of service for her customers.

One of her goals is to have a chain of distributorships for bulk grains.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, soap at wholesale to stock up her business.

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai is a 27-year-old entrepreneur who owns one small stall at the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He is the father of two children, age 1 and 3, and his mother babysits while his spouse helps him with the business. 

Erdenedalai has been operating a clothing sales business at the market since 2002 when he first rented his stall. Today, his working capital is approximately two million MNT. With his business profit, he has bought a small land plot located in the outer ger district (which has no basic infrastructure) and furnishing goods. 

Erdenedalai is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to import more women clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

In the future, he desires to build a new house on his plot of land.

loans.use: to import more clothes from Ereen, a border city of China.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, vive en casa de su madre con su hija de 1 año y su hermano, desde hace tres años se dedica a vender ropa para todas las edades: para niños, damas y caballeros como: short, pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas todos los días vende en el mercado y más que todo el día domingo es  el día que más se vende.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería y tener más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes, y comprar  blusas, pantalones, faldas, vestidos de esa forma obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia y tener  posibilidades de incrementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
María lives in her mother’s house with her brother and her one-year old daughter.  She’s been selling clothing for all ages for the last three years.  She sells clothes for children, women and men like: shorts, pants, shirts, blouses and skirts.  She sells every day at the market but mostly on Sundays which is the day that sales are best.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to have more variety available for her customers and to buy blouses, pants, skirts and dresses to earn more income to help her family and have the possibility of increasing her business more.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and married to a farmer in the village where they are living. The couple is blessed with three school-aged children. To increase her family's household income, Marites has been engaged in her retail store business for almost two years and earns about 500 PHP daily.

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stock items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with two children. 
Eliza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .
Eliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Eliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 37 years of age and married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Telesia needs a loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Telesia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en:
Nurlan is a 23-year-old IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who engages in cattle breeding and milk selling. He has 3 years of experience in this field. He is not married. His brother helps him run the business. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them, and then resells them in the livestock bazaar once every 5-6 months. 

He sells milk and yoghurt almost every day and this also brings him a good income. Being very popular, milk and meat products are in very high demand, and Azerbaijani people use them in everyday cuisine.  

Now Nurlan is thinking of getting married, and to do this he needs to build a house. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase another calf and a milk cow. He believes that additional cattle will bring up his income and he will be able to save money, build a house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.es: El señor Constancio nacido en la comunidad de HuacaHuasi de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba, actualmente vive con su familia en su comunidad en una vivienda construido de puro barro. La actividad a que se dedica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales en las parcelas heredadas de sus padres y algunas propias.  El presente crédito está solicitando para reintegrar de la compra de un vehículo que necesita para llevar a la escuela a sus hijos de su comunidad a la localidad de Tiraque y poder transportar sus productos al pueblo para su comercializacion.
texts.en: Constancio was born in the community of HuacaHuasi in Tiraque Province, Cochabamba Department.  He currently lives in his community with his family in a house made entirely of clay.  He is a farmer growing tubers and cereals on parcels inherited from his parents and on some of his own.  The present loan he’s requesting is to resume payments on a car he needs to take his children from his community to school in Tiraque and to transport his products to town to be sold.

loans.use: to resume car payments.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es: Edwar, de 43 años, es un hombre trabajador, bueno y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 19, 17 y 15 años. Todos los días trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos con quienes comparte la alegría de vivir juntos en su casa propia que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo de Edwar consiste en la siembra de cítricos, tiene una chacra en donde empezó hace 15 años con este trabajo, al principio tenía solo unas cuantos plantas cítricas, pero poco a poco y con bastante esfuerzo fue sembrando uno a uno y así fue creciendo su sembrío que tiene una medida de 1.5 hectáreas. Además de este negocio, tiene un ingreso adicional, que obtiene vendiendo bebidas alcohólicas heladas en su casa, y a diario se van a comprarle sus bebidas, en este negocio tiene la ayuda de algunos obreros quienes se encargan de la limpieza de la chacra. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que puede disponer de tiempo y tener ingresos que le permiten tener una mejor condición de vida. Antes de tener su negocio se dedicaba a trabajar para otras personas y eso no le permitía tener muchas ganancias. Ahora lo que más desea es consolidar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 8 con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado, se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cutas, como anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará bebidas para seguir vendiendo, además comprará materiales agrícolas para poder realizar la limpieza de sus tierras y contratar a algunas personas que le ayuden con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Edwar is 43 years old and is a good, hardworking, and responsible man.  He lives with his wife and they have three children, ages 19, 17, and 15.  He works every day to be able to provide a better quality of life for his children, with whom he shares his happiness for living together in their own home that they built with great effort.

Edwar raises citrus.  He has an orchard that he started 15 years ago.  At first he only had a few plants, but little by little, with lots of effort, he planted one by one and began increasing his orchard.  Now he has 1.5 hectares.

He also brings in additional income by selling cold alcoholic beverages from his home.  He buys them daily.  In this business he gets help from some of the workers who tend to the fields.  The good thing about his work is that he can have some spare time and also enough income to improve his life.  Before having this business, he worked for other people and that didn’t provide for much of an income.

Now he wants to consolidate his business.  This will be his 8th loan though MFP and he is very grateful to know that he will have financial support, now that he will feel certain that he can advance his business.  At the same time, he is committed once more to make his payments on time, as before.  With this loan of 1,500 PEN ($575), he will buy beverages to resell, and also agricultural supplies so that he can clean his fields, and hire some workers who can help with the work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 40-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 16. All of them are in school. Achol has been selling food in a hotel in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Achol has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, rice, and maize flour. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize flour, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rose Muthoni

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with 2 children, ages 3 and 8. She is an ambitious woman. She operates a grocery retail business where she sells tomatoes, oranges, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest challenge as the high cost of the goods she buys to resell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tomatoes and oranges. Her goal is to diversify her business by expanding into a big retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and tomatoes.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí, tiene 26 años, ella viaja a la Selva distribuyendo abarrotes por mayor, tiene 1 hijo, es soltera, esta en Finca desde hace 4 años, todo este tiempo que pasó ella siente que ha progresado mucho en su vida personal como en su negocio, las capacitaciones son muy valiosas para ella, ya que ahora ahorra y esta cumpliendo todo lo que se propone, pudo comprarse un terreno en Huanta, y ahora su deseo es poder construir su casa, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  ropa y abarrotes.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank (Capulí is a kind of cherry tree). 

She is 26 years old and she travels to Selva distributing wholesale groceries. She is a single mother with one child. 

She has been with Finca for 4 years. Through all of the time that has passed she has felt that she has made good progress in her personal and business life. The training sessions are very valuable for her. She is now saving and is keeping to her plan. She has bought land in Huanta and now she wants to be able to build a house. 

The money from this loan will be used to buy clothing and groceries.

loans.use: to buy clothing and groceries

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Prima has a junk shop that sells plastics, bottles & metals. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

Prima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Prima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastics & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to get a bigger room from where she can sell her charcoal and also to sell wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Felix  Francisco

texts.es:
felix se dedico a la misma actividad de su padre lo que es la venta de mariscos la misma que aprendió desde  muy joven. Su trabajo lo realiza solo. Su actividad la realizar levantandose muy en la mañana para viajar y poder  pescar los mariscos que va a vender, estos viajes los realiza cada dos dias. Algunas de sus dificultades al viajar y estar en el mar son son los ladrones y las piratas.

En su vida personal felix   esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene hijos pequeños que por edad no estudian todavía. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio y con su familia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo va a comprar herramientas para pescar y aumentar la pesca de su negocio y material de construcción para su casa. Unas de sus metas es poder terminar su casa y comprarse un carro para su familia.
texts.en:
José sells seafood just like his father, who taught him the business when he was very young. He works on his own, getting up very early to travel and catch what he's going to sell. He makes these trips every other day. Some of the challenges he faces in traveling and being out at sea are thieves and pirates.

In his personal life, José is married and his wife stays home. They have little children who are too young still to go to school. He has big dreams for his business and for his family, so he'd like to use the loan to buy fishing equipment for his business and building supplies for his house. One of his goals is to be able to finish his house and buy a car for his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies and construction materials.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a man of thirty-seven years. He is married and a father of three children. In addition, he is a farmer, and he has been farming for nine years, now. He also started a new business, selling tiles and interior decor items. He earns a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Cyrus's third loan with Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy tiles for sale at his business. In future, he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase tiles for sale at his business.

loans.name: Rokhy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2013.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité l'agriculture.

Codou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant son livret est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 46 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Elle cultive le mil,l'arachide et le maÏs,elle est à son deuxiéme prêt avec notre insitution.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter des semences de mil pour 20000f,de l'arachide 20000f et du maÏs pour 15000f.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux dépenses familiales et d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in November of 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same village and are all farmers. 

Codou, who is standing on the right in the photo raising her booklet, is the group leader. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. 

She grows millet, peanuts and corn. This is her second loan with our institution. 

With the loan, she plans on buying millet seeds for 20,000 F, peanut seeds for 20,000 F and corn seeds for 15,000 F. Her goal is to help pay for her family's expenses and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, peanut and corn seeds.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Sirakaru is a village that is famously known for producing the “creme de la creme” when it comes to athletics. It also has a lot of smallholder farmers who work the land and raise animals. 
Unfortunately, the people who do this farm work face many problems, like the high costs of the farm inputs. Rose has full knowledge of this but always finds a way to come through. 

Rose is from a remote village in the Sirakaru, Kitale area of Kenya and she is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize and vegetables and also keeping dairy cows. Rose has been able to provide nutritious food for her family.

Rose is requesting a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Rose believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Rose waits for your kindness.

Be inspired to loan to her today to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. owns a cosmetic and clothing shop in a part of Guayaquil called La Zona. She even makes breakfast for the children of her customers who come in to shop before they head out to work. Sara first opened her business by borrowing $100 from the chulqueros or loan sharks, and she typically works 7am-7pm. Her goal is to be a consultant for Yanbal, an Ecuadorian beauty supply company that places products in most salons across the country. She would like to use the proceeds from her loan to construct a store next to her home. She knows the fashion and cosmetics industry, so she would like to continue helping customers find the best products. Sara is a 31 year-old married mother of two who loves the business she runs. She says that the best part about her job is that she helps women feel good about themselves when they get dressed up for special occasions. Ms. M. is asking for this loan so she can purchase more Yanbal products, take a seminar in cosmetic sales, and buy a variety of clothes for her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ms. Medina is asking for this loan so she can purchase more Yanbal products, take a seminar in cosmetic sales, and buy a variety of clothes for her store.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.en:
In this zone of the city I am known as "Angel the container seller," because I sell plastic items for the home. I have another stand in another part of the city, which is run by my wife, and with the earnings we make we help our family with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

En esta zona de la capital me conocen como angel el vende pailas, y es porque me dedico a la venta de articulos de plasticos que son utiles en los hogares, tengo otro puesto en otro punto de la ciudad que es atendido por mi esposa, con los ingresos que percibimos ayudamos a nuestra familia con los gastos.

loans.use: To purchase containers, razers, cups, plates and other plastic items.

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Kol C. is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. runs a tailoring business where she sells clothes to people at the local market.  Her business typically generates about $6.00 per day.  Her husband, is a credit officer at a bank and can make about $4.00 per day.  Their two children are very young and still attend school.  C. hopes to use the loan to purchase more clothes to expand her tailoring business.  In the future, the family hopes to have enough money to build a concrete house.  Eventually, they dream they will be able to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand tailoring business.

loans.name: Chery

texts.en:
Mr. Chery S. is 26 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. He and his wife rent out traditional Khmer instruments to people who are celebrating a wedding ceremony.  They earn about 2 dollars a day.They have one child. 
They want to expand their business by purchasing instruments such as speakers, a microphone and a VCD to rent out.

loans.use: To purchase some instruments to expand their business.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania K., 49 years old, is from Faleu Manono. She owns a pig farm, which she developed with the help of SPBD's assistance. The farm has become a source of income for her and her family. According to Epifania, this is a particularly good business in Samoa. Epifania has a number of customers from her village and at times even from outside. Epifania says that she is fortunate to have received the assistance from SPBD, as she now has a good business where her family can rely on for financial support. She would, nevertheless, like to expand the business, and is therefore asking for a loan of US$300.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Gabe Avelina

texts.en:
Gabe Avelina J. Alcahuamaní belongs to the village bank “Sarita.”

She sells clothing in the middle of the bustling “Mercado Nely García,” a popular market in Ayacucho, Peru. She can be found there daily, shaded from the hot sun under a colorful umbrella and behind her display of clothing of all different types. There she waits with a smile on her face to chat with interested customers. Gabe buys her large supplies of clothing from a larger market in Lima. Twice a month she makes the 10-hour bus trip to the Peruvian capital. The majority of the clothing she keeps in her home, and daily brings a smaller supply to the market.

Before she was selling clothing in the market, Gabe sold “especias,” or spices, traveling between grocery stores and even between provinces to find markets for her products. When Gabe’s oldest daughter entered elementary school, she decided to change occupations to something more permanent and less tiring. That was one year ago today, and already she has her own space in the market and several regular customers.

As a long-term goal, Gabe hopes to open her own clothing store in the center of town where she would supply clothing of all types and occasions to the community. She says she loves her village bank because it is a place where she can meet with friends and also learn about how to better care for her home and her family. Gabe is asking for a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy larger quantities of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.use: Gabe is asking for a loan of $500, with which she will be able to buy larger quantities of clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: Khursheda is a mother of 4 children, she has friendly family and her husband and her children help her with her business. She became client of Microinvest in 2003. Her first loan was about 500 somoni and she spent it on expanding her inventory. Her businesses is very successful, which she attributes to her excellent customer service – she is quick, friendly and polite and always has a smile on her face. She also sells a wide range of shoes so that her customers can usually find what they are looking for. She is now applying for this loan from Microinvest in order to further expand her successful business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en: Fatimah is a 39 years old woman. Before joining MBK, her husband, Y. was the only one who worked in the family. Since joining MBK, Fatimah started her own bamboo matting business from her house. She usually earns US$20 per month. She needs a IDR 1,100,000 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her Bamboo matting business

loans.name: Isabel Virginia

texts.es:
The transportation business is a very profitable one, especially when it involves transportation from one department to another. This is the business of Mrs. Isabel N., who has her own minibus to transport passengers both within León and from León to Managua. Mrs. Isabel N. is a single mother who has a son to take care of, so she is looking for a way to survive in order to provide her humble home with some stability.

Currently the minibus is broken and she needs to buy the parts for the repairs. Mrs. Isabel N. turns confidently to Ceprodel, who for six years has provided financial support to her. She currently has a record of six credits.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de transporte es un negocio muy rentable especialmente cuando se trata de traslado de un departamento a otro. Esta actividad es la de la señora Isabel N. quien tiene a su cargo un microbús propio para traslado de personal tanto a lo interno de León como de León a Managua. La señora Isabel N. es madre soltera y con un hijo que mantener por lo que busca la manera de sobrevivir para lograr la estabilidad de su humilde hogar.

Actualmente la situación que atraviesa es que el microbús esta dañado y por tal razón es necesario la compra de los repuestos para su debida reparación. Por esta razón es que ella muy confiadamente acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace seis años le ha brindado apoyo financiero para su sustento. Actualmente tiene un record de 6 créditos.

loans.use: Repair minibus

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en: I am Yasmeen I. from Lahore, second largest metropolis in Pakistan. I am 56, married and a mother of an only daughter who is married. My husband is weak and sick and cannot work whereas I create ready made garments. Since I am the only breadwinner of the family there is a great responsibility on my shoulders. I need a loan to make my business more productive. My group members are: Najma B. and Ghazala B. who both require loans for their embroidered clothes business. Haneefa Begum will invest her share of the loan in her son’s furniture business. Razia B. is borrowing for her son to buy him a rickshaw on installments. I have become their group leader because they are hardworking and in need.

loans.use: Improve existing business

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano Núñez is married and has 11 children, including two who died, one of which in a transportation acccident and the other shortly after birth. Emiliano states that losing these two sons emotionally affected him and his wife tremendously, but with the hlpe of their friends and families they were able to survive this tragedy of their lives.

Emiliana is an entrepreneur, during a number of year he ran a bar/dining establishment in a space that he rented and that was waited on by his wife and girls. After a time he opened a new business, this time out of his own home, and until this day, it reamins the most important source of their earnings. The business they own is attended to mostly by his wife and it has been six years since they opened this space. At the same time they are dedicated to selling raw materials such as fruits, vegetables, meat, milk products, bread products, canned products and products for the home, among other things.

Thanks to their great aptitude for business and their ability to save, they were able to purchase a truck that they use to sell meats and sausages in the areas outside of the city. The loans that the Paraguay Foundation previously provided them with was a great help in order for them to maintain their business.

In the future, Emiliano wishes to expand his business and open a mini market where he can sell a greater variety of merchandise and offer commodity/choice for his clients. Currently, Emiliano is asking for a loan with which he can acquire larger quantities of merchandise for his store, and his providers will offer him discounted proces for the products he does buy.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliano Núñez, esta casado, tiene 11 hijos de los cuales dos ya fallecieron uno de ellos en un accidente de tránsito y otro a los pocos meses de nacer. Emiliano cuenta que la pérdida de sus hijos le afecto mucho emocionalmente a él y su esposa pero que con la ayuda de sus amigos y familiares pudieron sobre llevar el trago amargo que significo esto en sus vidas.

Emiliano es un hombre emprendedor, durante varios años administro un bar-comedor en un local que alquilaba y que era atendido también por su esposa e hijas. Luego de un tiempo abrió otro negocio pero ya en su casa propia y que hasta hoy día es la fuente de ingresos más importante que tienen. El negocio que tienen es una despensa que es atendida principalmente por su esposa y ya van seis años desde que abrieron su local. En la misma se dedican a vender insumos de primera necesidad como frutas, verduras, carne, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, productos para el hogar, entre otras cosas.

Gracias a su buena aptitud para los negocios y su sentido del ahorro, el pudo comprarse una camioneta que lo utiliza para vender carnes y embutidos recorriendo los barrios de la ciudad. Los créditos que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorgo anteriormente también fueron una gran ayuda para mantener ambos negocios.

En el futuro, Emiliano, desea ampliar su despensa y abrir un mini market, en donde pueda vender mayor variedad de mercaderías y ofrecer comodidad a sus clientes. Hoy día Emiliano solicita un crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades para su despensa, de este modo, sus proveedores le ofrecen muy buenos descuentos por su compra al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase grass, sugar, bread, drinks, milk products, fruits, vegetables, meat, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Tuyến, 39 years old, lives with her husband and their two school aged children. She has been with the TYM Fund for 6 years. She uses her loans to invest in her husband’s bicycle repair shop. Because he is a good and trustworthy mechanic who is also a very hard worker, they build a good business. In average, they make 6-7USD a day. The family’s economy is stable and the kids have good education. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 950USD to buy some tools and stock more bicycle parts.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Tuyến sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Năm nay 39 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ TYM đã được 6 năm. Sau khi được vay vốn, chị Tuyến bàn với chồng mở cửa hàng sửa chữa và thay thế phụ tùng xe đạp. Nhờ có tay nghề và biết giữ uy tín nên cửa hàng nhà chị Tuyến luôn đông khách. Trung bình mỗi ngày thu nhập khoảng 6-7USD. Nhờ công việc hoạt động tốt, kinh tế phát triển nên 2 con của chị Tuyến được tạo điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ. Các cháu hiện đều đang học những năm cuối cấp. Bước sang vòng vốn này, chị Tuyến xin vay 950USD để mua thêm phụ tùng và dụng cụ sửa xe.

loans.use: Buy bike parts and repairing tools

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Julia is 28 years old and originally from Iquitos. She lives in the Manuel Arévalo District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Region. She is a high school graduate with one son, whom still depends on her since he´s in elementary school.

A year and a half ago she started selling beauty products, filling requests from friends, family and neighbors. She started with the Manuela Ramos organization one year ago with her first loan of 200 Peruvian Nuevo Soles which she invested buying the beauty products. Julia joined the Santa Elena II community bank via the invitation of several neighbors in her community.

With this loan of 800 Peruvian Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of more products.

She aspires to be the owner of a well-known beauty line and to be able to improve her income in order to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente, natural de Iquitos , vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad; curso estudios secundarios completos, tiene 01 hijo, el cual aun depende del hogar, está cursando estudios primarios.

Se inicio hace 01 año y medio en la venta de productos de belleza, entrega de pedidos que le hacen amigas, familiares y vecinos. Con Manuela Ramos empezó, hace 01 año con S/.200.el cual le fue otorgado como primer préstamo, los invirtió en la compra de sus pedidos de productos de belleza. La señora Rosario ingresa al Banco Comunal “Santa Elena II ” por invitación de algunas vecinas de su comunidad..

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos.

Ella aspira ser directora de una conocida línea de belleza y poder mejorar sus ingresos pudendo construir su casa propia.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 51 years old has been a very active member of TYM since 1998. In 2000, she borrow money to invest in raising chickens and achieve some success. After that, she keep on taking out loans to invest in the business and her family is having around 400 chicken right now. Always look out for a better ways to improve her business, she has been able to achieve success after success. Both of her children are in school right now. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 19 millions VND to invest into her business. Her family income is 6 million VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh H. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình Thương 1998 từ khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị luôn vay vốn phát triển kinh tế và là thành viên tích cực của cụm. Năm 2000 chị đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi gà đẻ, thấy việc chăn nuôi gà có lãi nên các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà và sửa sang chuồng trại nuôi thêm gà thịt, hiện tại gia đình chị đang có 400 con gà thịt, với mô hình chăn nuôi lớn kết hợp với sự cố gắng học tập kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi, nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị luôn cho thu nhập cao kinh tế phát triển, chị có 2 con hiện tại các con chị đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising chicken

loans.name: Miriam's Omega Group

texts.en:
Miriam is 30 years old, married and has a one-year-old child. She is also raising another child who is four years old. Miriam makes a living running a shop where she sells tomatoes. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Miriam has applied for a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers. She will share this loan with the other members of her group, who run businesses selling bananas, vegetables and clothing. The fifth member of her group works as a seamstress.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of items to sell.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: Mr. Heam M. is a villager in Angk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a motorbike taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Khoem Sokha, is a pig breeder. Since her pigs have grown, she does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed them. Thus, her husband is seeking a loan to buy more pig feed. Mr. Heam M. is 21 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed to keep the pigs healthy

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 22 years old and married with a two year old child. Since 2007, she has been a clothing, soap, and charcoal seller. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Maryam has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she used to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes, soap, and charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, soap, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi (Unity) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes (trois mariées et une veuve) du groupe benkadi de l’association Kégnéreyè ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers traditionnels dans le village de Kimparana de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce en gros de condiments alimentaires. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés les trois prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son quatrième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Pour augmenter leur marge bénéficiaire elles font des achats groupés auprès des grossistes à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Les achats concernent le laye, les oignons, du soumbala (pâte alimentaire fabriquée à partir des noix de néré), les aromes et autres épices. Les femmes du groupe benkadi vendent leurs marchandises à la maison et au marché de kimparana où les détaillants viennent s’y ravitailler à crédit hebdomadairement. Le cycle d’achat et de vente du groupe dure en moyenne une semaine. Par conséquent elles s’approvisionnent chaque semaine.
Elles espèrent réaliser en moyenne et par personne un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 CFA. qui sera utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de commerce et acheter les trousseaux de mariages pour les filles. Elles ambitionnent d’ouvrir à l’avenir une boutique de stockage et de vente de condiments à Kimparana.
texts.en:
The four women (three married and one widowed) of the Benkadi group of the association Kégnéreyè have an average age of 45 and on average 3 children. They live in traditional households in the village of Kimparana, Prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

This group of women essentially wholesales condiments. To expand the size of their businesses, they decided two years ago to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed three preceding loans, they are ready for their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). To increase their profit margin, they group their purchases from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). They purchase onions, soumbala (an edible paste made of néré nuts), flavorings and other spices. The women of the Benkadi group sell out of their homes and in the marketplace of Kimparana where retailers come weekly to purchase on credit. The buying and selling cycle of the group lasts on average one week. Therefore, they do their buying once a week.

They each hope to make on average a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA which they intend to use to bolster their working capital and buy wedding trousseaus for their daughters. They would like in future to open a shop where they could warehouse and sell condiments in Kimparana.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for re-sale .

loans.name: Luz Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 474, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar y con la ayuda de su hijo quien es el que maneja su herramienta de trabajo. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, 2 pares de amortiguadores y 2 frenos, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asiento, etc. 

Luz agradece al Banco por la ayuda brindada y por confiar en su persona. Desea tener dos movilidades más para mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz C. is a member of the Mujeres del Progreso (Women of Progress) microfinance institute, located on Nº 474 Comandante Suárez, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is a 62-year-old widow with 5 grown up children. She decided to invest her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300.00 PEN in selling chickens. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 5 years.

She currently owns a motorcycle taxi, and gets help from her son, who drives her work vehicle. This business yields her enough profits so that she can pay off her loan punctually.

With this 3,000.00 loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will fix the motor, have the seats re-upholstered, and purchase 2 tires, 2 pairs of shock absorbers, 2 brakes, etc.

Luz gives thanks to the microfinance institute for helping her and for trusting in her. She wishes to have two vehicles so that she can improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motor, upholster seats, purchase tires, shock absorbers, brakes, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth habita en Waspan Norte desde hace veinticinco años pues ahí nació, es casada y con dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad, uno de ello ya va a clase, su esposo trabaja en mecánica industrial, la Sra. Elizabeth vende cosméticos desde hace cinco años que comenzó con prestamos comunales, con esta solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en su negocio de cosméticos ya que para esta fecha le hacen muchos pedidos y las venta es buena, a largo plazo es poder captar mas clientes para mejorar sus ingresos y así crecer también en  capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth C. has been living in Waspan Norte for 25 years as she was born there. She is a married mother with 2 children, ages 2 and 8, one of whom is already in school. Her husband works as an industrial mechanic, while she has been selling cosmetics for five years. She started her business with microloans. She will invest this loan in her cosmetics business because this is the season when she gets a lot of orders and sales increase. In the long run, she hopes to be able to attract more customers so that she can improve her earnings and make her financial resources grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina F. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her operation three years ago. She is a 60 year old divorced mother with nine children. Seven of her children are independent while the rest are learning trades.

Rosina trades in products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. With this loan, Rosina wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. She also hopes to increase her savings to support two of her grandchildren in school. She would appreciate it very much for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased inventory for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha es una mujer soltera, que a sus 30 años siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, quiere formar una familia, pero es conciente que necesita tener un buen sustento económico antes para darle a sus hijos un buen futuro. Para comer bien en Juliaca, se tiene que visitar el restaurante de Martha, el cual se ha convertido en uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad, debido a la gran sazón que le pone a sus comidas. Ella ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y ha decidido que quiere ampliarlo, incrementando el número de mesas que actualmente tiene. A Martha le gusta cocinar y siempre lo hace con mucha dedicación, pero le disgusta servir y llevar los platos de comida a los clientes porque tiene que hacerlo sola, ya que no cuenta con el dinero para pagarle a un ayudante, aun así no se desanima y quiere salir adelante para en el futuro llevar una buena vida. Ya estando en su segundo préstamo, Ana que siempre paga todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ha decidido mejorar su negocio y siente que tiene el respaldo de los socios  de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida. Con el préstamo adquirido en Microfinanzas PRISMA, Martha ha decidido comprar  5 mesas con sus respectivas sillas, que le costarán entre 800 a 1000 nuevos soles, ella está dispuesta a poner plata de su parte, con tal de mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is an unmarried woman, 30 years old, who has always struggled to get ahead. She'd like to start a family, but she knows she needs to have good economic means of support before she can offer her children a good future. For eating well in Juliaca, a visit to Martha's restaurant is a must. It has become one of the most popular spots in the city because of the great flavor she gives her food. She's been working in this business five years and wants to expand it, increasing the number of tables she currently has. Martha likes to cook and always does it with great dedication, but she doesn't like serving and carrying the plates of food to her customers because she has to do it by herself, since she doesn't have the money to pay someone to help her. Still, she doesn't become discouraged and wants to get ahead in order to live a better life in the future. Now on her second loan, Ana always makes her payments on time. She has decided to improve her business and feels that she has the support of the members of her "banco communal" (communal bank), where she is well-liked. With a loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, Martha has decided to buy five tables and the chairs to go with them, which will cost between 800 and 1000 nuevos soles. She is ready to invest her own money in improving and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Serafima

texts.en: Serafima B. is the mother of three children at the age of 32. Serafima's main activity is raising cattle, but she earns a profit from selling beef at a wholesale market. She does her job very well and her sales are good, so she decided this year to buy more cows because the demand for beef is high enough and the risk is small. MicroInvest is ready to help Serafima to ensure her business development. Serafima also hopes Kiva lenders are ready to help with increasing her cattle.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim K. has been selected to be the leader by the other four members in the group loan; all the members are people living in Phnom Penh City. K., 21, works as a garment worker for a garment industry with a specific salary; she can make $80 per month. To help support the family's foods needs a little more, her husband works as a blacksmith. The young couple has been married four years and they have no children. K. wants her husband to get a new business as a taxi driver, because she thinks that the business is profitable. Hence, she would like to borrow a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run a taxi. The other four borrowers are:
H., a motor taxi driver, is looking for a loan to use in his wife's business sewing clothes.
S. is a cloth preparer for a garment factory and she needs a loan to buy cloth to make doormats for sale.
H. sells Traditional Khmer cake and she requests a loan to buy the necessary ingredients for her business. 
N. works as a garment worker and she is seeking a loan to purchase a motor for riding to work. N. was not available for photographing so her husband's picture was taken instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband to run a taxi

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden L. is a single parent with two children. Playing the role of both mother and father requires great sacrifice according to Eden. She is 45-years old and maintains a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village to sustain her family.

Her eldest child, Denis, is 19-years old, a high school graduate, and now working as a factory worker in Manila. The younger is Maria, 7-years old and now in elementary school. They live peacefully in the rural area of Barangay San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. Eden is eager to give her children a good life. She works hard to earn a living so she can send her daughter to school and meet their needs.

Eden wants to borrow 5, 000 PHP from the lenders so that she can expand her business. She plans to restock the groceries that she offers to her customers, hopefully to increase her income. She hopes and prays that her loan will be granted and she promises to repay in due time and be a good client. She started her business three months ago and she really hopes to have sufficient capital for her business to grow.

loans.use: To buy stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Ángel Ernesto

texts.es: Ángel Ernesto R.  vive en el barrio Concepción ubicado en el departamento de San Vicente, Ángel de 24 años de edad es un joven muy luchador y trabajador, se dedica a la venta de zapatos en un local ubicado en San Vicente, los ingresos de sus ventas los utiliza para sus estudios de la universidad, y también para su familia; ya que vive con madre y abuela que solo cuentan con el apoyo de Ángel. Este crédito lo solicita para comprar nueva mercadería en zapatos y de esta manera  podrá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Angel R. Ernesto lives in the Concepcion neighborhood of the San Vicente department. Angel is 24 years old, and is a very young fighter and worker. He sells shoes in a room in San Vicente, and uses the revenues from his sales to support his studies at university and also to help support his family. He lives with his mother and grandmother, who only have Angel to count on. Angel is requesting this loan to buy new shoes and merchandise in order to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Tomaza

texts.en:
Mrs. Tomaza Cáceres is from the city of Carapeguá and lives in the Potrero district, 3 km from downtown. She is a single mother with two children. She dedicates herself to the sale of fine clothing for special occasions and clothing for men.

Mrs. Tomaza has been working in this field for more than 10 years and has a place in which she sells clothes in the middle of the Municipal market, where she has a good clientele.

The credit applied for was used to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.use: The purchase of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sunaya

texts.en:
Sunaya A. prepares and sells porridge. She sells by the lorry station in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. Sunaya buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Sunaya is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a butcher. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Sunaya's aspiration is to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Buuveibaatar

texts.en:
Buuveibaatar B. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughters are students in a local high school. Buuveibaatar has a small factory for half-processing animal intestines, which he purchases from local herders. Once intestines are half-processed, he transports them to sausage factories in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.

Buuveibaatar runs his factory with the help of his wife and two daughters. Since he started out in 2003, his factory has done well; his business capital has increased from 1,000,000 MNT to 3,800,000 MNT. Buuveibaatar is now requesting a loan to purchase more unprocessed intestines for his business. In the future, he hopes to put aside some of his profits for his daughters' university tuition.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed intestines

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 55 años, es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes y tienen sus propias familias. Ella vive sola en su casa propia. Hace 15 años empezó a trabajar como costurera, pero ahora ya es la administradora de su propio negocio, donde lleva un periodo de 2 años en su local propio. Luisa tiene una pequeña tienda de ropa y accesorios típicos de su región. Las prendas que vende son sólo para mujeres y son confeccionadas por otras personas que trabajan para ella. Lo que le gusta de esta labor es relacionarse con muchas personas, inclusive la visitan algunos artistas del medio del espectáculo local, quienes no dejan de probarse y tomarse fotos con sus prendas, lo que es una buena publicidad para su negocio. El deseo a futuro de Luisa es tener otras tiendas en diferentes lugares de su ciudad. Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos trabajan con mucha responsabilidad y ha hecho muy buenas amistades. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más materiales textiles para seguir confeccionando sus prendas.
texts.en:
Luisa is 55 years old. Her two children do not depend on her anymore and have their own families. She lives by herself in her own home. Luisa started working as a seamstress 15 years ago and now runs her own business, a small clothing shop, where she also sells traditional accessories from the region. She sells women’s apparel exclusively, made by people whom she hires. She likes what she does especially well because of the opportunity to meet many people. Local performance artists come to the shop to try on the clothing she sells and have their pictures taken, which is good publicity for the business. Her goal is to eventually own several stores in various parts of the city. This is the 4th loan she secures from MFP. She enjoys working with the communal bank because people there are very responsible and many have become good friends. Luisa will use the loan to buy textiles for new clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Badru's Group

texts.en: M. Badru is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a married man with 5 children with the eldest in Senior Two, while the rest are in the primary section. He has a butcher shop that he has been running for 20 years and he is able to make profits of 70,000/= a week. He believes that with the loan, he will be able to increase this amount. He has a business plan of buying preservers for meat for his businesses with the hope that he will make more money out of it. This is his first loan with the group and he hopes that with this loan, he will be able to buy more meat for resale.

loans.use: Buying more meat for resale

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth M. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Jenneth is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Jenneth owns and operates a business planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Jenneth has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jenneth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenneth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenneth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is twenty–four years old. He is single and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. 

Isaac is a mobile phone credit vendor and sometimes sells phone accessories. He sells on a table top under a tree in his community. Isaac has been in business for one year now and desires to expand his business. He sells credit for all kinds of networks.  He therefore wants a loan to buy more credits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phone credits and accessories

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, D. 48 años D. edad, es madre D. dos hijos mayores D. edad, cuenta con un taller D. costura pues se dedica al diseño y confección D. prendas D. vestir, este taller funciona en su propio domicilio.Ella trabaja con dos personas mas,cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo para desarrollar este trabajo. Es socia desD. hace siete años del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza”, su primer préstamo fue D. 300 soles,invirtió en la compra D. hilos, sierres, elásticos.
Con este préstamo D. 2000 soles, comprará telas, botones, hilos, blondas, piedras para decorar al por mayor, ya que ella trae D. la ciudad D. Lima . Su meta es comprarse una remalladora industrial y ampliar su taller D. costura.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de telas, botones, hilos, blondas, piedras para decorar las prendas

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: E. Chérifatou est née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Chérifatou réside depuis douze ans au quartier Sègbèya à Cotonou. Mariée à ZANNOU Félix, Chérifatou est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Félix seul. Chérifatou vend depuis sept ans de la nourriture (riz, pâté fait à base de farine de blé) et des divers (sucre, lait, savons, pâte alimentaire) à Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Chérifatou fait ses emplettes à Dantokpa, au marché international du Bénin.  Chérifatou a déjà obtenu deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé à ALIDé. Pour agrandir son étalage de divers et satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Chérifatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Chérifatou E. was born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Chérifatou has lived in the Sègbèya district of Cotonou for twelve years. Married to Félix Zannou, Chérifatou is the mother of four children, all of whom are in school. The household expenses are taken care of by Félix alone. For seven years, Chérifatou has been selling food products (rice, paste made from wheat flour) and various items (sugar, milk, soaps, food pastes) in Ayélawadjè in Cotonou. Chérifatou makes her purchases at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Chérifatou has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid them properly. To enlarge her selection of goods and better satisfy her customers, Chérifatou is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items (canned food, cartons of milk, food pastes, etc.), bags of rice, and maize

loans.name: Ful Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ful Maiya S. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region so the lives in this region are miserable. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Ful Maiya S. has 7 people, including herself, in her family. She lives in a single family with her husband and five children. She has one son and four daughters. Her son is studying in grade 11 and her daughters are studying in grades 10, 9 ,8 and 5 respectively.

Both Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Dhan Bahadur S. are engaged in agricultural farming. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Due to the hilly region they face lots of problem in their agricultural farming. Now Mrs. S. is requesting her first term loan of Rs 10,000.00 to buy fertilizers and seeds for their agricultural farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Felipa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Felipa habita en la comarca de villa Alvarez de Nueva Guinea, tiene 2 niños menores de edad, los cuales estudian la primaria en la comunidad de la comarca Los Monos de Villa Alvarez, se dedica a las actividades productivas del campo, requiere comprar 2 vacas paridas para aumentar su hato ganadero y poder logra mayor producción de leche y recibir mayor ingreso económico para de esta forma ayudar a mejorar la dieta alimenticia del núcleo familiar, ella comercializa su producción su producción a la planta procesadora Lacteos del Triunfo Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja en coordinación con ella en la actividad agropecuaria y agrícola, también él colabora en las actividades del hogar, Felipa es una mujer ejemplar, emprededora,  responsable, honesto, humilde, reconocida en la comarca, su mayor sueño es estar bien de salud y en el futuro dejar un buen inventario de ganado para sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones de vida para el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Ms. Felipa S. lives in the Villa Alvarez de Nueva Guinea region. She has two underage children who attend elementary school in the Los Monos de Villa Alvarez region. She works in agriculture and needs to purchase 2 recently calved cows so that she can increase the size of her herd, thus producing a greater amount of milk and obtaining bigger profits to help with her family expenses. She sells the milk to dairy processors in Triunfo Nueva Guinea. Her husband works with her in farming and agriculture, but he also collaborates with the household chores. Felipa is an exemplary, enterprising, responsible, honest and humble woman who is well-known in the area. Her greatest wish is to be healthy and to be able to leave a great amount of livestock for her children in the future, providing her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase recently calved cows for milk production

loans.name: Phang
